original: brtse ba la sogs pa'i yid kyi yon tan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa'i yid kyi yon tan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The mental qualities such as love are called ‚Äúinner qualities.‚Äù

original: 'di la dpe ni shing dag dang dngul chu zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la dpe ni shing dag dang dngul chu zhes bya ba ste / de rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The examples are ‚Äútrees‚Äù and ‚Äúquicksilver.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi yon tan 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yon tan 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of them is ‚Äúsome external qualities.‚Äù

original: yang 'bad rtsol la mi ltos pa kho na'i phyir goms pa las byung ba'i snying rje la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: yang 'bad rtsol la mi ltos pa kho na'i phyir goms pa las byung ba'i snying rje la sogs pa yang /
translated: Moreover, compassion, etc., which arise from cultivation, are not dependent on effort alone.

original: goms pa yang rang gi dang gis te /üîΩrang gi rgyu mtshan gyis yin par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: goms pa yang rang gi dang gis te / rang gi rgyu mtshan gyis yin par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: Cultivation is natural,

original: sems la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and the summary is ‚Äúin the mind.‚Äù

original: bde sogs zhes bya bas chos can rnams chos kyi khyad par dang ldan par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bde sogs zhes bya bas chos can rnams chos kyi khyad par dang ldan par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The subject is indicated by ‚Äúpleasure, etc.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'bad rtsol gzhan gyis bskyed bya'i khyad par gzhan ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i brjod bya yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bad rtsol gzhan gyis bskyed bya'i khyad par gzhan ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i brjod bya yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The other distinction that is to be produced by other effort is indicated by the expression ‚Äúnaturally flowing.‚Äù

original: yang nas yang du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang nas yang du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression ‚Äúagain and again‚Äù indicates

original: de goms pas ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de goms pas ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: that cultivation is the natural flow of that.

original: byas pa'i khyad par ni phul du byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag yin no ;
analyzed: byas pa'i khyad par ni phul du byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag yin no ;
translated: The difference in action is that they are the most excellent.

original: de rjes su 'jug pa'i khyad par yin yang /
analyzed: de rjes su 'jug pa'i khyad par yin yang /
translated: Although they are the difference in engagement,

original: mchongs pa la sogs pa rnam par ldog pa kho na yin nam de las bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mchongs pa la sogs pa rnam par ldog pa kho na yin nam de las bstan pa ni /
translated: is it only the case that jumping and so on are stopped?

original: de'i tshe snying rje la sogs pa'i khyad par byas zin par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe snying rje la sogs pa'i khyad par byas zin par brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement that compassion and so on are already produced at that time

original: gang gi tshe yang 'bad rtsol la mi ltos pa mchongs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang mtshan nyid mi @294b mthun pa'i khyad par bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang 'bad rtsol la mi ltos pa mchongs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang mtshan nyid mi @294b mthun pa'i khyad par bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: teaches that the difference in characteristics that is not dependent on effort is the difference in jumping and so on.

original: khyad par tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not just the difference.

original: khyad par 'di la ltos pa yin na 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par 'di la ltos pa yin na 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that this is the case when there is dependence on this difference

original: rtsol ba gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is ‚Äúthe effort is different.‚Äù

original: gal te khyad par 'di nyid goms pa'i bskyed bya la khyad par med na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par 'di nyid goms pa'i bskyed bya la khyad par med na /
translated: If there is no difference in the product of the cultivation of this very difference,

original: 'di ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yin /
translated: how is this?

original: rgyu la khyad par med na 'bras bu la khyad par med do snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩgal te mchongs pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu la khyad par med na 'bras bu la khyad par med do snyam du sems pa ni / gal te mchongs pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If there is no difference in the cause, there is no difference in the effect.üîΩIf there were no difference in the effect, then even a small effort would bring about the desired result.

original: goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par yin yang /
analyzed: goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par yin yang /
translated: Even though there is a difference in what is produced by practice,

original: khyad par dag la yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa dang mi ltos pa chos can la gnas pa nyid kyis khyad par che ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par dag la yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa dang mi ltos pa chos can la gnas pa nyid kyis khyad par che ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: it is taught that there is a great difference in the basis, the person, in terms of whether or not they rely on effort.

original: 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa'i khyad par ni 'phel ba yin yang chu bskol ba bzhin du shin tu 'phel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa'i khyad par ni 'phel ba yin yang chu bskol ba bzhin du shin tu 'phel ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though the difference that relies on effort increases, it does not increase greatly, like boiling water.

original: rten dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyis rang nyid kho na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: rten dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyis rang nyid kho na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: Because it is an effect that is incompatible with its basis, it itself is destroyed.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The summary of this is stated in the line ‚ÄúTherefore‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rten brtan pa'i phyir 'phel ba'i khyad par ni rten dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: rten brtan pa'i phyir 'phel ba'i khyad par ni rten dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Because the basis is stable, the difference that increases is not an effect that is incompatible with its basis.

original: de'i phyir shin tu 'phel ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu 'phel ba kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is only a very great increase,

original: khyad par gyi rgyu dang rten ma 'gal ba'i phyir dang / khyad par la yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rgyu dang rten ma 'gal ba'i phyir dang / khyad par la yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause and support of the distinction are not contradictory, and because the distinction does not depend on exertion.

original: da ni snying rje la sogs pa'i chos kho na phul du byung ba'i ming can ni goms pa'i bskyed bya yin gyi chos can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni snying rje la sogs pa'i chos kho na phul du byung ba'i ming can ni goms pa'i bskyed bya yin gyi chos can ni ma yin te /
translated: Now, the dharmas such as compassion, which are called ‚Äúsupreme,‚Äù are the products of cultivation, not the possessors of the dharmas,

original: rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i phyir dang de kho na nyid bzhin du phul du byung ba'i gnas skabs mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i phyir dang de kho na nyid bzhin du phul du byung ba'i gnas skabs mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from one‚Äôs own continuum and because one sees the supreme state as it really is.

original: mchongs pa la sogs pa'i chos can yang 'bad rtsol med na mi srid par bstan pa ni gang phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mchongs pa la sogs pa'i chos can yang 'bad rtsol med na mi srid par bstan pa ni gang phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching that the possessors of the dharmas such as jumping are not possible without exertion is ‚Äúbecause . . .

original: rigs mthun pa'i sngar gyi sa bon las byung ba nyid 'bad rtsol nyid kyis bskyed bya nyid sel bar byed pas yul gyi phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa la ltos pa'i yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i sngar gyi sa bon las byung ba nyid 'bad rtsol nyid kyis bskyed bya nyid sel bar byed pas yul gyi phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa la ltos pa'i yin no //
translated: ‚Äù The arising from a previous seed of a similar type is itself produced by exertion, and it is eliminated by exertion. Therefore, it depends on the benefit of the object, etc.

original: de'i phyir chos la mi dmigs pa la sogs pa nyid kyis snying rje la sogs pa rab tu 'jug pa brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos la mi dmigs pa la sogs pa nyid kyis snying rje la sogs pa rab tu 'jug pa brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement of this is:

original: yul nye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul nye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object is not near, etc.‚Äù

original: de la dmigs pa nyid ni da dung yang snang ba nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa nyid ni da dung yang snang ba nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the very non-apprehension of the object is still the appearance is:

original: dran pa dang thos sogs kyis kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang thos sogs kyis kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy memory, hearing, etc. also.‚Äù

original: dran pa la sogs pa'i mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa'i mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of memory, etc.

original: dngos por mi snang phyir rnam rtog ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos por mi snang phyir rnam rtog ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: is taught as ‚Äúconceptualization‚Äù because it does not appear as a thing.

original: yul la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /üîΩmi mthun pa'i @295a * //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te / mi mthun pa'i @295a * //
translated: It is not only independent of the object, etc.

original: phyogs kyis kyang bzlog bya ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs kyis kyang bzlog bya ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that it is not to be averted by adverse elements is:

original: de'i zhing du byas pa dag ces bya ba'o //üîΩrgyas pa las gzhan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i zhing du byas pa dag ces bya ba'o // rgyas pa las gzhan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving made that the field.‚ÄùüîΩOther than extension

original: rgyas pa la ma yin pa ste gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la ma yin pa ste gzhan pa'o //
translated: is not extension, i.e., other.

original: de kho na gzhan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de kho na gzhan pa nyid yin te /
translated: That is just otherness.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi gsal bar byas pa'i phyir dang / goms pa'i yul la sogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir zhan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi gsal bar byas pa'i phyir dang / goms pa'i yul la sogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir zhan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not weak because it is not obscured by adverse factors and because it does not depend on the object of meditation, etc.

original: 'di ltar sems can dang chos dad mi dmigs pa'i snying rje rnams ni so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin par 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can dang chos dad mi dmigs pa'i snying rje rnams ni so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin par 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, compassion that does not take sentient beings and things as its objects is established as belonging to ordinary beings, ƒÅryas, and bodhisattvas, respectively.

original: mchongs pa yang rang gi sa bon las byung ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: mchongs pa yang rang gi sa bon las byung ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt jumping also produced from its own seed?

original: goms pa ni phul du byung ba kho na la snying rje la sogs pa bzhin du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: goms pa ni phul du byung ba kho na la snying rje la sogs pa bzhin du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: We think that it is only the extraordinary that is produced by meditation, as is the case with compassion, etc.

original: ji ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If you think that, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:üîΩJumping is produced from jumping.

original: mchongs pa ni mchongs pas byung ba ni yin te stobs dang 'bad rtsol las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mchongs pa ni mchongs pas byung ba ni yin te stobs dang 'bad rtsol las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that jumping is produced from jumping because it is produced from strength and effort.

original: de ltar mchod nyid las mchongs min //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mchod nyid las mchongs min //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: Jumping is not produced from jumping.

original: stobs las sam 'bad rtsol las byung ba ni goms pas shin tu phul du byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: stobs las sam 'bad rtsol las byung ba ni goms pas shin tu phul du byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Does not the power or exertion arise from practice?

original: de rgyu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rgyu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is:

original: gnas pa'i nus nyid yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas pa'i nus nyid yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is the cause of that, because it is the potentiality of the abiding.

original: goms pa'am gzhan yang rung de'i rang bzhin gyis mchong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: goms pa'am gzhan yang rung de'i rang bzhin gyis mchong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the result of the abiding, but it is not the case that the jumping is by the nature of that practice or something else.

original: goms pa ni stobs kyi rang bzhin kho na la brten pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: goms pa ni stobs kyi rang bzhin kho na la brten pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that practice is based only on the nature of power is:

original: rang gis mchongs pa goms par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gis mchongs pa goms par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The jumping by one‚Äôs own power is the practice.

original: goms pa yod pa'i mchongs pa gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: goms pa yod pa'i mchongs pa gang yin pa ni /
translated: The jumping that exists in practice

original: snga rol de stobs yod kyang med pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni ji ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snga rol de stobs yod kyang med pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni ji ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: is not the power that existed before, is it?

original: sngar gyi stobs bad kan la sogs pas lus lci ba la sogs pas nye bar gnod pa yin la goms pas ni nye bar gnod pa med par byed pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sngar gyi stobs bad kan la sogs pas lus lci ba la sogs pas nye bar gnod pa yin la goms pas ni nye bar gnod pa med par byed pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the power that existed before is harmed by the heaviness of the body due to phlegm and so on, and that practice removes the harm is:

original: de ni dang po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dang po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is called the first.

original: gal te stobs rang gi sa bon tsam las byung bar 'bad rtsol med par phul du byung ba'i snyad rjer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te stobs rang gi sa bon tsam las byung bar 'bad rtsol med par phul du byung ba'i snyad rjer 'gyur ro //
translated: If the power arises from its own seed without effort, it is called ‚Äúexcellent.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: If you think that the non-observation of an effect

original: rgyu'i tshogs pa med par go bar byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs pa med par go bar byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: makes one understand the absence of a collection of causes,

original: gal te brtse ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te brtse ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is the same for compassion and so on.

original: de'i tshe de'i bdag nyid du yang zhes yang gi sgra rim las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i bdag nyid du yang zhes yang gi sgra rim las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: At that time, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in ‚Äúit is also like that‚Äù is reversed from the order.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rten brtan pa yang @295b yin na yin gyi gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten brtan pa yang @295b yin na yin gyi gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: If the basis is stable, it is so, but not at another time.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su byed pa la goms pa las rtogs pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo las ni ma yin zhes ci las rtogs pa yin zhes /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su byed pa la goms pa las rtogs pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo las ni ma yin zhes ci las rtogs pa yin zhes /
translated: From the practice of making it an opposing factor, it is understood, but not from its own nature. What is the understanding?

original: 'di ltar goms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar goms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In this way, it is said that ‚Äúpractice‚Äù and so on.

original: gsal ba ni bya ba la phul du byung ba goms pa gang yin pa de snga ma snga ma ni phyi ma phyi ma'i snying rje la sogs pa'i rtsa ba yin te snga ma'i rang gi rigs kyi sa bon nyid med na /üîΩgoms pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal ba ni bya ba la phul du byung ba goms pa gang yin pa de snga ma snga ma ni phyi ma phyi ma'i snying rje la sogs pa'i rtsa ba yin te snga ma'i rang gi rigs kyi sa bon nyid med na / goms pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that without the seed of one's own kind, there is no cultivation.

original: snga ma'i rang gi rigs las byung ba yin na goms par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma'i rang gi rigs las byung ba yin na goms par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that it arises from one's own kind and becomes cultivated is

original: brtse ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the statement beginning with affection, etc.

original: de yang gang la 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang la 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is it?

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is clarity.

original: skye ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not birth.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i goms pa phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i goms pa phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in this way, compassion is taught to be the nature of mind itself because of the excellence of cultivation that arises from its own seed.üîΩThe statement beginning with therefore

original: snying rje ni sems kyi rang bzhin kho na yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩdes na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje ni sems kyi rang bzhin kho na yin par bstan pa ni / des na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is the teaching that compassion is the nature of mind itself.

original: rang gi don zhes bya bas gegs byed pa med pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don zhes bya bas gegs byed pa med pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The statement beginning with one's own purpose is the holding of the absence of obstruction as supreme.

original: rang gi sa bon las byung ba nyid ces bya bas goms pas phul du byung ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las byung ba nyid ces bya bas goms pas phul du byung ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase arising from their own seeds indicates that they are perfected by cultivation.

original: 'di nyid ni tshad ma kun las btus pa la sogs pa la 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid kyi bsam pas dgongs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin par bstan to ;
analyzed: 'di nyid ni tshad ma kun las btus pa la sogs pa la 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid kyi bsam pas dgongs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin par bstan to ;
translated: This very [perfection of intention] is taught in the Compendium of Valid Cognition and so forth as the perfection of intention due to the wish to benefit migrating beings.

original: shin tu goms pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shin tu goms pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that they apply in accordance with their intention teaches that they are very familiar.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus refers to the above.

original: thugs rje phul byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brtse ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje phul byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brtse ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa'o //
translated: Having excellent compassion and so forth explains having love.

original: sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to destroy suffering is for the purpose of destroying one's own and others' suffering.

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa sngon du byed pa kho na snying rje dang ldan pa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa sngon du byed pa kho na snying rje dang ldan pa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it only suitable for the compassionate one to prioritize destroying others' suffering?

original: rang gi sdug bsngal gzhom pa mngon du byed pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal gzhom pa mngon du byed pa ni /
translated: The manifestation of the destruction of one's own suffering

original: de lta bu'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not like that, because of the absence of such a thought.

original: rang gi sdug bsngal gzhom pa mngon du byed pa yang /
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal gzhom pa mngon du byed pa yang /
translated: The manifestation of the destruction of one's own suffering

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa mngon du byed pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa mngon du byed pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar dgongs pa yin te /
translated: is the means of manifesting the destruction of the suffering of others, and so it is certainly intended,

original: de med na de nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩldog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de med na de nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / ldog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because without that, that would not exist.üîΩThe explanation of that is:üîΩThe reversal of that is the manifestation of the means and its cause.

original: thabs dang de'i rgyu mngon du byed pa pos de bshad pa ni shin tu bla bar mtho ris dang byang grol zhes bya ba'o //üîΩmtho ris kyi @296a * //
analyzed: thabs dang de'i rgyu mngon du byed pa pos de bshad pa ni shin tu bla bar mtho ris dang byang grol zhes bya ba'o // mtho ris kyi @296a * //
translated: The path to heaven and liberation is the explanation of that.üîΩThe path to heaven

original: lam mngon du ma byas pa ni /üîΩchad par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lam mngon du ma byas pa ni / chad par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: is not manifestedüîΩbecause it is not possible to cut off the object of inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: de la ni des zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la ni des zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In that, by that.

original: rjes su dpag pas yongs su nges pa'i de kho na nyid yod pa la sogs pas skad cig ma nyid la sogs par nges pa yin na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas yongs su nges pa'i de kho na nyid yod pa la sogs pas skad cig ma nyid la sogs par nges pa yin na /
translated: If one ascertains momentariness, etc. by inference, then one ascertains the reality that is ascertained by inference, etc.

original: rang gi don ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: One‚Äôs own purpose is inference.

original: 'dod pa ni byed pa ste de'i dus na med pa ni ston pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni byed pa ste de'i dus na med pa ni ston pa med pa'o //
translated: Desire is activity. When it does not exist, it is not taught.

original: ji tsam du zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam du zhe na /
translated: How much?

original: thams cad kyi tshe ni ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe ni ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should add ‚Äúnot at all times.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo ston pa ni /
translated: The nature of inference for the sake of others is taught.

original: rang gi sngon du 'gro ba can yin na /
analyzed: rang gi sngon du 'gro ba can yin na /
translated: If it has a prior antecedent,

original: de'i tshe gdul bya nye ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gdul bya nye ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then at that time, even the disciples are not near,

original: rang nyid ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not ascertained themselves.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa'i thabs las byung ba dang / de'i rgyu'i skyon ni 'di ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa'i thabs las byung ba dang / de'i rgyu'i skyon ni 'di ma yin te /
translated: The method of the non-occult and the fault of its cause are not this.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha las brtsams nas khyad par thams cad mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha las brtsams nas khyad par thams cad mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all distinctions are manifest, beginning with the factors conducive to penetration.

original: rjes sud pag pas khyad par thams cad nges ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes sud pag pas khyad par thams cad nges ba yang ma yin te /
translated: All distinctions are not ascertained by inference.

original: mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be directly perceptible.

original: thabs byung de rgyu lkog tu gyur pa la skyon gzhan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thabs byung de rgyu lkog tu gyur pa la skyon gzhan bstan pa ni /
translated: Another error is shown in the following verse, with regard to the hidden cause of the effect.

original: dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pa na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pa na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist when one is born in the hells and so on.

original: 'bras bu mngon du byed pa ni dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dus thams cad du ston par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon du byed pa ni dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dus thams cad du ston par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one actualizes the effect, one would always manifest it, because one would not go to the hells and so on.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not be otherwise.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gzhom pa mngon du byed pas 'khrugs pa ma yin pa nyid med na dran pa goms pa'i yid kyi gsal ba nyid dang bral ba'i phyir sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa med pa yin na so sor nges pa'i las kyi
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gzhom pa mngon du byed pas 'khrugs pa ma yin pa nyid med na dran pa goms pa'i yid kyi gsal ba nyid dang bral ba'i phyir sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa med pa yin na so sor nges pa'i las kyi
translated: Similarly, if there were no non-agitation, which is the actualization of the destruction of suffering, then there would be no knowledge of the recollection of past lives, because it would be devoid of the clarity of the mind that is habituated to mindfulness.

original: 'bras bu ston pa ma yin la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par ma nges pas rnam pa thams cad pa'i dngos po thams cad mngon du byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir 'od zer can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams la sogs pa'i srung gtam ston
analyzed: 'bras bu ston pa ma yin la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par ma nges pas rnam pa thams cad pa'i dngos po thams cad mngon du byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir 'od zer can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams la sogs pa'i srung gtam ston
translated: It does not reveal the result and it is impossible to manifest all things in all aspects because the specific nature of the result and cause is not ascertained.üîΩüîΩTherefore it reveals the protection wheel of the world of Marici and so on.üîΩ

original: par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it does not show the result, and because the distinction of the nature of the result and cause is not ascertained, it is impossible to manifest all things in every way, therefore, it does not show the protection of the world system of Marici, etc.

original: bstan pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching is called the world system.

original: de bas na thams cad ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa bzhin du rang gi sdug bsngal gzhom pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa bzhin du rang gi sdug bsngal gzhom pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, all means that just as one conquers the suffering of others, so one conquers one's own suffering.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In that regard means

original: sdug bsngal gzhom pa dang de'i rgyu mngon du byed pa dag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhom pa dang de'i rgyu mngon du byed pa dag go //
translated: in conquering suffering and manifesting its cause.

original: rgyu ni thabs yin te de bzhin du sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal @296b gzhom pa de'i rgyu mngon du byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir zhes bya bas bshad pa yin te sdug bsngal gzhom pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: rgyu ni thabs yin te de bzhin du sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal @296b gzhom pa de'i rgyu mngon du byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir zhes bya bas bshad pa yin te sdug bsngal gzhom pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro
translated: The cause is the means.  Thus, ‚Äúin order to destroy suffering‚Äù is explained as ‚Äúin order to manifest the cause of that destruction of suffering,‚Äù because the destruction of suffering is the illustrated meaning.

original: // de nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu dang yul las so //
analyzed: // de nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu dang yul las so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means from the cause and the object.

original: de la rgyu ni lung dang rigs pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni lung dang rigs pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Regarding that, the cause is scripture and reasoning.

original: rigs pas ni rigs pa dang mi rigs pa nyid shes pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs pas ni rigs pa dang mi rigs pa nyid shes pa yin la /
translated: Reasoning is the knowledge of what is reasonable and unreasonable.

original: lung gis ni las kyi lam ste /
analyzed: lung gis ni las kyi lam ste /
translated: Scripture is the path of action,

original: 'di byas nas 'di byas pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di byas nas 'di byas pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: saying ‚Äúhaving done this, one does that.‚Äù

original: rigs pa las gzhan pa ni lung yin te de 'dzin par bstan pas sgra rnams ni don la mi rigs pa nyid du yang 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa las gzhan pa ni lung yin te de 'dzin par bstan pas sgra rnams ni don la mi rigs pa nyid du yang 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Scripture is different from reasoning, because it is taught to apprehend that.  By this, the words are also taught to be unreasonable with regard to the meaning.

original: lam yang rigs pa kho na ma yin nam ma mthong ba de'i chos yod pas go bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam yang rigs pa kho na ma yin nam ma mthong ba de'i chos yod pas go bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the path also just reasoning?  Because it is not possible to understand the existence of that phenomenon which is not seen,

original: de yang de la tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang de la tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not a valid cognition.

original: de 'di ltar rigs pa dang lung dang lhan cig pa 'jug pa'i yul du nges par byed pa yin gyi re re ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'di ltar rigs pa dang lung dang lhan cig pa 'jug pa'i yul du nges par byed pa yin gyi re re ni ma yin no //
translated: It is a means of ascertaining the object of engagement, which is in agreement with reasoning and scripture, but not each of them individually.

original: gang gi phyir yul med pa ni rigs pa ma yin la yul yang rigs pa dang bral ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul med pa ni rigs pa ma yin la yul yang rigs pa dang bral ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not reasonable for there to be an object that is not [in agreement with reasoning and scripture], and an object that is devoid of reasoning is also not [a valid object].

original: des de ltar spyi nyid la 'dzin pa rnam par dpyad pa bstan nas snga ma gang yin pa dang / phyi ma gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des de ltar spyi nyid la 'dzin pa rnam par dpyad pa bstan nas snga ma gang yin pa dang / phyi ma gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis bstan pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the analysis of the apprehension of universals, he teaches by way of the distinction between what is prior and what is subsequent:

original: sdug bsngal rgyu dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of suffering, etc.

original: de med na rgyu med pa can gyi sdug bsngal de gzhom pa'i don gyi 'bad rtsol nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i yan lag tu dang po rgyu yongs su rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de med na rgyu med pa can gyi sdug bsngal de gzhom pa'i don gyi 'bad rtsol nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i yan lag tu dang po rgyu yongs su rtogs pa yin no //
translated: When that does not exist, since the exertion for the purpose of destroying that causeless suffering would not occur, the first understanding of the cause is a limb of engagement.

original: de'i rjes la yongs su rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes la yongs su rtogs pa ni /
translated: After that, the understanding is

original: de'i zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i'o //
translated: of that, i.e., the cause.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la snga ma bzhin du phyin ci log pas rgyu ma tshang ba med pa la gzhom pa nyid du mi nus pas mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la snga ma bzhin du phyin ci log pas rgyu ma tshang ba med pa la gzhom pa nyid du mi nus pas mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of impermanence, it is impossible to overcome the cause of error, as it was in the case of the previous example, and so it is impossible for the error to cease.

original: gnyis po ci las rtogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis po ci las rtogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: From what are the two known?

original: sdug bsngal nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy the fact of suffering.‚Äù

original: res 'ga' ba'i sdug bsngal ni /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba'i sdug bsngal ni /
translated: The suffering that is occasional

original: rgyu dang de'i mi rtag pa yang go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang de'i mi rtag pa yang go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: makes known its cause and its impermanence.

original: de ma thag pa shin tu sbyor bar byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ma thag pa shin tu sbyor bar byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The fact that this is not an immediate application is indicated by

original: 'di thams cad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúall of this.‚Äù

original: tshad ma can gyi lus la yang tshad ma de yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'grel bar ni rigs pa'i yul ma yin pa bsdu pa'i don du lung 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: tshad ma can gyi lus la yang tshad ma de yin pa'i phyir ro // 'grel bar ni rigs pa'i yul ma yin pa bsdu pa'i don du lung 'dzin pa yin /
translated: The measure of the body is the same as the measure of the world.üîΩIn the commentary, the citation of scripture is for the purpose of including what is not a proper object of reasoning.

original: lung 'dzin pa ni rigs pa las 'jug pa'i don du'am zhes bya ba la sogs par rjod par byed par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: lung 'dzin pa ni rigs pa las 'jug pa'i don du'am zhes bya ba la sogs par rjod par byed par gsal ba yin no //
translated: The citation of scripture is for the purpose of engaging in reasoning, as it is said, ‚ÄúThe world is not a proper object of reasoning.‚Äù

original: rnam par dpyod pa la mngon du phyogs pa ma yin pa ni rigs pa mthong yang shin tu sbyor bar byed pa ma @297a * //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa la mngon du phyogs pa ma yin pa ni rigs pa mthong yang shin tu sbyor bar byed pa ma @297a * //
translated: One who is not inclined to investigate, even though he sees the reasoning, is not one who applies himself to the task.

original: yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that he is not one who applies himself to the task is:

original: 'di thams cad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll of this is . . .

original: tshad ma can gyi yul la yang tshad ma de mi 'thob na go bar byed pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la ma rmongs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshad ma can gyi yul la yang tshad ma de mi 'thob na go bar byed pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la ma rmongs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äù If one thinks that even in the case of a valid object, the valid cognition is not obtained, then the statement, ‚Äúnot in the case of one who is not confused‚Äù is supplied.

original: ci sngar ram phyis kyang yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci sngar ram phyis kyang yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúIs it prior to or subsequent to the investigation?‚Äù

original: khyad par du yongs su rtog pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par du yongs su rtog pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that it is a special investigation is:

original: de la re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that regard, first . . .

original: rgyu'am de'i mi rtag pa yongs su ma brtags na 'di ldog par rung ba ni 'jug pa la khyab par bya ba 'gal ba yin la mi 'jug par rung ba nyid rgyu med pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'am de'i mi rtag pa yongs su ma brtags na 'di ldog par rung ba ni 'jug pa la khyab par bya ba 'gal ba yin la mi 'jug par rung ba nyid rgyu med pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äù If the cause or its impermanence is not investigated, it is possible that this will be reversed, and the pervasion of the engagement is contradicted. It is possible that there is no engagement, and that is the cause.

original: rgyu med pa nyid kyi ngo bo dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid kyi ngo bo dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the nature of the cause is observed is:üîΩ‚ÄúThe cause . . .

original: rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúwithout a cause‚Äù is said.

original: gal te dngos po skad cig ma rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa can yin gyi de bzhin du rgyun ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po skad cig ma rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa can yin gyi de bzhin du rgyun ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If a thing is momentary, it is destroyed by its very nature, but not so a continuum.

original: rgyu dang bral ba med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúwithout separation from its cause‚Äù is said.

original: rgyu rtag pa las kyang lan cig skyes pa ni rang gi ngo bo kho na 'jig pa ma yin nam gang gi phyir rtag pa yang 'di de kho na'i skyed byed ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rtag pa las kyang lan cig skyes pa ni rang gi ngo bo kho na 'jig pa ma yin nam gang gi phyir rtag pa yang 'di de kho na'i skyed byed ma yin te /
translated: If it is produced from a permanent cause, is it not the case that what is produced is destroyed by its very nature? Why is it not produced again? Because it is permanent.

original: skyes par bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: skyes par bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If it is thought that it is not the producer of that,

original: rgyu yis byas pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu yis byas pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúbecause it is produced by a cause‚Äù is said.

original: gal te skyes pa yin yang de dang 'dra ba gzhan ni rgyu yod na 'jug pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te skyes pa yin yang de dang 'dra ba gzhan ni rgyu yod na 'jug pa kho na yin no //
translated: If it is produced, it is just like another that is produced when there is a cause.

original: gal te med pa kho nas de med par 'gyur zhes ci las yin /
analyzed: gal te med pa kho nas de med par 'gyur zhes ci las yin /
translated: If it is not produced, why is it not the case that it is not produced because it does not exist?

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa med kyang bum pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa med kyang bum pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: A pot, etc. is not non-existent even when a potter, etc. does not exist.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: gal te de med kyang yod na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te de med kyang yod na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it exists even when it does not exist‚Äù is said.

original: rdza mkhan gyi de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skad cig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skad cig ma yin gyi /
translated: The potter's is the moment immediately following its production.

original: phyi ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma ni ma yin te /
translated: The latter is not.

original: skad cig ma snga ma rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the former moment is the cause.

original: rgyu med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni mi rtag pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩrtag pa'i rgyu can la rgyu med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni mi rtag pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // rtag pa'i rgyu can la rgyu med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the qualities that are the opposites of the faults that were mentioned beginning with causelessness is having a cause that is impermanent, and so forth.

original: rtag tu rgyu can la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyu can la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that what has a permanent cause is taught to be causeless is having a cause that is permanent.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩldog pa yod ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na / ldog pa yod ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the consequence of that?üîΩThere is no cessation.

original: ldog pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no cessation.

original: ma bral ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrtag tu rgyu can la zhes bya ba 'dis yin pa de'i yang rgyu gang yin /
analyzed: ma bral ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to // rtag tu rgyu can la zhes bya ba 'dis yin pa de'i yang rgyu gang yin /
translated: The meaning is that it is not separated.üîΩHaving a cause that is permanent means that it has a cause that is permanent.

original: de la ni med pa med do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la ni med pa med do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: That which is permanent has no cause is to be supplied.

original: mi rtag pa'i rgyu can yin yang rgyu rang nyid kho nas 'jig pa'i phyir de'i don du rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi bya ba 'bras bu med pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rgyu can yin yang rgyu rang nyid kho nas 'jig pa'i phyir de'i don du rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi bya ba 'bras bu med pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Although impermanence is the cause, since the cause itself is destroyed, those who are endowed with imagination think that the activity is indeed fruitless for that purpose.

original: gang phyir de ltar rgyu gnas na //
analyzed: gang phyir de ltar rgyu gnas na //
translated: Since the cause remains in that way,

original: @297b zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: @297b zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said.

original: de ltar gnas pa ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa 'am bag chags kyi ngo bos gnas pa na'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa 'am bag chags kyi ngo bos gnas pa na'o //
translated: Thus, remaining is remaining by the continuity of engagement or by the nature of habitual tendencies.

original: 'bras bu ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The result is suffering.

original: log pa med ces bya bar dgongs nas rgyu'i rgyun nam bag chags ldog pa'i don du 'bad rtsol ni rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: log pa med ces bya bar dgongs nas rgyu'i rgyun nam bag chags ldog pa'i don du 'bad rtsol ni rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Thinking that there is no cessation, it is only reasonable to strive for the purpose of reversing the continuum of the cause or habitual tendencies.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni de ltar gnas na zhes bya brgyu rtag pa yin na'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni de ltar gnas na zhes bya brgyu rtag pa yin na'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The author of the commentary explains that if it remains in that way, the cause is permanent.

original: de yang rgyu'i rgyun nam bag chags kyang rung ba 'gal ba can gyi lam med na /
analyzed: de yang rgyu'i rgyun nam bag chags kyang rung ba 'gal ba can gyi lam med na /
translated: Moreover, if there is no path that is contradictory to either the continuum of the cause or habitual tendencies,

original: mi ldog pa yin pa'i phyir de'i 'gal ba'i phyogs kyi lam shes pa yin la de yang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo kho na rtog pa las shes par bla bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi ldog pa yin pa'i phyir de'i 'gal ba'i phyogs kyi lam shes pa yin la de yang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo kho na rtog pa las shes par bla bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is irreversible, it is the path that is the opposite of that. And that is taught to be known from the mere nature of the cause.

original: de rgyu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de rgyu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, That cause...

original: snyam pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snyam pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Endowed with the mind that thinks...

original: de lta'i rigs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta'i rigs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: means endowed with that kind of reasoning.

original: rtag pa'i rgyu can gyi sdug bsngal la de ltar dgongs pa yin gyi mi rtag pa'i rgyu can la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa'i rgyu can gyi sdug bsngal la de ltar dgongs pa yin gyi mi rtag pa'i rgyu can la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that suffering that has a permanent cause is intended in this way, but not that which has an impermanent cause.

original: rgyu 'jig pa ni 'gal ba can med na ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu 'jig pa ni 'gal ba can med na ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The destruction of the cause is taught to be incompatible, not without it.

original: byung ba zhes bya ba rgyun gyis 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: byung ba zhes bya ba rgyun gyis 'jug pa yin te /
translated: What is called arisen is the engagement by continuity.

original: grang ba la dro ba bzhin no //üîΩ'di'i yang phyi rol nyid du cung zad 'gal ba can du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: grang ba la dro ba bzhin no // 'di'i yang phyi rol nyid du cung zad 'gal ba can du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Like heat for cold.

original: rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking that this is also slightly incompatible with external things, he says, It is not without a cause.

original: skye ba'i rgyu ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu ma yin nam de yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gis byas pa yin la /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu ma yin nam de yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gis byas pa yin la /
translated: Is not the cause of birth the cause of virtue and nonvirtue? And that is done by attachment and aversion.

original: rgod par byed pa la sogs pa'i rnam rtog gis byas pa yin na /
analyzed: rgod par byed pa la sogs pa'i rnam rtog gis byas pa yin na /
translated: And that is done by discursive thought such as excitement.

original: kun tu rtog pa de ldog na de las byung ba'i chags pa la sogs pa ldog pa yin la de las kyang /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa de ldog na de las byung ba'i chags pa la sogs pa ldog pa yin la de las kyang /
translated: If one stops discursive thought, attachment and so on that arise from it stop.

original: de'i las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i las ldog pa yin no //
translated: And from that, its action stops.üîΩAnd since action also ceases when its effect arises, one is said to be liberated from all suffering by the exhaustion of action.

original: de ltar ba'i las kyang 'bras bu byung na zad pa yin pa'i phyir las zad bas ni sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par grol bar brjod pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar ba'i las kyang 'bras bu byung na zad pa yin pa'i phyir las zad bas ni sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par grol bar brjod pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that, it says:

original: gal te rgyu med pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that suffering arises without a cause, that is not tenable.

original: bdag tu lta ba yod na rang la chags pa dang ldan pa ni bdag gi lus la sogs pa la chags par byed pa'i byir chags pa de nyid rgod par byed pa'i kun tu rtog pa ma yin pa dang las kyi rgyu can ni /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba yod na rang la chags pa dang ldan pa ni bdag gi lus la sogs pa la chags par byed pa'i byir chags pa de nyid rgod par byed pa'i kun tu rtog pa ma yin pa dang las kyi rgyu can ni /
translated: If the view of self exists, one who possesses attachment to self makes attachment to self arise with regard to one‚Äôs body and so on. That attachment itself is not discursive thought that causes excitement. Action that has a cause

original: bdag tu rtog pa dang ma bral ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu rtog pa dang ma bral ba yin no //
translated: and one is not free from the conception of self.

original: de'i tshe las gzhan dang gzhan yin gyi sdug bsngal grol ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe las gzhan dang gzhan yin gyi sdug bsngal grol ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that at that time, the other actions are not the cause of suffering is:

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: ma rig pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because of ignorance.

original: sdug bsngal phyin ci log blo dang // sred pa kun nas 'ching ba ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyin ci log blo dang // sred pa kun nas 'ching ba ni //
translated: The teaching of the reasoning that the cause of suffering is the error of the idea of pleasure, the bondage of craving,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: and so on is:

original: @298a * // las dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni ma rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @298a * // las dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni ma rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of action and suffering is called ignorance.

original: bde ba dang dge ba la sogs pa mthong ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang dge ba la sogs pa mthong ba ni /
translated: The seeing of pleasure, virtue, and so on is:

original: ma rig pa dang las kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin par bde ba las bzlog ba sdug bsngal la sogs par mthong ba ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang las kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin par bde ba las bzlog ba sdug bsngal la sogs par mthong ba ni /
translated: The seeing of suffering, and so on, which is the opposite of pleasure, is not the cause of suffering through ignorance and action.

original: gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o ;
analyzed: gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o ;
translated: This is the antidote.

original: / gzhan dag na re rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag gzhan yin par ma mthong ba ni /
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag gzhan yin par ma mthong ba ni /
translated: Others say that the seeing of the intrinsic reality and the person as different is:

original: las las yin pas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin zhing bdag dang bdag ma yin pa dag gi rnam par dbye ba dag la mthong ba ni 'ching ba yin la /üîΩdbye ba mthong ba ni de'i gnyen po yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩde ltar rgyu'i ngo bo la log par rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: las las yin pas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin zhing bdag dang bdag ma yin pa dag gi rnam par dbye ba dag la mthong ba ni 'ching ba yin la / dbye ba mthong ba ni de'i gnyen po yin no zhes zer ro // de ltar rgyu'i ngo bo la log par rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If the view of the cause of suffering is a misconception,

original: de'i gnyen po yang nges par gnas pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩgal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yang nges par gnas pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni / gal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then its antidote is not a definite state.üîΩIf the cause of suffering is the view of self and what belongs to a self,üîΩthen the view of the various distinctions is also the cause of the various distinctions of suffering.üîΩThe antidote to that is the view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self.

original: mthong ba yang sna tshogs par mthong ba nyid kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu sna tshogs pa las yin no zhes zer ba ni /üîΩsdug pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste bzlog par bya ba ni rgyu zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mthong ba yang sna tshogs par mthong ba nyid kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu sna tshogs pa las yin no zhes zer ba ni / sdug pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste bzlog par bya ba ni rgyu zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.

original: bdag ces bya ba nyid dang / bdag gi zhes bya ba nyid kyang chags pa'i gzhi nyid yin te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba nyid dang / bdag gi zhes bya ba nyid kyang chags pa'i gzhi nyid yin te /
translated: The view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a self.üîΩThe view of the non-distinction of self and what belongs to a self is the antidote to the view of self and what belongs to a

original: gzhan du na bde ba dang dge ba'i 'du shes yin yang blang bya nyid med pas nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bde ba dang dge ba'i 'du shes yin yang blang bya nyid med pas nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, even if there is the notion of pleasure and virtue, there is no appropriation because there is nothing to be appropriated.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes la yang dor bya nyid med pas gzhom bya ma yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes la yang dor bya nyid med pas gzhom bya ma yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the notion of suffering is explained as not to be destroyed because there is nothing to be rejected.

original: de ltar na gzhom pa dang nye bar len pa yang bdag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa chags pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de'i 'gal ba bdag med pa mthong bas ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhom pa dang nye bar len pa yang bdag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa chags pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de'i 'gal ba bdag med pa mthong bas ldog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason for attachment, such as ‚Äúthe self is to be destroyed and appropriated,‚Äù is stopped by seeing selflessness, which is incompatible with it.

original: de kho na yang bdag nyid thams cad kyis gzhom pa dang nye bar ldog par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de kho na yang bdag nyid thams cad kyis gzhom pa dang nye bar ldog par byed pa yin la /
translated: Thatness is what destroys and appropriates in every way.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal bzlog pa dang sdug bsngal gzhom pa yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal bzlog pa dang sdug bsngal gzhom pa yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the cessation of suffering that has that as its nature is the cessation of suffering, and the destruction of suffering that has that as its nature is the destruction of suffering.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang bdag ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma mthong ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang bdag ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma mthong ba ni /
translated: In the same way, the nonseeing of the distinction between the self and the nonself

original: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa'i rtsa ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa'i rtsa ba ni /
translated: is the root of attachment to the self and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: gzhom pa dang nye bar len pa'i rgyu mtshan du rig par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩbdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbdag kho na la bdag tu lta ba sel ba ni /
analyzed: gzhom pa dang nye bar len pa'i rgyu mtshan du rig par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni / bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o // bdag kho na la bdag tu lta ba sel ba ni /
translated: The reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.

analyzed: 'dus byas spyod yul can zhes bya ba ste / ji ltar lus dang dbang po dang blo dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams bdag ma yin pa la bdag tu lta bas @298b chags par byed pa yin te /
translated: The reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.

analyzed: yongs su mi 'dor zhing len par byed pa de bzhin du bdag gi ba yang sdug bsngal ba'am sdug bsngal dang 'brel ba ni /
translated: The reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.

original: nye bar len par mi byed cing yongs su 'dor bar byed do //üîΩde bzhin du gcig pu mi dga' na /
analyzed: nye bar len par mi byed cing yongs su 'dor bar byed do // de bzhin du gcig pu mi dga' na /
translated: The reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.

original: de gnyis pa 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas re zhig bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ni skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis pa 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas re zhig bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ni skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: The reason for the destruction and appropriation is shown.üîΩThe reason for the destruction and

original: bde ba dang de'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa mthong ba yang bdag med par rig pa'i 'ching ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bde ba dang de'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa mthong ba yang bdag med par rig pa'i 'ching ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The seeing of happiness, its cause, etc. is not the cause of bondage, even though one knows selflessness.

original: de ltar rgyu'i ngo bo nges par brtags pas de las bzlog pas bdag med par 'dzin pa la ma yin no zhes bya ba shes par bla ba yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩbdag med mthong ba 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i ngo bo nges par brtags pas de las bzlog pas bdag med par 'dzin pa la ma yin no zhes bya ba shes par bla ba yin par bstan pa ni / bdag med mthong ba 'gal ba yin //
translated: Thus, by ascertaining the nature of the cause, it is shown that the opposite of that is the cause of bondage, and that the apprehension of selflessness is not.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The seeing of selflessness is not contradictory.

original: yid kyi sdug bsngal bdag dang bdag gir kun tu rtog pa las byung ba ni kun rtog med na mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi sdug bsngal bdag dang bdag gir kun tu rtog pa las byung ba ni kun rtog med na mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The mental suffering that arises from the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù does not occur if there is no conception.

original: rtsub mo la reg pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi bskyed bya'i dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: rtsub mo la reg pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi bskyed bya'i dmigs pa ni /
translated: The object that is to be known, which is produced by the object of contact with roughness, etc.

original: tshogs pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa kho na bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: tshogs pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa kho na bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: arises just like the object, because it arises from the collection.

original: gal te chags pa dang bral na //
analyzed: gal te chags pa dang bral na //
translated: If one is free from attachment,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then one is free from suffering.

original: gal te dmigs pa bzhin du sdug bsngal lam cig shos de'i bskyed bya yin na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa bzhin du sdug bsngal lam cig shos de'i bskyed bya yin na /
translated: If, like the object, the pleasure or pain were the effect of that,

original: de gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur gyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur gyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: then it would be the nature of one and not the other.

original: 'gyur na yang des rtogs pa ni yul la sogs pa'i tshogs pa bde ba la sogs pa'i bag chags dang lhan cig pa nyid bde ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur na yang des rtogs pa ni yul la sogs pa'i tshogs pa bde ba la sogs pa'i bag chags dang lhan cig pa nyid bde ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: If it were to occur, then the cause of pleasure would be the mere collection of the object and so on, together with the latent impressions of pleasure and so on.

original: gang yang gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa phul du byung ba'i bag chags kyis rang gi bde ba la sogs pa'i bag chags bsgribs pa de'i yul la dmigs pa de'i tshogs pa yod pas dmigs pa yod na bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba ma yin
analyzed: gang yang gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa phul du byung ba'i bag chags kyis rang gi bde ba la sogs pa'i bag chags bsgribs pa de'i yul la dmigs pa de'i tshogs pa yod pas dmigs pa yod na bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba ma yin
translated: But when the latent impressions of one‚Äôs own pleasure and so on are obscured by the latent impressions of the superior wish to free others from suffering, then even though the collection of the object and so on exists, pleasure and so on do not occur,

original: te / rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩgzhan sdug bsngal bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: te / rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / gzhan sdug bsngal bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because there is no cause for them.üîΩThis is taught by ‚ÄúIf one wishes to free others from suffering. . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te gzhan bde bar byed pa 'am sdug bsngal gzhom pas kyang rang la 'bras bu ci zhig 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: gal te gzhan bde bar byed pa 'am sdug bsngal gzhom pas kyang rang la 'bras bu ci zhig 'byung ba yin /
translated: What result does one get from making others happy or from destroying their suffering?

original: de med na rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams gang la yang 'jug pa ma yin snyam du sems pa la /üîΩgzhan gyi bde ba la'am /
analyzed: de med na rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams gang la yang 'jug pa ma yin snyam du sems pa la / gzhan gyi bde ba la'am /
translated: If it does not exist, then those who are rational would not engage in anything.üîΩIf one is attached to oneself in relation to the pleasure of others,

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa la bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa la bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin na /
translated: or in relation to the destruction of the suffering of others,

original: rang gi bde ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med pas bdag la chags @299a * //üîΩpa bsgribs bzhin pa la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi bde ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med pas bdag la chags @299a * // pa bsgribs bzhin pa la 'jug pa ni /
translated: then one would not engage in anything, since one would not be concerned with one‚Äôs own pleasure, etc.

original: bdag la yod pa'i 'bras bu med na ji ltar 'jug pa yin zhes glags btsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la yod pa'i 'bras bu med na ji ltar 'jug pa yin zhes glags btsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One should not seek an opportunity to say that one would engage in actions while being obscured by attachment to oneself.

original: bdag gi ba'i 'bras bu yang de nyid la mngon par zhen pa med na 'jug par byed pa ma yin par bstan ba /
analyzed: bdag gi ba'i 'bras bu yang de nyid la mngon par zhen pa med na 'jug par byed pa ma yin par bstan ba /
translated: If one is not attached to the result that belongs to oneself, one would not engage in actions. This is demonstrated by the following verse:

original: bdag gi ba la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi ba la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One does not engage in actions because of attachment to what belongs to oneself.

original: gzhan la rang nyid kyi bla yin na rang la chags pas ldog pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la rang nyid kyi bla yin na rang la chags pas ldog pa kho na yin te /
translated: If something belongs to oneself, then one would only turn away from it because of attachment to oneself.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i yang khyad par las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i yang khyad par las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that one would not engage in actions because of attachment to the result that belongs to oneself.

original: 'di mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that this is seen is:

original: bu la chags pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bu la chags pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of attachment to a son.

original: kha cig ni gzhan la rang nyid du mngon par zhen pa phul du byung ba med kyang bdag med pa bsgom pa phul du byung bas bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa ldog pa phul du byung ba yin na de'i snying po can gyi bdag chags kyi
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhan la rang nyid du mngon par zhen pa phul du byung ba med kyang bdag med pa bsgom pa phul du byung bas bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa ldog pa phul du byung ba yin na de'i snying po can gyi bdag chags kyi
translated: Some, although not having an outstanding adherence to another as self, have an outstanding cultivation of selflessness, and so they have an outstanding reversal of adherence to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: ngo bo'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i tshogs pa las dmigs pa 'byung ba yin yang /
analyzed: ngo bo'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i tshogs pa las dmigs pa 'byung ba yin yang /
translated: The essence of the self is the cause of attachment, and since it is abandoned, although the collection of objects of adherence produces the object of adherence,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩdes na bdag med pa de'i bdag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa ni / des na bdag med pa de'i bdag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the arising of the effect, happiness and suffering, and so on, is not demonstrated.

original: de la gnod pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de la gnod pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Therefore, that selflessness is the self is stated from ‚ÄúThat selflessness is the self‚Äù up to ‚ÄúWhat harm is there in that?‚Äù

original: 'di las kyang bdag med pa mthong ba goms par mngon par 'dod pa'i bag chags phul du byung ba las kyang sdug bsngal gyi bag chags bsgribs pas de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal ni yul la dmigs pa bzhin du skye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di las kyang bdag med pa mthong ba goms par mngon par 'dod pa'i bag chags phul du byung ba las kyang sdug bsngal gyi bag chags bsgribs pas de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal ni yul la dmigs pa bzhin du skye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Also, from this, it is shown that the result of suffering, suffering, is not produced by the object, because of the latent impressions of the view of selflessness, which is cultivated, being superior to the latent impressions of suffering.

original: gang la kho na la goms pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang la kho na la goms pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, to what?

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa med na /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa med na /
translated: If there is no apprehension of self and entities connected to the self,

original: 'du byed pa tsam mthong ba'i yal bar 'dug pa ni phul du byung ba dang ldan pa yin te bsgom pa phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed pa tsam mthong ba'i yal bar 'dug pa ni phul du byung ba dang ldan pa yin te bsgom pa phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the mere seeing of formations is indifference, which is endowed with superiority, because of the superiority of cultivation.

original: sdug bsngal ni bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i snying po can gyi bag chags kyi bskyed bya yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i snying po can gyi bag chags kyi bskyed bya yin la /
translated: Suffering is that which is produced by latent impressions that have the essence of manifest clinging to self, etc.

original: de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes sngar bstan pa nye bar sdud pa ni shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes sngar bstan pa nye bar sdud pa ni shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, very much, in order to summarize the previous teaching that it does not occur without that.

original: mang po zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba phal che ba nyid de /
analyzed: mang po zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba phal che ba nyid de /
translated: Many means the abundance of application.

original: rtsa ba'i sems bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sems bsdus pa'o //
translated: The root is the mind that is concentrated.

original: rnam pa du mar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa du mar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The many aspects are

original: de'i rjes su spyod pa'i sems kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs par gnas pa'i rnam par dbye ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i rjes su spyod pa'i sems kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs par gnas pa'i rnam par dbye ba yin la /
translated: the distinctions that are the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on of the mind that is engaged in that.

original: rnam par dbye ba bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba bsdus pa yin te /
translated: They are included in the distinctions.

original: bsdus pa'i sems kyis dus mang po nyid du bsgoms pa la sbyor ba mang po nyid 'thob pa yin pas rnam pa thams cad @299b gsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i sems kyis dus mang po nyid du bsgoms pa la sbyor ba mang po nyid 'thob pa yin pas rnam pa thams cad @299b gsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since one who has a concentrated mind obtains many applications in the cultivation of many times, it is said that all aspects are clear.

original: 'grel bar ni bdag med pa mthong ba zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'i khyad par yod na'o //
analyzed: 'grel bar ni bdag med pa mthong ba zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'i khyad par yod na'o //
translated: In the commentary, seeing selflessness is when there is a distinction in abandonment.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'phel ba'o //
translated: Realization is the increase of wisdom.

original: thabs rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thabs rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Many kinds of methods are

original: rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan yin la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan yin la /
translated: the qualities of miracles, superknowledges, and so on.

original: de med pa ni skyon yin pa ste /
analyzed: de med pa ni skyon yin pa ste /
translated: Their absence is a fault,

original: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as the mental misdeeds.

original: nyes pa phra mo dang rags pa nang na gnas pa ni bdag med par mthong ba'i bsgom pa phul du byung bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skyon phra mor 'gyur ba yang de'i nang na gnas pa'i rigs mthun pa bsgoms pas shin tu phra ba'i phyir shin
analyzed: nyes pa phra mo dang rags pa nang na gnas pa ni bdag med par mthong ba'i bsgom pa phul du byung bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skyon phra mor 'gyur ba yang de'i nang na gnas pa'i rigs mthun pa bsgoms pas shin tu phra ba'i phyir shin
translated: Subtle and gross faults that exist internally are extremely subtle because they are cultivated in the internal homogeneity of the excellent meditation that sees selflessness.

original: tu mtshon par dka' ba yang mtshon par byed pa yin zhes bya bas rtog pa phul du byung bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tu mtshon par dka' ba yang mtshon par byed pa yin zhes bya bas rtog pa phul du byung bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since they are extremely difficult to discern, they are discerned by the excellent discernment that is taught.

original: bag chags ni ngag ma dag pa khol mo zhes zer ba lta bu dang / lus ma dag pa mchongs bas 'gro ba lta bu dang / yid ma dag pa rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa med pas lung du ma bstan pa sems mngon du rgyu ba yin te /
analyzed: bag chags ni ngag ma dag pa khol mo zhes zer ba lta bu dang / lus ma dag pa mchongs bas 'gro ba lta bu dang / yid ma dag pa rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa med pas lung du ma bstan pa sems mngon du rgyu ba yin te /
translated: Latent potentialities are the impure speech of a servant, the impure body of one who moves by jumping, and the impure mind of one who is always distracted and neutral.

original: bdag tu nga rgyal ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par ni nyon mongs pa med kyang 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu nga rgyal ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par ni nyon mongs pa med kyang 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The distinctive result of the afflictions, such as the pride of self, occurs even in the noble listeners and solitary realizers who are free from afflictions.

original: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa gang gi yin pa de'i ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa gang gi yin pa de'i ste /
translated: It is the one who engages in the welfare of others.

original: thub pa chen po'i 'di bse ru lta bu la sogs pa'i rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa las khyad par ni bag chags spangs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //üîΩlus dang dbang po dang blo dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi yin par nges pa la de las bzlog pa bdag med par mthong ba ni gnyen po yin gyi /
