translated: A thing is not made to be hidden by inference in the time periods such as the past alone, and it is not the case that it is not hidden in the present alone.üîΩBecause the object of consciousness is the division of the connection between things and time.

original: te / shes pas dmigs pa ni dngos po dang dus kyi 'brel pa dag gi dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di la yang skyon brjod par dogs pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: te / shes pas dmigs pa ni dngos po dang dus kyi 'brel pa dag gi dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di la yang skyon brjod par dogs pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Also, in this position, it is thought that the fault of the expression ‚Äúin what time‚Äù is suspected.

original: ji ste dus gang du zhes bya ba'o / dpyid kyi dus la sogs pa rnams la yang dngos po'i khyad par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dus 'ga' yang med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ste dus gang du zhes bya ba'o / dpyid kyi dus la sogs pa rnams la yang dngos po'i khyad par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dus 'ga' yang med par bstan pa ni /
translated: Also, because there is no difference in the particular thing in the time periods such as spring, it is taught that no time exists at all.

original: dngos po las ni tha dad par //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po las ni tha dad par // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Time is not at all.üîΩTime is not at all.

original: dus ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'i yan lag gi rdzas ni grang ba'i dus yin la /
analyzed: dus ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'i yan lag gi rdzas ni grang ba'i dus yin la /
translated: The time of the substance of the branch of differentiation is the cold season.

original: de bzhin du rab tu snyi ba'i yan lag me'i rdzas kyi dpyid kyi dus la sogs @305b par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu snyi ba'i yan lag me'i rdzas kyi dpyid kyi dus la sogs @305b par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the time of the substance of the branch of extreme softness is the spring season, etc.üîΩBut time is not at all.

original: dus med kyang mthong bar 'gyur ba 'das pa'i dus nyid dang / snang ba'i dus da ltar ba nyid dang / ma 'ongs pa mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid ces bya bar dus rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba yin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /üîΩde dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus med kyang mthong bar 'gyur ba 'das pa'i dus nyid dang / snang ba'i dus da ltar ba nyid dang / ma 'ongs pa mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid ces bya bar dus rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba yin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la / de dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The time of the past is the time of what has been seen, the time of the present is the time of what is seen, and the time of the future is the time of what will be seen.üîΩThe time of the past is the time of what has been seen, the time of the present is the time of what is seen, and the time of the future is the time of what will be seen.

original: thams cad mngon du byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa la ni mthong bar gyur pa nyid dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mngon du byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa la ni mthong bar gyur pa nyid dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For the yogi who has realized all, there is no time of what has been seen and no time of what will be seen.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i mthong ba la ni 'das pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa kho nar gsal bar byed pa ni dpyid sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i mthong ba la ni 'das pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa kho nar gsal bar byed pa ni dpyid sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The yogi‚Äôs vision is that past, etc. do not exist at all.

original: rnal 'byor pa la de ltar bu'i dbye ba med du zin kyang chu rol mthong ba la ltos nas 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la de ltar bu'i dbye ba med du zin kyang chu rol mthong ba la ltos nas 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Even though there is no such division for the yogi, it is thought that it is in dependence on seeing the water‚Äôs edge that there is a division.

original: gnyis po zhes bya ba smos pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag go //
analyzed: gnyis po zhes bya ba smos pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe two‚Äù refers to the past and future.

original: de ltar slob dpon rnams kyi bzhed gzhung rnams mngon par 'dod pa ma yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon rnams kyi bzhed gzhung rnams mngon par 'dod pa ma yin par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown that the positions of the masters are not what is intended,

original: rang gi 'dod pa bstan pa ni /üîΩji ltar rjes su dpag pa ni //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa bstan pa ni / ji ltar rjes su dpag pa ni //
translated: he teaches his own position.üîΩAs for inference,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is just as he says.

original: rjes su dpag pas de rtogs bzhin pa ni de ltar 'gyur gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas de rtogs bzhin pa ni de ltar 'gyur gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that it is just as he says that the past, etc. are realized by inference, but not by direct perception?

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid la 'das pa nyid la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid la 'das pa nyid la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: It is because it is not possible for something that is not hidden to be past, etc.

original: mngon sum yang ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum yang ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception‚Äù is mentioned.

original: ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object?

original: rjes su dpag pa des zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that inference.‚Äù

original: 'das pa'i rgyus skyed pa'i 'bras bu gang las 'das par 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: 'das pa'i rgyus skyed pa'i 'bras bu gang las 'das par 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what past cause would the past result arise?‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa des zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that inference.‚Äù

original: de ltar mngon sum gyis mthong ba rjes su rtogs pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas mthong ba mngon sum gyis yin gyi 'bras bu dang rgyu dag la ni rigs pa 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum gyis mthong ba rjes su rtogs pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas mthong ba mngon sum gyis yin gyi 'bras bu dang rgyu dag la ni rigs pa 'di ma yin no //
translated: Just as what is seen by direct perception is understood, so what is seen by inference is direct perception. But this is not the case for cause and effect.

original: rjes su dpag pas bskyed pa'i mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa'i rtags dang rtags can 'dzin pa'i rim pas rim gyis 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas bskyed pa'i mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa'i rtags dang rtags can 'dzin pa'i rim pas rim gyis 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: Direct perception produced by inference is engaged in gradually, in the order of the apprehension of the reason and the property of the reason.

original: 'khrul pas dngos po mi snang ba'i phyir dang / spyi'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir de lta bur 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pas dngos po mi snang ba'i phyir dang / spyi'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir de lta bur 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: It is like that because of the non-appearance of things due to error and because of the mere aspect of generality.

original: gal te mngon sum rjes su dpag pas bskyed pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum rjes su dpag pas bskyed pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is produced by direct perception and inference, then it is not nonconceptual.

original: rim gyis rtogs pa ni goms pa phul du byung ba sna tshogs pa'i rnam rtog dang sgra'i don gyi bdag nyid can gyi bstan bcos kyi rnam rtog bzhin du rim pa ma yin pas snang ba bstan pa ni /üîΩde ni shin tu goms pa la //
analyzed: rim gyis rtogs pa ni goms pa phul du byung ba sna tshogs pa'i rnam rtog dang sgra'i don gyi bdag nyid can gyi bstan bcos kyi rnam rtog bzhin du rim pa ma yin pas snang ba bstan pa ni / de ni shin tu goms pa la //
translated: The gradual understanding is like the treatise-understanding, which has the nature of various concepts and the meaning of words, and is not nonsequential. The teaching of the nonsequential appearance is:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is from very strong familiarity.

original: shin tu goms pa las du ma shes pa gcig la snang ba ma yin nam /üîΩshes pa du ma gcig la ni ma @306a * //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las du ma shes pa gcig la snang ba ma yin nam / shes pa du ma gcig la ni ma @306a * //
translated: From very strong familiarity, is it not the case that many consciousnesses appear in one?

original: yin no // de'i phyir ji ltar glo bur du du ba mthong ba dang dus mtshungs par me'i shes pa yin /
analyzed: yin no // de'i phyir ji ltar glo bur du du ba mthong ba dang dus mtshungs par me'i shes pa yin /
translated: Many consciousnesses do not appear in one. Therefore, how is it that at the time of suddenly seeing smoke, there is the consciousness of fire?

original: cig car bar mngon par 'dod pa ni yid myur du rgyu ba yin pas rim par mtshon pa'i phyir mgal me la 'khor lor mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: cig car bar mngon par 'dod pa ni yid myur du rgyu ba yin pas rim par mtshon pa'i phyir mgal me la 'khor lor mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: The assertion that it is simultaneous is because the mind moves quickly, and it is like seeing a wheel of fire from a whirling firebrand.

original: de lta yin na rdzu 'phrul gyi chos can gyi rnal 'byor pas sprul pa'i lus dang dbang po rnams la yid gcig dbang po'i rnam shes du ma'i skyed byed du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na rdzu 'phrul gyi chos can gyi rnal 'byor pas sprul pa'i lus dang dbang po rnams la yid gcig dbang po'i rnam shes du ma'i skyed byed du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, for a yogin who has the quality of magical power, the mental faculty would not be the producer of many sense consciousnesses in regard to the emanated bodies and sense faculties.

original: de'i phyir don du ma bzhin du gcig du ma la yang rgyu gzhan tshang ba yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir don du ma bzhin du gcig du ma la yang rgyu gzhan tshang ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, just as in the case of many objects, if the other causes are complete in regard to one or many,

original: du mar yang byed pa yin te /
analyzed: du mar yang byed pa yin te /
translated: it produces many.

original: ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not attached.üîΩThe deficiency is in the order.

original: ma tshang ba ni rim pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: ma tshang ba ni rim pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: This is the seen reasoning.

original: 'khrul pa nyid ni mngon sum la yang mtshungs te so sor snang ba la rnam rtog gi don gyi phyogs la 'dzud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid ni mngon sum la yang mtshungs te so sor snang ba la rnam rtog gi don gyi phyogs la 'dzud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Error is the same in direct perception, because in the appearance of each, conceptual thought is inserted in the object.

original: 'on te de la rnam rtog nyid ni 'khrul pa yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'on te de la rnam rtog nyid ni 'khrul pa yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no ;
translated: But if conceptual thought itself is error and not direct perception,

original: / de lta ma yin te gang gi phyir mngon sum gyi bya ba la rnam rtog ni rang gi byed pa'i sgrib par byed pa 'di mthong ngo zhes rjes su 'brang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: / de lta ma yin te gang gi phyir mngon sum gyi bya ba la rnam rtog ni rang gi byed pa'i sgrib par byed pa 'di mthong ngo zhes rjes su 'brang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, if it were not so, then in the case of the activity of perception, conceptual thought would be seen to obscure its own activity, and it would follow that it is not a subsequent modifier.

original: de'i phyir de yang de lta bu nyid la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang de lta bu nyid la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is also engaged in that very same object,

original: so sor snang ba ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: so sor snang ba ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: but it is not a distinct appearance.

original: dngos por snang ba ma yin pa nyid ni rnam pa ma lus pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos por snang ba ma yin pa nyid ni rnam pa ma lus pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not an appearance as an entity, because it does not apprehend all aspects.

original: 'dis ni spyi'i rnam pa nyid gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyi'i rnam pa nyid gsal ba yin no //
translated: This clarifies the very aspect of the general.

original: gang la gnyis ka'i skyon mtshungs pa /
analyzed: gang la gnyis ka'i skyon mtshungs pa /
translated: Where the fault is the same for both,

original: de la lan yang mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: de la lan yang mtshungs pa yin //
translated: the reply is the same.

original: de 'dra'i don ni rnam dpyad la //
analyzed: de 'dra'i don ni rnam dpyad la //
translated: In the examination of such an object,

original: gcig la brgal zhing brtag bya min //
analyzed: gcig la brgal zhing brtag bya min //
translated: one should not dispute the one.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of this reasoning is:üîΩIf the Veda is beginningless,

original: thog med gal te rig byed kyang //
analyzed: thog med gal te rig byed kyang //
translated: then the understanding from it

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is also beginningless.

original: de las te rig byed las rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: de las te rig byed las rtogs pa ni /
translated: From that, from the Veda, understanding is also beginningless.

original: 'jug par byed par rjod par byed pa nyid kyis de 'dzin par byed pa ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'jug par byed par rjod par byed pa nyid kyis de 'dzin par byed pa ji ltar yin te /
translated: How can one who is a mere speaker, who causes one to engage in the Veda, be a comprehender?

original: ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: He cannot be!

original: da ltar 'dod bzhin pa ni thog ma med pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar 'dod bzhin pa ni thog ma med pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: One does not understand that the Veda is beginningless just because one desires it to be so.

original: ji srid ji srid du rtogs pa de srid de srid du nye ba kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji srid ji srid du rtogs pa de srid de srid du nye ba kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is only as long as one understands it that it is near.

original: de ltar ba bzhin du dus gzhan la yang 'jug par byed par rjod par byed pa nyid du ma yin na rig byed ji srid yod kyi bar du don dang 'brel pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar ba bzhin du dus gzhan la yang 'jug par byed par rjod par byed pa nyid du ma yin na rig byed ji srid yod kyi bar du don dang 'brel pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In the same way, if one is not a mere speaker who causes one to engage in the Veda at another time, then it is shown that the Veda is not related to its meaning for as long as it exists:

original: gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin rtogs pa na dus thams cad du de'i rang bzhin kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin rtogs pa na dus thams cad du de'i rang bzhin kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If one thinks that when one understands the Veda in this way, is it not always just that nature?

original: byed pa po ma yin pa nyid dran pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa nyid dran pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Because one remembers that one was not the author,

original: gal te sngon yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sngon yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: if one says, ‚ÄúIt was like this before,‚Äù

original: spyi ni phan tshun tha dad pas ma rtogs bzhin pa ni khyad par rnams kho @306b na yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni phan tshun tha dad pas ma rtogs bzhin pa ni khyad par rnams kho @306b na yin no //
translated: The universal is not perceived, since it is different from the particulars.

original: rang rgyud yongs su bcad pa na //
analyzed: rang rgyud yongs su bcad pa na //
translated: The particulars alone are perceived.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi don nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi don nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen the continuum is interrupted‚Äù refers to the meaning of the term ‚Äúoccasion.‚Äù

original: yongs su shes su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa nyid kyis thabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su shes su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa nyid kyis thabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though it is known‚Äù means that it is not a means of knowing because it is beginningless.

original: 'brel pa ni rang bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / du ba'i 'brel pa bzhin du rtogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa can nyid tsam 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa nyid kyis rang bzhin ma yin pa'i 'brel pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rang bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / du ba'i 'brel pa bzhin du rtogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa can nyid tsam 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa nyid kyis rang bzhin ma yin pa'i 'brel pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The relation is not natural, and the cognition is not direct perception, like the relation of smoke. It is a sign that has the nature of apprehending the mere relation, because it is preceded by a non-natural relation.

original: rtogs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Mere cognition is not a means of knowing.

original: gnod pa can ma dmigs pa yang the tshom yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa can ma dmigs pa yang the tshom yin te /
translated: Non-apprehension of what can be obstructed is also doubt.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa can ni da ltar nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa can ni da ltar nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the future result is not presently near,

original: rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not realized.

original: skyes bu med pas de las 'byung ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu med pas de las 'byung ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Since there is no person, the fault that would arise from that is not the case.

original: rab rib can bzhin du skyon gzhan yin zhes bya bas bstan pa yin par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rab rib can bzhin du skyon gzhan yin zhes bya bas bstan pa yin par brjod pa ni /
translated: It is stated that the fault is different, like the one with myodesopsia.

original: sngar bstan pa nyid don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa nyid don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of what was previously taught is just that.üîΩEven if attachment and so on are not causes that reveal another ignorance, they are still the negative tendencies of latent tendencies.

original: gal te yang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams mi shes pa gzhan nyid du ston pa'i rgyu ma yin du zin kyang bag chags kyi gnas ngan len nyid gzhan du rig pa yin yang gzhan du brjod par 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba'i rigs pa'am /
analyzed: gal te yang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams mi shes pa gzhan nyid du ston pa'i rgyu ma yin du zin kyang bag chags kyi gnas ngan len nyid gzhan du rig pa yin yang gzhan du brjod par 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba'i rigs pa'am /
translated: Even though they are known to be different, it is asserted that they are different.

original: bkres pa la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin la gnod par byed pa cis mi srid pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin la gnod par byed pa cis mi srid pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhy is it impossible that hunger and so on harm samƒÅdhi?‚Äù

original: gal te thabs goms pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te thabs goms pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIf one is familiar with the method.‚Äù

original: rgan pos sgra thos nas tha snyad du byed pa byis pas mthong ba ni de dang 'brel pa'i shes pa rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgan pos sgra thos nas tha snyad du byed pa byis pas mthong ba ni de dang 'brel pa'i shes pa rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: The old man hears the sound and makes the convention. Is it not the case that the child sees and realizes the cognition that is related to that?

original: de yang de bzhin du gzhan gyi yin la /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du gzhan gyi yin la /
translated: And that is just like the other one.

original: de yang de bzhin kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: And that is just like that one.

original: des na dmus long brgyud pa zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: des na dmus long brgyud pa zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: Thus, it is called the ‚Äúseries of the blind.‚Äù

original: tha snyad byed pa po'i rgyud pa ni snga mas snga ma'i 'brel pa yin gyi me dang du ba bzhin du 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad byed pa po'i rgyud pa ni snga mas snga ma'i 'brel pa yin gyi me dang du ba bzhin du 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The series of the one who makes the convention is the relation of the prior to the subsequent, but it is not a relation like that of fire and smoke,

original: mngon sum pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i don to //
translated: because it is not direct perception. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in the case of another‚Äù means also in the case of that produced by a person.

original: 'di la ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa rjes su dpag pa la rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: 'di la ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa rjes su dpag pa la rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: ‚ÄúIn this case‚Äù means that in the case of the omniscient one, inference is the root.

original: don dang 'brel pa rang bzhin gyis shes pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa rang bzhin gyis shes pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the relation to the object is known only by nature.

original: 'dis ni 'di rang nyid don dang 'brel pa la bag chags ni gnod byed ma yin par bstan la /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di rang nyid don dang 'brel pa la bag chags ni gnod byed ma yin par bstan la /
translated: This shows that the latent impressions do not harm the self‚Äôs connection with its object.

original: gzhan la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they harm another,

original: rang nyid kho na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang nyid kho na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because the self itself does not exist.

original: gzhan yang des na thugs kyang zhes bya ba ni des @307a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang des na thugs kyang zhes bya ba ni des @307a * //
translated: Moreover, the self is also not the cause of the arising of consciousness, because it is not a cause, like anything else that is not a cause.

original: na gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: na gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is connected to the word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not a cause.‚Äù

original: thabs goms pa phul du byung ba las byung ba'i gsal ba des zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin no //üîΩde yod kyang rang gi don rgyas pa'i phyir de spangs pa'i don du ci'i phyir 'bad rtsol byed ces zer ba la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thabs goms pa phul du byung ba las byung ba'i gsal ba des zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin no // de yod kyang rang gi don rgyas pa'i phyir de spangs pa'i don du ci'i phyir 'bad rtsol byed ces zer ba la bstan pa ni /

original: khyad par 'di yin zhes bya ba ni rang gi don la 'jug pa bes ru lta bu la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par 'di yin zhes bya ba ni rang gi don la 'jug pa bes ru lta bu la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: This is the difference, which is the difference in their natures, like a cow and a horse.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas chags pa'i snying po can ni bag chags dang ldan pa rnams kho na yin gyi dmigs pa'i tshogs pa can tsam las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas chags pa'i snying po can ni bag chags dang ldan pa rnams kho na yin gyi dmigs pa'i tshogs pa can tsam las ni ma yin te /
translated: The suffering of hunger and so on is the core of attachment to the self and mine, and it is only those who have the latent predispositions who have it, not those who merely have the collection of the sense faculties.

original: gcig gi rnam pa'i bde ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gcig gi rnam pa'i bde ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is because it would follow that the pleasure and so on of one person would be the pleasure and so on of another.

original: bru ba tsha ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde bzhin du kham gyi zas dang 'gal ba can gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba bsags pa las kyang skye ba snga ma las byung ba'i skye ba dran pas sam /
analyzed: bru ba tsha ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o // de bzhin du kham gyi zas dang 'gal ba can gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba bsags pa las kyang skye ba snga ma las byung ba'i skye ba dran pas sam /
translated: The suffering of hunger and so on is also like this.

original: las la dbang du gyur pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las la dbang du gyur pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, even though the form realm gods are virtuous and accumulate food, they do not have hunger and so on because they remember their previous lives through remembering past lives and they do not engage in actions due to being powerful.üîΩThis is because they are the opposite of food.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa rnams shin tu mi srid par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa rnams shin tu mi srid par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that hunger and so on are completely impossible for them.

original: gal te skye ba dran pa yis //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te skye ba dran pa yis // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one remembers one‚Äôs birth,

analyzed: lha sogs ngo bo yis zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spyod pa'i lha nyid thob pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the nature of the gods, etc.‚Äù means that one obtains the very nature of a god who lives in the form realm.

analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi rgyu tsam las byung ba ma yin te /

analyzed: goms pa las byung ba yin la /

original: zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: khams gsum po la yang sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes 'dor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'di nyid thabs goms pa yin par ci las shes she na /

analyzed: de don phyir zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩbstan pa ni 'bras bu yin gyi thabs ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: that

original: de don phyir ni bstan pa'i don yin pa'i phyir bstan pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de don phyir ni bstan pa'i don yin pa'i phyir bstan pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: For that reason, it is the meaning of the teaching, because it is the cause of the teaching.

original: 'di nyid kho na las thabs goms pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kho na las thabs goms pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: It is only from this that the means is cultivated, not from anything else.

original: de'i de rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i de rgyu yin no //
translated: That is its cause.

original: 'di ci las nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci las nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: From what is it ascertained?

original: thub las te bde bar gshegs pa nyid las dang po 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thub las te bde bar gshegs pa nyid las dang po 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: From the Sage, from the Sugata, because it arises first.

original: de nyid grub pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i sgrar gdags par rung ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid grub pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i sgrar gdags par rung ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is suitable to be designated as the word of the teaching, which is the nature of that which is accomplished, not anything else.

original: 'di la yang rgyu nyid bsgrub bya kho na yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'di la yang rgyu nyid bsgrub bya kho na yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Here, is the cause itself the probandum?

original: rgyu gnyis po 'di ji lta ba de ltar bshad pa ni de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis po 'di ji lta ba de ltar bshad pa ni de ma thag tu'o //
translated: These two causes are explained in that way, immediately after.

original: 'grel par ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'grel par ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: In the commentary, it is clear.

original: de ci mngon zhe na zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir bstan pa yin gyi de nyid ma yin zhes ci las shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ci mngon zhe na zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir bstan pa yin gyi de nyid ma yin zhes ci las shes pa'o //
translated: How is that known? It is known that it is the teaching because it is the cause of the teaching, not because it is that itself.

original: 'di ni rgyu ru bshad ces bya ba ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid dang / ston pa nyid du bstan pa yin gyi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu ru bshad ces bya ba ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid dang / ston pa nyid du bstan pa yin gyi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is called the cause, because it is the cause that is the basis for the wish to benefit migrating beings, and it is the basis for the teaching of the Teacher, but it is not the basis for the perfection of the result.

original: de'i phyir gtso bo ma yin par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtso bo ma yin par shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the principal one.

original: dang po brjod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad mar gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa @308a * //
analyzed: dang po brjod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad mar gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa @308a * //
translated: Because it is mentioned first, in the verse, ‚ÄúThe one who is valid...‚Äù,

original: der ro // grub pa'i ngo bo ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin pa de ji lta bu yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: der ro // grub pa'i ngo bo ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin pa de ji lta bu yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: the nature of the Accomplished One is the state of the Sugata.

original: rgyu spangs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu spangs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is that? It is said, ‚ÄúThe cause is abandoned...‚Äù.

original: dogs pa med pa yul med pa ni gcig pu mi dga' na gnyis pa 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: dogs pa med pa yul med pa ni gcig pu mi dga' na gnyis pa 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las so //
translated: The one who is without fear and without object is the one who is alone and not in a group.

original: bdag med pa mthong bar rigs pas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong bar rigs pas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The one who is without self is the one who is different from the one who is seen.

original: de bden tha dad bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: de bden tha dad bdag nyid kyis //
translated: The one who is true is the one who is different from the one who is self.

original: zhes bya bas brjod bya bzlog pa ma yin par dgongs pas mthong ba dang rigs pa'i sgra dag gi mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam rjod par byed pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bas brjod bya bzlog pa ma yin par dgongs pas mthong ba dang rigs pa'i sgra dag gi mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam rjod par byed pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, the terms ‚Äúseeing‚Äù and ‚Äúreasoning‚Äù are taught to be the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, respectively, because they are not the opposite of the expressed.

original: sbyor ba ni goms pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni goms pa ste /
translated: Cultivation is familiarization.

original: yang na sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba'o ;

original: / gnyis su med par ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / gnyis su med par ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Nonduality is not difference.

original: gcig gi rnam pa 'di shes pa la yod pa zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: gcig gi rnam pa 'di shes pa la yod pa zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Since it is said that this aspect of one exists in consciousness,

original: yang na gcig ces bya ba rgya che ba la dmigs pas phan tshun mi rigs pa'i phyir dbye ba ma rtogs par dgongs pas so //
analyzed: yang na gcig ces bya ba rgya che ba la dmigs pas phan tshun mi rigs pa'i phyir dbye ba ma rtogs par dgongs pas so //
translated: Or else, it is because the one called ‚Äúextensive‚Äù is the object of observation, and because it is not reasonable for them to be mutually exclusive, that the intention is that the divisions are not realized.

analyzed: de de ltar yin na gzhan dmigs par rigs pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, it is reasonable that the other is not observed.

analyzed: phan tshun ma 'dres par ji ltar 'gyur /

analyzed: de ltar nyams su myong ba yin na de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog ma yin la /
translated: If that is the case, it is not a conceptual thought that apprehends it in that way.

original: yin na yang de yang de ltar rtogs pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yin na yang de yang de ltar rtogs pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were, it would not go beyond the realization of that.

original: ma lus pa ma rtogs par gyur pa yin grang na de de lta ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma lus pa ma rtogs par gyur pa yin grang na de de lta ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were the case that it is not realized in its entirety, that is not so.

original: de'i phyir gnyis su med pa nyid phan tshun rjes su 'jug par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis su med pa nyid phan tshun rjes su 'jug par rig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-duality is known to be mutually inclusive.

original: yang na bdag med pa mthong na zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa gnyis mngon du byed pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na bdag med pa mthong na zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa gnyis mngon du byed pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs par brjod pa yin la /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúif one sees selflessness‚Äù means that the actualization of the two types of selflessness is described as the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag med pa de la sbyor ba ni ldan pa ste /üîΩyongs su 'dris pa yin gyi mngon du byed pa ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag med pa de la sbyor ba ni ldan pa ste / yongs su 'dris pa yin gyi mngon du byed pa ni ma yin te ;
translated: The bodhisattvas are endowed with the application to that selflessness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma thob par bar ma dor mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma thob par bar ma dor mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but they do not realize it, because it would follow that they would attain nirvana in the interval before they attain the qualities of a buddha.

original: de 'dis khyab 'jug gi 'jig rten la sogs par 'gro bas grol bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba gsal bar bstan pa ni thams cad du bdag med pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dis khyab 'jug gi 'jig rten la sogs par 'gro bas grol bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba gsal bar bstan pa ni thams cad du bdag med pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the clear statement of the verse: ‚ÄúThey are liberated by going to the world of Vishnu and so on.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe bdag @308b mthong ba can la bde ba ni skyes bu'i don yin la /üîΩbde ba thob na byas par 'gyur ba yin par lta na bde ba'i 'du shes la nye bar gnas pa ni chags par bya ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag @308b mthong ba can la bde ba ni skyes bu'i don yin la / bde ba thob na byas par 'gyur ba yin par lta na bde ba'i 'du shes la nye bar gnas pa ni chags par bya ba'am /
translated: When one who sees a self sees that the purpose of a person is the attainment of pleasure,

original: khro bar bya ba'i kun tu rtog par gyur nas 'khor bar kun du rgyug par byed kyi ldog par mi byed do //
analyzed: khro bar bya ba'i kun tu rtog par gyur nas 'khor bar kun du rgyug par byed kyi ldog par mi byed do //
translated: and that when pleasure is attained, one has done what had to be done, then, abiding in the perception of pleasure, one would be attached to it or would conceive of it as something to be angry at, and would not turn away from wandering in samsara.

original: de'i tshe 'di drang srong rnams kyis skye ba ni sdug bsngal kho na yin no zhes pa sdug bsngal bsgom ba las sad pa yin na yongs su tshol ba'i skyon rnams rig par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di drang srong rnams kyis skye ba ni sdug bsngal kho na yin no zhes pa sdug bsngal bsgom ba las sad pa yin na yongs su tshol ba'i skyon rnams rig par byed pa yin la /
translated: They recognize the faults of thorough searching.

original: 'di gang yongs su tshol bar byed pa ste dgra mang po can ni rnyed na yang nyung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di gang yongs su tshol bar byed pa ste dgra mang po can ni rnyed na yang nyung ba yin la /
translated: What is thoroughly searched for? Even if found, it is little, and it has many enemies.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan las kyang lus dang yid la yal ga mang po can gyi gdung ba skye bar byed na chags par mi byed cing /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan las kyang lus dang yid la yal ga mang po can gyi gdung ba skye bar byed na chags par mi byed cing /
translated: And the reason for that is that it produces many branches of affliction in the body and mind.

original: yang srid kyi rgyu 'khor ba rnams sogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: yang srid kyi rgyu 'khor ba rnams sogs par mi byed do //
translated: One should not be attached to it, and one should not accumulate the causes of rebirth.

original: des na sdug bsngal thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bdag tu yang yod pa'i phyir su zhig bdag med pa mthong ba'i rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bdag tu yang yod pa'i phyir su zhig bdag med pa mthong ba'i rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since one is liberated from all suffering, and since the self exists, who would be liberated by seeing selflessness?üîΩIt is absolutely impossible.

original: mi srid pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: mi srid pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: This is the thought of the opponent.

original: phyir mi ldog pa de gang zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa de gang zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is that nonreturner?

original: de la re zhig bdag tu lta ba yin na sdug bsngal bsgom pas nyes pa dang las med pa mi srid pa yin te /üîΩsdug bsngal gyi 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag tu lta ba yin na sdug bsngal bsgom pas nyes pa dang las med pa mi srid pa yin te / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: First, if one has the view of self, it is impossible that one has no faults and karma through cultivating the meditation on suffering.

original: slar yang ldog ces bshad pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: slar yang ldog ces bshad pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is explained in the lines:üîΩ‚ÄúIf one has the view of self, one will not enter the branch of relinquishing the conception of suffering.‚Äù

original: slar yang mi ldog pa'i rgyu ni bdag tu lta ba bcom pa las ldog pa'i bdag tu lta ba yod pa thob pa yin la /
analyzed: slar yang mi ldog pa'i rgyu ni bdag tu lta ba bcom pa las ldog pa'i bdag tu lta ba yod pa thob pa yin la /
translated: The cause of not returning is obtaining the view of self that is the opposite of the destroyed view of self.

original: de'i phyir bdag tu lta ba'i sa bon yod pa na'ang /üîΩlus la sogs pa bdag gir lta ba'i sa bon yod na 'di chags pa'i snying po can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu lta ba'i sa bon yod pa na'ang / lus la sogs pa bdag gir lta ba'i sa bon yod na 'di chags pa'i snying po can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, even if one has the seed of the view of self,

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes nyid 'dor ba'i yan lag la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /üîΩsdug bsngal lta bur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes nyid 'dor ba'i yan lag la 'jug par mi 'gyur te / sdug bsngal lta bur ro //
translated: if one has the seed of the view that the body and so on are mine, one will not enter the branch of relinquishing the conception of suffering,üîΩbecause one has a mind that is attached to that.

original: lus la sogs pa la yang sdug bsngal mang bas bdag gi ba nyid kyang 'dor ba'i sems su 'gyur ro zhe na de'i rgyu yod pa yin na /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la yang sdug bsngal mang bas bdag gi ba nyid kyang 'dor ba'i sems su 'gyur ro zhe na de'i rgyu yod pa yin na /
translated: If one has the seed of the view that the body and so on are mine, one will also have the seed of the view that the body and so on are the self.üîΩIf one has the seed of the view that the body and so on are the self, one will also have the seed of the view that the body and so on are mine.üîΩIf one has the seed of the view that the body and so on are mine, one will also have the seed of the view that the body and so on are the self.

original: de nyid 'di la sdang ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de nyid 'di la sdang ba yin zhing /
translated: and it is hatred for that which is not the self.

original: de las bzlog pa la chags pa yin pa'i phyir de las byung ba'i las ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa la chags pa yin pa'i phyir de las byung ba'i las ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba yin par brjod do //
translated: And since the karma that arises from that is the cause of birth, it is called birth.

original: de'i phyir bdag gi la sogs par lta ba chags ba'i snying po can yin pa'i phyir /üîΩphan byed pa la ltos nas chags par bya ba'i kun du rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gi la sogs par lta ba chags ba'i snying po can yin pa'i phyir / phan byed pa la ltos nas chags par bya ba'i kun du rtog pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, since the view of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the core of attachment,üîΩit is the conception of attachment in dependence on the benefactor.

original: gnod par byed pa la ltos nas ni sdang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa la ltos nas ni sdang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: And it is the conception of hatred in dependence on the harm-doer.

original: de'i phyir chags par @309a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir chags par @309a * //
translated: Therefore, since the conceptions of attachment

original: bya ba'i kun du rtog pa rnams dang / sdang bar bya ba rnams kyang brdzun par rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba ni gti mug yin no //üîΩde dag kyang de mthong ba nyid kho na bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba bsgom pas rtogs pa yin zhes gnyi ga mi 'thad pa'i phyir rgol ba de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i kun du rtog pa rnams dang / sdang bar bya ba rnams kyang brdzun par rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba ni gti mug yin no //üîΩde dag kyang de mthong ba nyid kho na bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba bsgom pas rtogs pa yin zhes gnyi ga mi 'thad pa'i phyir rgol ba de ni gyi na'o //
translated: and the conceptions of hatred are false by nature, the view of the self is delusion.üîΩSince both of these are untenable, the opponent‚Äôs argument is nonsense.

original: de lta na de ci'i phyir spangs pa yin zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩbdag lta'i sa bon spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de lta na de ci'i phyir spangs pa yin zhes bstan pa ni / bdag lta'i sa bon spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, the question is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is that abandoned?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ste /üîΩbdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i snying po can gyi rtog pa rnams bcom pa ni yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i snying po can gyi rtog pa rnams bcom pa ni yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The response is:üîΩBecause the seed of the view of self is abandoned.

original: sa bon med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The destruction of the conceptual thought that has the essence of the view of self, etc. is not subject to origination again, because the seed is absent.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: skye dang zhes bya ba ni las so //
analyzed: skye dang zhes bya ba ni las so //
translated: ‚ÄúOrigination‚Äù refers to karma.

original: skyon med pa'i gnas skabs dang yang skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skyon med pa'i gnas skabs dang yang skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because there is no origination in the state of flawlessness, this is what is meant.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dge ba'i las dang skye ba dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dge ba'i las dang skye ba dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, this is because the bodhisattvas have virtuous karma and rebirths.

original: nyan thos rnams la ni de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la ni de med pa'i phyir /
translated: But this is not so for the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: skye ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are without origination.üîΩBut for ordinary beings, both are absent.

original: so so'i skye ba rnams la ni de gnyi ga med pa'i phyir nyes pa dang / skye ba yod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: so so'i skye ba rnams la ni de gnyi ga med pa'i phyir nyes pa dang / skye ba yod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that they have faults and rebirths is:

original: nyes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFaults and rebirths. ‚Äù

original: de yang nyes pa med pa'i gnas skabs ci las byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang nyes pa med pa'i gnas skabs ci las byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if one asks, ‚ÄúFrom what does the state of being without fault arise? ‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩgnas skabs gnyis pa'i rgyu bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba smos so // gnas skabs gnyis pa'i rgyu bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúfrom the absence of the view of the self. ‚Äù

original: skye ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of the second state is indicated by the phrase, ‚Äúfrom the absence of the view of the self. ‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase, ‚Äúfrom the absence of the view of the self‚Äù is also the cause of the third state.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba dag ni rang gi ngo bos mthong pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba dag ni rang gi ngo bos mthong pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that the view of the self and the view of what belongs to the self are not the cause of desire and so on?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩbde ba sgrub pa la sogs pa'i shes pa nyid kyis chags pa'i yul nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / bde ba sgrub pa la sogs pa'i shes pa nyid kyis chags pa'i yul nyid kyis sam /
translated: What then is the cause?

original: chags pa'i snying po can nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: chags pa'i snying po can nyid kyis yin no //
translated: It is the cognition that seeks to obtain pleasure and so on, or it is the object of desire, or it is the essence of desire.

original: de'i phyir de nyid 'di'i spang bya yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid 'di'i spang bya yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is that very cognition that is to be abandoned, not the view of the self.

original: bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir ldog pas so //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir ldog pas so //
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúbecause of the absence of the view of the self. ‚Äù

original: gzhan ci las nyon mongs pa yod pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan ci las nyon mongs pa yod pa yin /
translated: From what other cause would the afflictions arise?

original: bdag la sogs par lta ba kho na chags pa'i ngo bo yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag la sogs par lta ba kho na chags pa'i ngo bo yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the view of the self and so on is the essence of desire.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i ngo bo'i chags pa dang phan 'dogs pa dran pa yin na chags par bya ba'i rtog pas 'dod chags yin //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i ngo bo'i chags pa dang phan 'dogs pa dran pa yin na chags par bya ba'i rtog pas 'dod chags yin //
translated: If attachment is the recollection of the attachment to the entity of the view of self and the recollection of the benefit, then it is attachment because of the idea of attachment.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dran pa yin na 'khrugs pa'i rtog pas zhe sdang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dran pa yin na 'khrugs pa'i rtog pas zhe sdang yin no //
translated: Similarly, if it is recollection of another, it is hatred because of the idea of agitation.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i chags pa phan byed pa dang / gcig ltos pa'i ngo bo yod na de la ltos pa nyid kho na gzhom par mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i chags pa phan byed pa dang / gcig ltos pa'i ngo bo yod na de la ltos pa nyid kho na gzhom par mi nus so //
translated: If there is the entity of attachment to the view of self and the recollection of the benefit, and the entity of dependence on the one, then it is impossible to destroy the dependence itself.

original: nus na yang rang gi ngo bo 'joms par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus na yang rang gi ngo bo 'joms par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is possible, then it follows that the entity is destroyed.

original: de de las tha dad par 'gyur yang byang grol 'dod pa'i @309b don gang yin pa rgyas par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de de las tha dad par 'gyur yang byang grol 'dod pa'i @309b don gang yin pa rgyas par byed pa yin /
translated: Even if it is different from that, it is the one who expands the purpose of desiring liberation.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bos ni tha dad pa can nyid kho nas dgos pa dang ldan pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bos ni tha dad pa can nyid kho nas dgos pa dang ldan pa ma yin la /
translated: The entity of blue, etc., is only different, and it is not the one who has a purpose.

original: de ni bdag go zhes byas nas tshol ba'i sdug bsngal yin la /
analyzed: de ni bdag go zhes byas nas tshol ba'i sdug bsngal yin la /
translated: It is the suffering of searching, thinking, ‚ÄúThat is the self.‚Äù

original: de ni med pa kho na la ltos pa yin gyi yod pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni med pa kho na la ltos pa yin gyi yod pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: That is only in dependence on the nonexistent, and not on the existent.

original: 'dis ni bdag ni 'di rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag ni 'di rnams kyi'o //
translated: This is the self of these.üîΩ

original: 'di rnams ni bdag gi'o zhes 'brel pa'i blo'i rgyu'i mtshan gyi de'i ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni bdag gi'o zhes 'brel pa'i blo'i rgyu'i mtshan gyi de'i ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gsal ba yin no //
translated: This makes clear that the idea of a connection, ‚ÄúI am theirs, they are mine,‚Äù is not the nature of things.

original: bdag med pa dang bdag tu lta ba dag mtshungs pa nyid stobs mtshungs pa 'gal bar rnam par rtog pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang bdag tu lta ba dag mtshungs pa nyid stobs mtshungs pa 'gal bar rnam par rtog pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The idea that the view of selflessness and the view of self are equal in strength is the conceptual thought that conceives of a contradiction.

original: gal te bdag med pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The view of selflessness is the view of non-self.

original: bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa'i yul nyid kyis stobs mtshungs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa'i yul nyid kyis stobs mtshungs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The idea that they are equal in strength because they have true and false objects is presented as follows:

original: de bden zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bden zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is true‚Äù means that the view of selflessness is true.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a misconception‚Äù means that it is contradictory.

original: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bden par yod pa dang 'gal ba can nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bden par yod pa dang 'gal ba can nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the opposite of that‚Äù means that it is contradictory to the view of self, which is the opposite of the view of selflessness.

original: de ltar bden pa dang tha dad pa'i sgra dag bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa dang tha dad pa'i sgra dag bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the words ‚Äútrue‚Äù and ‚Äúfalse,‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyi sgra bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sgra bshad pa ni /
translated: he explains the word ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd of a different nature‚Äù is the reading.

original: bsdu ba byas pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i sgra dang lhan cig par rjes su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bsdu ba byas pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i sgra dang lhan cig par rjes su brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is used to include the word ‚Äúdifferent.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin rjod par byed pa 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshigs kyang yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin rjod par byed pa 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshigs kyang yin no //
translated: This expression of ‚Äúnature‚Äù is also a reason.

original: bdag med par lta ba ni bden pa dang 'gal ba can yin te /
analyzed: bdag med par lta ba ni bden pa dang 'gal ba can yin te /
translated: The view of selflessness is contradictory to the truth.

original: ci las lhan cig yin pa'i phyir bden pa dang 'gal ba can yin no zhes lhan cig pa yin pa'i phyir bden pa dang 'gal ba can yin no zhes rtogs pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyi sgra ni rang bzhin rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci las lhan cig yin pa'i phyir bden pa dang 'gal ba can yin no zhes lhan cig pa yin pa'i phyir bden pa dang 'gal ba can yin no zhes rtogs pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyi sgra ni rang bzhin rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When one understands that it is contradictory to the truth because it is concomitant with something, then the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù expresses its nature.

original: gtsang spra can thod pa can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin du 'bad pas ldog bya nyid yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gtsang spra can thod pa can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin du 'bad pas ldog bya nyid yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The expression ‚Äúone should strive to turn away from the nature of being a brahman who is pure and wears a topknot‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs kyi nyid med pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi nyid med pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: should be seen as a nonreason.

original: de'i tshe yang dngos po'i ngo bor rjod byed nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang dngos po'i ngo bor rjod byed nyid yin no //
translated: At that time, it is an expression of the nature of a thing.

original: phyir ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pa med pas so //
analyzed: phyir ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pa med pas so //
translated: because there is no turning back.

original: nad med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: nad med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Health is the absence of afflictions.

original: yongs su bzung ba med pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba med pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Freedom from grasping is the absence of distress due to the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: lam bshad pa la mi gsal ba ni 'bras bu'am rgyu yang rung rnam pa thams cad pa'i lam bstan pa la mi gsal bar mtshon par byed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lam bshad pa la mi gsal ba ni 'bras bu'am rgyu yang rung rnam pa thams cad pa'i lam bstan pa la mi gsal bar mtshon par byed par bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the path is as follows: Lack of clarity regarding the path is taught to be a lack of clarity in teaching the path in all of its aspects, whether in terms of its result or its cause.

original: nges pa'i tshig la mi gsal ba //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig la mi gsal ba //
translated: Lack of clarity regarding etymologies.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtso bo nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtso bo nyid kyang ngo //
translated: This is also the principal one.

original: bdag med @310a * //
analyzed: bdag med @310a * //
translated: Lack of clarity regarding selflessness.

original: bsam spangs pa la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa la ni bdag med pa 'gal ba can ma yin la /
analyzed: bsam spangs pa la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa la ni bdag med pa 'gal ba can ma yin la /
translated: For the noble listeners and so on, selflessness is not contradictory.

original: lam gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yon tan gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yon tan gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no other path. This means that the third quality does not exist.

original: ji srid smra ba zhes bya ba ni smra ba po nyid do //
analyzed: ji srid smra ba zhes bya ba ni smra ba po nyid do //
translated: As long as there is speech, there is the nature of speech.

original: nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis 'u bu cag la sogs pa rnams la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis 'u bu cag la sogs pa rnams la khyab pa yin te /
translated: The fault is in those who are like us, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba yin la ma mthong ba de la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba yin la ma mthong ba de la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not see the absence of passion, and because there is no turning back for those who do not see it.

original: yang na smra ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rnam par rtog pa'i go byed yin zhes zer ba ni //üîΩsmra ba ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na smra ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rnam par rtog pa'i go byed yin zhes zer ba ni // smra ba ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or else, the statement that the speaker is the cause of the understanding of the conceptual differentiation of effect and cause isüîΩthe statement that the speaker is the cause of the understanding of the conceptual differentiation of effect and cause.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi rnam pa la don du zhen pa'i 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi rnam pa la don du zhen pa'i 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: Conceptual differentiation is the error of adherence to an object in its aspect.

original: de ma yin pa la der zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa la der zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an adherence to what is not that as that.

original: gal te yang lus pa ni lam tsam las ma nyams pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang lus pa ni lam tsam las ma nyams pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the remainder is the mere path that has not declined,üîΩand it is only the seeing of the aspect of its special existence in that which causes one to apply oneself to another path.

original: de la yod pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa mthong ba kho na las 'di ni lam gzhan la sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni 'di las lhag mar yod pa ma yin pas ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: de la yod pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa mthong ba kho na las 'di ni lam gzhan la sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni 'di las lhag mar yod pa ma yin pas ma lus pa'o //
translated: The statement that there is nothing more than this is the remainderless.

original: goms phyir ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi rnam pa'i yul las so //
analyzed: goms phyir ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi rnam pa'i yul las so //
translated: The statement that it is due to practice is due to the object of the special aspect.

original: the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'gal ba'i bsgrub pa las ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'gal ba'i bsgrub pa las ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDoubt‚Äù is not established because of the reversal of the non-contradictory proof.

original: rnam par rtog pa bsgrub pa la yang zhes bya ba ni de med kyang shin tu goms pa yin na tshig re re dang ngag re re rjod par byed pa rnams la rnam par rtog pa med kyang smra bar mthong ba'i phyir mi shes kyang de rnam yodüîΩpa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bsgrub pa la yang zhes bya ba ni de med kyang shin tu goms pa yin na tshig re re dang ngag re re rjod par byed pa rnams la rnam par rtog pa med kyang smra bar mthong ba'i phyir mi shes kyang de rnam yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven in the proof of conceptual thought‚Äù means that even without that, if there is complete familiarity, then in those who utter each word and each sentence, even without conceptual thought, speech is seen. Therefore, it is not that conceptual thought does not exist.

original: rang rig par bya ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig par bya ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is to be known by oneself, there is no other conceptual thought.

original: 'phen pa ste goms pa'i shugs kyis gdul bya de'i bsam pa can la de'i lam dngos su mthong ba kho na las rnal 'byor pa'i tshig 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phen pa ste goms pa'i shugs kyis gdul bya de'i bsam pa can la de'i lam dngos su mthong ba kho na las rnal 'byor pa'i tshig 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Propelled by the force of familiarity, the yogi‚Äôs words engage only in the path of that disciple who has that intention.

original: ji ltar 'u bu cag la sogs pas ka ba la sogs pas ka ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'u bu cag la sogs pas ka ba la sogs pas ka ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as we and others say ‚Äúthis is a pillar‚Äù with a pillar, etc.

original: bshad zin zhes bya ba ni rtog pa 'di rnams so sor ma rig pa kho na skye ba 'am zhig pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad zin zhes bya ba ni rtog pa 'di rnams so sor ma rig pa kho na skye ba 'am zhig pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAlready explained‚Äù means that these thoughts are not produced or destroyed by mere non-apprehension.

original: de'i tshe rnam rtog ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam rtog ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, it means that they are not thoughts.

original: don gang blo la rab gsal ba //
analyzed: don gang blo la rab gsal ba //
translated: That which is clear to the mind

original: sgra ni de la tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: sgra ni de la tshad ma nyid //
translated: is valid cognition with regard to that.

original: don gyi de nyid rgyu can min //
analyzed: don gyi de nyid rgyu can min //
translated: The reality of the object is not caused.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rna ba'i rnam shes la don gang gsal ba ni smra ba po'i blo'i yul la don de ltar yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rna ba'i rnam shes la don gang gsal ba ni smra ba po'i blo'i yul la don de ltar yin pa'i phyir /
translated: With regard to the object that is clear to the ear consciousness, that object is the object of the speaker‚Äôs mind. Because it is like that,

original: skyon med par bstan pa'i phyir skyon med par bstan pa ni 'dir ni shes pa mi gsal bar zhes bya @310b ba'o ;
analyzed: skyon med par bstan pa'i phyir skyon med par bstan pa ni 'dir ni shes pa mi gsal bar zhes bya @310b ba'o ;
translated: in order to demonstrate that there is no fault, the demonstration of no fault is ‚ÄúHere, the cognition is not clear.‚Äù

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa bzhin du mngon sum gyis kyang gzhan gyi don thob par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa bzhin du mngon sum gyis kyang gzhan gyi don thob par bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, just as with inference, it is demonstrated that the meaning is obtained by direct perception as well:

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception sees‚Äù and so on.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags su bstan pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa mngon sum pa ma yin pa la yin gyi bum pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags su bstan pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa mngon sum pa ma yin pa la yin gyi bum pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The indication of the trimodal mark is for the sake of others, not for one's own sake.

original: de lta yin na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yin /
analyzed: de lta yin na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yin /
translated: If that is so, how is it an inference?

original: rtags bzhin du gzhan gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags bzhin du gzhan gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates in another the cognition of the inferential object, just as the mark does.

original: de lta yin na de'i de rang don kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na de'i de rang don kho na yin no //
translated: If that is so, then that is only for one's own sake.

original: de lta yin na yang smra ba po'i de de lta yin pa'i phyir de ltar brjod do //
analyzed: de lta yin na yang smra ba po'i de de lta yin pa'i phyir de ltar brjod do //
translated: Even if that is so, it is stated that way because the speaker's is that way.

original: gzhan du rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tshig rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tshig rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the statement of the inferential object would be an inference.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi yul gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi yul gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is because it generates the cognition of the object of perception,

original: mngon sum yang gzhan gyi don du cis mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon sum yang gzhan gyi don du cis mi 'gyur /
translated: why is perception not for the sake of others?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: de de la 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de de la 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not a valid cognition itself, due to not having the nature of being related to that.

original: don rtogs pa la brda can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs pa la brda can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sign is the means of understanding the object.

original: ji ltar yang tshul gsum par bstan pa ni de rig pa po la rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag par nye bar gdags su rung ba'i phyir sgra tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yang tshul gsum par bstan pa ni de rig pa po la rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag par nye bar gdags su rung ba'i phyir sgra tshad ma yin no //
translated: And since the statement of the trimodal condition is the cause of the inferential cognition in the person who knows the trimodal condition, it is proper to designate the statement as an inference. Thus, the statement is a means of valid cognition.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'dod nas de ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'dod nas de ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: But not otherwise.

original: nus pa mtshon par byed pa'i rgyu tshig ni zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa mtshon par byed pa'i rgyu tshig ni zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The statement is made in this way because it is desired to show that the statement is the cause of the indication of the capacity.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i tshig yod pa min na rnam par nges pa med pa'i phyir smra ba po nyid ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i tshig yod pa min na rnam par nges pa med pa'i phyir smra ba po nyid ma nges pa yin no //
translated: And since there is no statement that is devoid of conceptualization, the speaker himself is not ascertained, because there is no ascertainment.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du ni 'gal ba med par sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du ni 'gal ba med par sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: But it is not contradictory to say that he is possessed of attachment, etc.

original: ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: The inclusion of the doubt concerning the counter-pervasion is

original: de phyir sgra yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de phyir sgra yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: therefore, the statement ‚Äúsound is also . . . ‚Äù

original: lus la 'am gzugs la sogs pa la yang bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya bar yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: lus la 'am gzugs la sogs pa la yang bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya bar yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: The self is also grasped as the body, form, etc., and as the ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the view of the self and the mine not a cause of the defilements?

original: 'on kyang gtso bo dang cig shos ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gtso bo dang cig shos ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: However, the primary and secondary are grasped as the agent.

original: dran pa yang bdag la sogs par lta ba spangs pa yin yang /
analyzed: dran pa yang bdag la sogs par lta ba spangs pa yin yang /
translated: Also, mindfulness is abandoned in the view of the self, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyun la ni thog ma med pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir sems kyi rgyun las nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyun la ni thog ma med pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir sems kyi rgyun las nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: However, the stream of defilements is not abandoned from the stream of mind because it has a beginningless cause.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa la smra ba por ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma yin no //üîΩyod pa la mi rtag pa nyid lta bu'o snyam du sems @311a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa la smra ba por ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma yin no // yod pa la mi rtag pa nyid lta bu'o snyam du sems @311a * //
translated: Therefore, since there is no opposing factor, there is no doubt that attachment, etc., are abandoned by the path of vision.

original: pa ni / gal te gzhan las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa ni / gal te gzhan las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The thought that it is like impermanence in regard to what exists is stated in the line: ‚ÄúIf it is from another.‚Äù

original: bde ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid 'dzin pa dang / dran pa'i rgyud las nyes pa rnams zad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid 'dzin pa dang / dran pa'i rgyud las nyes pa rnams zad pa ma yin la /
translated: and the cause of the exhaustion of faults in the continuum of memory is not the establishment of the non-existent.

original: de'i phyir med pa sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the establishment of the non-existent.

original: 'on te bdag la sogs par lta ba spangs pa la ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthong pa ma yin snyam na yang /
analyzed: 'on te bdag la sogs par lta ba spangs pa la ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthong pa ma yin snyam na yang /
translated: But if you think that the cause of the afflictions is not the view of self, etc.,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: de ma dmigs pa ni 'dod chags med pa las ma dmigs pa bzhin du rung ba ma yin pa'i yul can la ni med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de ma dmigs pa ni 'dod chags med pa las ma dmigs pa bzhin du rung ba ma yin pa'i yul can la ni med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of that is not tenable, like the non-apprehension of non-attachment. The subject that has an unreal object does not establish the non-existent.

original: nyes pa zad pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúthe non-exhaustion of faults.‚Äù

original: bde ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi shes pa bdag dang 'brel pa med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /üîΩthal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi shes pa bdag dang 'brel pa med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin te / thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni //
translated: The cognition that is the cause of pleasure, etc. is not related to the self, and therefore is not the cause of attachment, etc.

original: ma mthong ba ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúHow can it be seen?‚Äù

original: de lta yin na zhig pa nyid du ji ltar rtog ce na /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhig pa nyid du ji ltar rtog ce na /
translated: If that is so, how can it be conceived as just ceased?

original: skyon rnams mi zad pa nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skyon rnams mi zad pa nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfaults are not exhausted‚Äù is stated.

original: gang las bsgrub bya la sbyor bar byed pa rtogs pa yin gyi sbyor bar mi byed pa la ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang las bsgrub bya la sbyor bar byed pa rtogs pa yin gyi sbyor bar mi byed pa la ni ma yin la /
translated: The realization that connects to the probandum is the proof, not the one that does not connect.

original: de yang 'jigs pa med na rtag pa nyid yin na mi rtag pa la yang rgyun dang ldan pa la sems bzhin du rgyud gcod par byed pa'i thabs med pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang 'jigs pa med na rtag pa nyid yin na mi rtag pa la yang rgyun dang ldan pa la sems bzhin du rgyud gcod par byed pa'i thabs med pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, if there is no fear, it is permanent. If it is impermanent, there is no method to cut the continuum of that which is continuous, like the mind.

original: yod kyang so so'i skye bo bzhin du yongs su mi shes pa yin na'o //
analyzed: yod kyang so so'i skye bo bzhin du yongs su mi shes pa yin na'o //
translated: Even if there is, it is not fully understood, like that of an ordinary being.

original: 'on kyang rgyu zhes bya ba sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu zhes bya ba sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: However, the cause is the one that connects.

original: rtag pa nyid ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Permanence is not established.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rnam par bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rnam par bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the reason of being endowed with the arising of attachment and so on is eliminated.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma bcad pa ni sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma bcad pa ni sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Since the dissimilar class is not eliminated, it is not the proof.

original: rgyu yod phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu yod phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the cause exists‚Äù is stated.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the cause is not incomplete.

original: yod kyang grang ba bzhin du rgyu la mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod na rtsa ba dang bcas pa chad par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod kyang grang ba bzhin du rgyu la mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod na rtsa ba dang bcas pa chad par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Even if it exists, if there is an opposing factor to the cause, it is cut off together with its root.

original: gnyen po zhes bya ba ste /üîΩgnyen po yang rgyu'i ngo bo shes na de dang 'gal ba can du mkhas pas shes pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnyen po zhes bya ba ste / gnyen po yang rgyu'i ngo bo shes na de dang 'gal ba can du mkhas pas shes pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught in the line, ‚ÄúThe antidote.‚Äù

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one knows the nature of the cause, one knows that it is opposed by the antidote. This is taught in the line, ‚ÄúThe nature of the cause.‚Äù

original: 'grel par ni rgyu yod pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du bzhed de /
analyzed: 'grel par ni rgyu yod pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du bzhed de /
translated: In the commentary, ‚Äúthe existence of the cause‚Äù is accepted as ‚Äúbeing endowed with a cause.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught in the line, ‚ÄúBeing endowed with a cause.‚Äù
