original: phyi rol ni mar khu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol ni mar khu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The external is the ghee, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
translated: The external is the wind, etc.

original: nus mthu la sogs pa'i khyad par med pa ni sman gyi rdzas rnams nye bar 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus mthu la sogs pa'i khyad par med pa ni sman gyi rdzas rnams nye bar 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of special potency, etc., is because the medicinal substances are destroyed.

original: bdag med par lta ba ni zhes bya ba ni yul lhan cig byed pa can nyid kyi phyir 'joms pa ma yin /
analyzed: bdag med par lta ba ni zhes bya ba ni yul lhan cig byed pa can nyid kyi phyir 'joms pa ma yin /
translated: The view of selflessness is not destroyed because it is the object that is the co-creator.

original: log @311b par rtog pa med pa nyid ni bdag med pa'i yul la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba'i bdag tu 'am /
analyzed: log @311b par rtog pa med pa nyid ni bdag med pa'i yul la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba'i bdag tu 'am /
translated: The absence of false imagination is the object of selflessness, etc., and the uncommon form, etc.üîΩIf one grasps the self and what belongs to the self in the self or in the uncommon, then one is destroyed by the view of the transitory collection, and one is destroyed by the view of annihilation.

original: thun mong ma yin par 'dzin par byed na de chad pa la bdag chad par sems par byed pa ni mi 'chad par sred pa dang ma bral ba yang dang yang du de nye bar len pas rnam par bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs par
analyzed: thun mong ma yin par 'dzin par byed na de chad pa la bdag chad par sems par byed pa ni mi 'chad par sred pa dang ma bral ba yang dang yang du de nye bar len pas rnam par bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs par
translated: The one who is not free from craving for non-cessation is repeatedly destroyed by grasping that.

original: ni pha rol pos kyang khas blangs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ni pha rol pos kyang khas blangs pa kho na yin no //
translated: This is accepted by the opponent.

original: bde bar gshegs pa bcom ldan 'das ni skyes pa gzhan bzhin tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa bcom ldan 'das ni skyes pa gzhan bzhin tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: The Sugata, the Blessed One, is a valid cognizer for others, like another person.

original: bdag cag rig byed 'don pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag cag rig byed 'don pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: But we who recite the Vedas are not.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan la tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan la tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Because for others, he is not a valid cognizer.

original: nye bar ston par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar ston par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not teach.

original: rig byed ni de dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa kho na lta bu yin gyi bcom ldan 'das ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed ni de dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa kho na lta bu yin gyi bcom ldan 'das ni ma yin te /
translated: The Vedas are like the eye, etc. that possess that, but the BhagavƒÅn is not,üîΩbecause they are different.

original: tha dad pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúEven if.

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúeven though.‚Äù

original: 'on te gzhan yang tshig gi sgo nas tshad ma yin zhe na yang bden te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yang tshig gi sgo nas tshad ma yin zhe na yang bden te /
translated: If you say that the Vedas are valid because of their words, that is true,

original: phyin ci ma log par smra ba yin na de lta yin gyi bcom ldan 'das ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par smra ba yin na de lta yin gyi bcom ldan 'das ni ma yin te /
translated: but if they are not speaking falsely, that is not the case for the BhagavƒÅn,

original: rig byed tshad mas gnod pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rig byed tshad mas gnod pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ba ni /
translated: because he is the object that is harmed by the valid knowledge of the Vedas.

original: tshad ma ni phyin ci ma log pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma ni phyin ci ma log pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúValid knowledge is nonerroneous.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med par rtogs na phyin ci log la dga' ba byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med par rtogs na phyin ci log la dga' ba byed pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äù If one realizes that there is no beginning or end, one does not delight in error.

original: ma yin te ;
analyzed: ma yin te ;
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: rig byed la ni skyob pa med pas dor ba'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig byed la ni skyob pa med pas dor ba'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the Vedas are a limb to be discarded, since they do not protect.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is the opposite of that.

original: nya phyis la dngul gyi shes pa ni zin pa kho na'i phyir mi 'dod par thugs rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul gyi shes pa ni zin pa kho na'i phyir mi 'dod par thugs rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The consciousness of silver in a shell is not accepted because it is only a grasping, but it is said to be due to the power of compassion.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni skyob pa mngal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni skyob pa mngal ba'i phyir /
translated: The Lord is a protector because he is compassionate.

original: phyin ci log la gnod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log la gnod par byed pa yin te /
translated: He is a foe-destroyer because he harms the perverted.üîΩHe is a protector because he is not a valid cognition.

original: de la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni skyob pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni skyob pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained by the word ‚Äúprotector.‚Äù

original: de rnam par 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de rnam par 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: nyid gzigs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyid gzigs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe sees reality.‚Äù

original: mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can ni rang gi tshig mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can ni rang gi tshig mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: He is a foe-destroyer because he sees his own words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The Lord is also like that.

original: gzhan du yang slu ba'i bsam pa ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan du yang slu ba'i bsam pa ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it seen that he has a deceptive intention in other cases?

original: 'bras med phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras med phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúBecause there is no result.‚Äù

original: thob par bya ba ma lus pa brnyes pa ni gzhan du gsungs pa la dgos pa med do //
analyzed: thob par bya ba ma lus pa brnyes pa ni gzhan du gsungs pa la dgos pa med do //
translated: For one who has attained all that is to be attained, there is no need for other statements.

original: thob par bya ba ma thob pa'i ched du bdag tu lta ba can ni gzhan du yang smra ba yin te /
analyzed: thob par bya ba ma thob pa'i ched du bdag tu lta ba can ni gzhan du yang smra ba yin te /
translated: But those who have the view of self, who have not attained what is to be attained, speak of other cases.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩthob @312a * //
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to // thob @312a * //
translated: The meaning is that they do not have perfect abandonment.

original: bar bya ba thob kyang 'phags pa nyan thos bzhin du dgos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bar bya ba thob kyang 'phags pa nyan thos bzhin du dgos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though they have obtained what is to be obtained, they do not teach, just like the ƒÅrya ≈õrƒÅvakas, because they have no need.

original: nye bar mi ston pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: nye bar mi ston pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it just that they do not teach?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: thugs rje dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig la 'jug par ston par mdzad pa ni thugs brtser ldan phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thugs rje dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig la 'jug par ston par mdzad pa ni thugs brtser ldan phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The compassionate one is said to engage in the welfare of others alone.

original: gzhan gyi don du ni rang la dgos pa med kyang gzhan gyi don gyi dgos pa tshig gi byed pa gang la yin pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis gsungs pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du ni rang la dgos pa med kyang gzhan gyi don gyi dgos pa tshig gi byed pa gang la yin pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis gsungs pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Even though there is no need for the welfare of others, the purpose of the welfare of others is stated with the distinction ‚Äúthe purpose of the activity of speech.‚Äù

original: thugs rje dang ldan pa yang dbang po las 'das pa shes par mi nus pa mi mkhyen na rmongs pas ston par byed par rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: thugs rje dang ldan pa yang dbang po las 'das pa shes par mi nus pa mi mkhyen na rmongs pas ston par byed par rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the compassionate one is not able to know what is beyond the scope of the faculties, is it not understood that he teaches out of ignorance?

original: rtsom kun yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtsom kun yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: All compositions are said to be.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i don du rtsom pa ni rtsom kun no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i don du rtsom pa ni rtsom kun no //
translated: The composition of all treatises is for the sake of omniscience.

original: de la mngon par sbyor ba ni goms pa las so //
analyzed: de la mngon par sbyor ba ni goms pa las so //
translated: And the application to that is from cultivation.

original: de'i phyir dran pa goms pas yid gsal ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa goms pas yid gsal ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the mind is clear from the cultivation of mindfulness,

original: skye ba snga ma la sogs pa dran pa yin na chos dang chos ma yin pa shes pa dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyi de nyid shes pa yin na /
analyzed: skye ba snga ma la sogs pa dran pa yin na chos dang chos ma yin pa shes pa dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyi de nyid shes pa yin na /
translated: if there is recollection of former lives, etc., then there is knowledge of dharma and nondharma, and knowledge of reality, which is the distinction of the nature of cause and effect.

original: khyad par ma lus pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su dpag pa goms pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das par shes par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par ma lus pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su dpag pa goms pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das par shes par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But it is not possible to know what is beyond the senses, because of the cultivation of inference of all the aspects of the distinction.

original: 'bras bu med phyir zhes bya ba 'di kho nas dgos pa med pa bzhin du des dpog pa'i rgyu med pa yin par yang bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu med phyir zhes bya ba 'di kho nas dgos pa med pa bzhin du des dpog pa'i rgyu med pa yin par yang bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the absence of effect‚Äù shows that, like the absence of purpose, the absence of cause is also inferred by that.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the absence of cause‚Äù is stated.

original: thugs ni brtse bar ldan phyir dang // rtsom pa kun la sbyor ba'i phyir //
analyzed: thugs ni brtse bar ldan phyir dang // rtsom pa kun la sbyor ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of his compassion and his application to all compositions,

original: zhes bya ba dag gis ston pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag gis ston pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: These two verses explain the reason for the teaching.

original: thugs rje ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thugs rje ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is because of his compassion.

original: 'phel ba'i shugs las zhes bya ba ni goms pa phul du byung bas rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bas ston pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i shugs las zhes bya ba ni goms pa phul du byung bas rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bas ston pa yin par brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù refers to the excellence of practice, and ‚Äúfrom the force of his growth‚Äù refers to the excellence of the teacher, who is free from conceptual thought.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bcom ldan 'das ni mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bcom ldan 'das ni mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One is non-deceptive.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa bzhin du tshad ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa bzhin du tshad ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: He is like a valid cognition, like perception and inference.

original: des na skyob pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na skyob pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One is a protector.

original: ston pa ni gsal bar mdzad pa yin la /
analyzed: ston pa ni gsal bar mdzad pa yin la /
translated: The teacher is one who illuminates.

original: de 'phen pa las yod pa'i 'bras bu med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par dpyad par bya ba mu stegs dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rnam grangs ji lta ba bzhin du dogs pa sngon su 'gro ba can du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de 'phen pa las yod pa'i 'bras bu med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par dpyad par bya ba mu stegs dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rnam grangs ji lta ba bzhin du dogs pa sngon su 'gro ba can du bstan pa ni /
translated: The three kinds of distinctions, because there is no effect that exists by being projected by that, and so forth, are to be analyzed. The three kinds of distinctions are taught as having the prior apprehension of the tƒ´rthikas, noble ≈õrƒÅvakas, and bodhisattvas, respectively.

original: gal te rang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said, by itself, and so on.

original: @312b 'di yang de lta bu'i rnam pa can kho nar cis mi 'gyur snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: @312b 'di yang de lta bu'i rnam pa can kho nar cis mi 'gyur snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Why would it not be just like that? It is thought, If it is said, 'in this way too,' and so on.

original: 'o na 'di la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na 'di la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here too, it is thought, If it is said, 'in this way too,' and so on.

original: don gyi gtso bo la mi slu bas de'i shes pa bzhin du de dang mtshungs pa'i bsgom pa'i tshogs pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan ni chos la sogs pa'i yul can du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi gtso bo la mi slu bas de'i shes pa bzhin du de dang mtshungs pa'i bsgom pa'i tshogs pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan ni chos la sogs pa'i yul can du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Since the principal object is undeceiving, the consciousness of that is understood to be the consciousness arisen from the assembly of meditation that is similar to it, the subject of phenomena, and so on.

original: de'i phyir de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dgag pa'i rgyu dang ldan par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dgag pa'i rgyu dang ldan par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the teaching that possesses the cause of the negation of the consciousness that has that aspect is as follows.

original: 'di la bshad zin te /
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin te /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: de ni bdag med pa mthong ba'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag med pa mthong ba'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThis is the vision of selflessness.

original: mi slu ba nyid tshad ma nyid du yongs su gcod pa yin na /
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid tshad ma nyid du yongs su gcod pa yin na /
translated: ‚Äù If non-deceptiveness is the definition of valid cognition,

original: 'di yongs su gcod par byed pa yang yongs su shes pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'di yongs su gcod par byed pa yang yongs su shes pa kho na yin la /
translated: then the ascertainment of that is the understanding of that,

original: de yongs su ma shes na de nyid shes par mi nus so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de yongs su ma shes na de nyid shes par mi nus so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: and if that is not understood, one cannot understand that.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúThe Lord.

original: skyob pa 'am zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis mi slu ba can nyid kho nar brtag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skyob pa 'am zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis mi slu ba can nyid kho nar brtag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚Äù Another synonym for ‚Äúsavior‚Äù is ‚Äúnon-deceptive.

original: yang na bden pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bden pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù This is taught by ‚Äúor.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / bden pa bzhi la sogs pa ston pa ni lci bar rtogs pa yin pa de la skyob pa yin par bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / bden pa bzhi la sogs pa ston pa ni lci bar rtogs pa yin pa de la skyob pa yin par bstan pa yin la /
translated: ‚Äù The teaching of the four noble truths and so on is the teaching of the heavy.

original: 'dir ni tshad mar 'thad pa bden pa tsam yul yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni tshad mar 'thad pa bden pa tsam yul yin no //
translated: Here, the object of valid cognition is merely the truth.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log dgag par bya ba la ltos bya nyung ba yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log dgag par bya ba la ltos bya nyung ba yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is less to be done in the negation of error, there is also no need for realization. This is the distinction.

original: rigs pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa gzhan la yang bdag la'am lus la sogs pa la bdag tu lta ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa thun mong pa la bdag gi'o zhes thun mong ma yin pa nyid du bdag gir lta ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: rigs pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa gzhan la yang bdag la'am lus la sogs pa la bdag tu lta ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa thun mong pa la bdag gi'o zhes thun mong ma yin pa nyid du bdag gir lta ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin la /
translated: In other treatises on reasoning, etc., it is taught that the view of self with regard to the self or the body, etc., and the view of mine with regard to the common form, etc., as if they were not common, are the cause of suffering.üîΩAnd that the opposite of that is the limb of liberation, etc.

original: de las bzlog par mthong ba ni byang grol gyi yan lag yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa kho na ma yin nam ;üîΩde'i phyir bden par ston pa thun mong ma yin pa ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de las bzlog par mthong ba ni byang grol gyi yan lag yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa kho na ma yin nam ; de'i phyir bden par ston pa thun mong ma yin pa ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: So why is it not just that?

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba ste /üîΩston par byed pa ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba ste /üîΩston par byed pa ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is it not just that?‚ÄùüîΩThe response is, ‚ÄúEven though it is taught that the view of self with regard to the self or the body, etc., and the view of mine with regard to the common form, etc., as if they were not common, are the cause of suffering, and that the opposite of that is the limb of liberation, etc.,

original: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyang lus la sogs pa la bdag med par lta ba kho na yin gyi bdag tu lta ba ni ma yin te 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyang lus la sogs pa la bdag med par lta ba kho na yin gyi bdag tu lta ba ni ma yin te 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Also, those who propound a self only view the body, etc. as selfless, not as a self, because there is no contradiction.üîΩThis is indicated by the words, ‚ÄúEven though devoid of reason.

original: rigs pa dang bral yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang bral yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄùüîΩSuffering is also of four kinds: impermanent, suffering, empty, and selfless.

original: sdug bsngal ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa las zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi la yang sdug bsngal gyi rnam par tha snyad 'dogs pa ni gzhan gyi rnam pa sdud par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩde 'di rnam pa gzhan la @313a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa las zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi la yang sdug bsngal gyi rnam par tha snyad 'dogs pa ni gzhan gyi rnam pa sdud par byed pa yin pa'i phyir / de 'di rnam pa gzhan la @313a * //
translated: The designation of suffering in terms of these four aspects is a way of subsuming other aspects.

original: yang mtshungs pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: yang mtshungs pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: One might think that this is also the same for other aspects.

original: de ltar bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa yin no /
translated: This is indicated by the words, ‚ÄúIt is taught in this way.üîΩ‚Äù

original: kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rkyen dang / rab tu bskyed pa'i rnam pa rnams dang / 'gog pa'i rnam pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa rnams dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rkyen dang / rab tu bskyed pa'i rnam pa rnams dang / 'gog pa'i rnam pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa rnams dang /
translated: The aspects of cessation are the aspects of cessation, peace, excellence, and definite emergence.

original: lam gyi rnam pa la yang lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa rnams sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa la yang lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa rnams sdud pa yin no //
translated: The aspects of the path are the aspects of path, suitability, achievement, and definite release.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the truth of suffering is as follows.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'o //
translated: Suffering is what is to be established.

original: kun 'byung rgyu ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung rgyu ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: Origination is the cause of samsara,

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun no //
translated: the continuum of birth and death.

original: de gang dag gi yin pa de dag ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de gang dag gi yin pa de dag ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Those who have that are called samsaric beings.

original: phung po zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: The aggregates are the subject.

original: skye ba snga ma las 'dir 'ongs pa dang / 'di nas de'i phyi mar 'gro ba 'khor ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: skye ba snga ma las 'dir 'ongs pa dang / 'di nas de'i phyi mar 'gro ba 'khor ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not samsara to come here from a previous birth and go from here to a later one?

original: de yang grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de yang grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: This is not so, he thinks.

original: goms las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: goms las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is from habituation.

original: de yang ci las yin /
analyzed: de yang ci las yin /
translated: What is it from?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni phung po kun tu 'dzin pa'i yid kyi chos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni phung po kun tu 'dzin pa'i yid kyi chos te /
translated: Desire, etc. are mental states that grasp the aggregates.

original: de las gsal ba khyab par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gsal ba khyab par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are seen to be clear and pervasive from that.

original: gzhan las byung ba ni de las khyad par du nges pas ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan las byung ba ni de las khyad par du nges pas ma yin la /
translated: It does not arise from another, because it is ascertained as a difference from that.

original: 'dod rgyal nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod rgyal nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not chance.

original: ci las she na /
analyzed: ci las she na /
translated: What is it from?

original: skyes pa'i phyir skye ba ste 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: skyes pa'i phyir skye ba ste 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Because it arises, it is birth, which is the effect.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ni med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ni med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is contrary to that, it is nonexistence.

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: If there is no cause, the effect does not occur,

original: rtag tu med par 'gyur ro //üîΩrgyu med de rgyu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag tu med par 'gyur ro // rgyu med de rgyu med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it would be permanent nonexistence.

original: skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Because there is no cause, there is no birth.

original: skye bar 'gal ba'i phyir ni med pa'i phyir rtag tu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar 'gal ba'i phyir ni med pa'i phyir rtag tu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is contrary to birth, it is nonexistence. It would be permanent existence.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni 'khor ba can nyid ni sdug bsngal dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni 'khor ba can nyid ni sdug bsngal dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The author of the commentary says that samsara is contrary to suffering.

original: de las bzlog pa khyab pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa khyab pa'i phyir //
translated: because the opposite of that is pervasion.

original: zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te 'dod chags zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is called ‚Äúattachment,‚Äù

original: de la bde ba'i rnam pa nyid bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bde ba'i rnam pa nyid bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: because the aspect of suffering exists just as the aspect of pleasure does,

original: 'gal ba nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid ma yin la /
translated: it is not contradictory.

original: ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it uncertain.

original: dug dang bcas pa'i bza' ba bzhin du sdug bsngal du ro gcig pa nyid kyis blang bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dug dang bcas pa'i bza' ba bzhin du sdug bsngal du ro gcig pa nyid kyis blang bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is not to be accepted, since it is of the same taste as suffering, like food that is poisoned. This is taught:

original: 'khor ba'i lam du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i lam du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the path of cyclic existence,‚Äù

original: gzhan du ni bde ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni bde ba nyid du'o //
translated: but not elsewhere, as pleasure.

original: bde ba'i rnam pa nyid ni dngos su ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam pa nyid ni dngos su ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of pleasure is not direct,

original: phung po rnams goms pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ri dvags 'chor ba po la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po rnams goms pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ri dvags 'chor ba po la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the aggregates arise from habituation, like the hunter and so on. This is the meaning.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa @313b ni ;
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa @313b ni ;
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment and so on‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'dod chags goms pa'i rgyu can ta //
analyzed: 'dod chags goms pa'i rgyu can ta //
translated: Attachment is the cause of habituation.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught:üîΩ‚ÄúAttachment is the cause of habituation.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba ni sa bon la sogs pa la yang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du goms pa la mi ltos par skye ba ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba ni sa bon la sogs pa la yang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du goms pa la mi ltos par skye ba ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúIn reality‚Äù means that, like a sprout, etc., from a seed, etc., it does not arise without depending on habituation.

original: de ltar skye ba ni dbang med pa nyid kyis dor bar mi nus pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba ni dbang med pa nyid kyis dor bar mi nus pa yin la /
translated: Such an arising is not to be abandoned by one who is powerless.

original: 'gro ba gzhan ni med pa'i phyir bde bar yang srid pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan ni med pa'i phyir bde bar yang srid pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: But it is possible to be happy by another way of life, since there is no other way of life.

original: gal te 'dod chags zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one is attached to pleasure,üîΩone is not liberated.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni goms pa las byung ba nyid kyang gcig tu bde ba nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni goms pa las byung ba nyid kyang gcig tu bde ba nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPleasure‚Äù is to be supplied with ‚Äúis not liberation.‚ÄùüîΩSince it arises from habituation, it is not to be abandoned by one who is powerful.

original: goms pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir dbang yod pa nyid kyis dor bar mi nus pa yin la 'gro ba gzhan 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar mi nus pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: goms pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir dbang yod pa nyid kyis dor bar mi nus pa yin la 'gro ba gzhan 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar mi nus pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: The other way of life is shown to be incapable of abandoning attachment, etc.:

original: gang gi tshe de nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When one is attached to that very pleasure,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa dang 'dra bas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa dang 'dra bas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: It is like a false imagination, thus it is a false imagination.

original: 'dod pa tsam gyi gzhi can nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam gyi gzhi can nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the same as being based on mere desire.

original: mngon par dga' ba'i ngo bo ni yid kyi bde ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba'i ngo bo ni yid kyi bde ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of delight is mental pleasure, not anything else.

original: de'i phyir goms pa las byung ba yin gyi dngos su ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir goms pa las byung ba yin gyi dngos su ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it arises from cultivation, not directly:

original: bde ba ni sems mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni sems mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Pleasure is the delight of the mind.

original: gzir pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir bde ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzir pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir bde ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that pleasure is the antidote to oppression, not by its own nature:

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that were so.

original: de nyid dang cig shos la mngon par dga' ba ni goms pa la mngon par dga' bas dngos su ba nyid du khyad par med na de kho na la goms pa nyid mchog yin zhes bya ba 'di la bye brag ci zhig yod ces zer ba la /
analyzed: de nyid dang cig shos la mngon par dga' ba ni goms pa la mngon par dga' bas dngos su ba nyid du khyad par med na de kho na la goms pa nyid mchog yin zhes bya ba 'di la bye brag ci zhig yod ces zer ba la /
translated: If there is no difference in the directness of delight in reality and delight in its opposite through delight in cultivation, what is the difference in this statement that cultivation of reality alone is supreme?

original: gal te de ni 'gyur med na //
analyzed: gal te de ni 'gyur med na //
translated: If it is not changeable,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: as stated.

original: de kho na nyid la mngon par dga' ba ni 'dor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la mngon par dga' ba ni 'dor ba ma yin te /
translated: One who delights in reality does not abandon it,

original: gnod pa can med par rtag tu yod pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: gnod pa can med par rtag tu yod pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: because it always exists without being harmed.

original: cig shos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin te /
translated: The other does not,

original: yul la gnod pas ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul la gnod pas ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is stopped by the harm of the object. This is the meaning.

original: rgyu de nyid kyis de kho na nyid ni 'dod pa la gnod pa byed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyis de kho na nyid ni 'dod pa la gnod pa byed par bstan pa ni /
translated: By that very cause, reality is taught to harm desire:

original: ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as desire, etc.

original: goms pa las byung bas thog ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: goms pa las byung bas thog ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of being born from cultivation, it is beginningless.

original: 'dus byas pa'i sdug bsngal nyid kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa'i sdug bsngal nyid kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The very suffering of the compounded is taught to be desire, etc.:

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of that, as stated.

original: bde ba nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal don dam pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal don dam pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The very bliss is not the ultimate suffering.

original: thams cad nyid la zhes bya ba ni yul la'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyid la zhes bya ba ni yul la'o //
translated: In all, as stated, is in regard to the object.

original: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin @314a * //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin @314a * //
translated: Suffering is to be accomplished through effort,

original: la ; bde ba ni de med pas rang bzhin gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: la ; bde ba ni de med pas rang bzhin gyis grub pa'o //
translated: but pleasure is not, since it exists naturally without that.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni bde ba med pa la ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni bde ba med pa la ste /
translated: In that case, in the absence of pleasure,

original: 'dod pa 'gal ba nyid kyis skrag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'gal ba nyid kyis skrag pa yin la /
translated: fear arises from the conflict of desire,

original: de goms pa ni rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de goms pa ni rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: and the cultivation of that is the engagement in it.

original: des na de med pa'i phyir ni skrag pa goms pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na de med pa'i phyir ni skrag pa goms pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of that, because of the absence of the cultivation of fear,

original: sdug bsngal de nyid la'am ni mi 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de nyid la'am ni mi 'dod pa la'o //
translated: in that very suffering, or in what is undesirable,

original: de med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba de la /
translated: because of the absence of that, in that which is called suffering,üîΩpleasure is stated as a branch of the relinquishment of the cause of suffering.

original: bde ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid 'dor ba'i yan lag tu brjod pa nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid 'dor ba'i yan lag tu brjod pa nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary is:

original: de'i phyir goms pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir goms pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called cultivation.

original: dpe bstan pa ni bu la chags pa la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa ni bu la chags pa la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The example is stated:

original: yod pa'i bu la mngon par chags pa dang ldan pa ni de med pa las sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa'i bu la mngon par chags pa dang ldan pa ni de med pa las sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
translated: One who is attached to an existent son suffers from the absence of that.

original: de la skrag pa goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la skrag pa goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is habituated to fear it.

original: de goms pa med na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu bu de nyid la bde ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de goms pa med na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu bu de nyid la bde ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If one is not habituated to it, the very child who is the cause of suffering is taught to be a cause of happiness:

original: bu skyes na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bu skyes na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen a child is born,üîΩone should not be afraid of suffering, but should be afraid of happiness.üîΩ‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gzhom par 'dod pas bde ba nyid gzhom par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhom par 'dod pas bde ba nyid gzhom par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one who desires to overcome suffering should overcome happiness itself.

original: de lta yin na ma spangs pa'i bde ba dang de'i rgyu la goms par bya ba yin gyi sdug bsngal ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ma spangs pa'i bde ba dang de'i rgyu la goms par bya ba yin gyi sdug bsngal ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, one should cultivate the happiness that is not abandoned, and its cause, but not suffering.

original: rtag tu 'dod pa dag dang ni //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /üîΩsdug bsngal gyi don du ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi don du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu 'dod pa dag dang ni // zhes bya ba ste / sdug bsngal gyi don du ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi don du'o //
translated: One should not be habituated to desire,üîΩbecause of the suffering of change.üîΩ‚ÄúFor the sake of suffering‚Äù means for the sake of the suffering of change.

original: sdug bsngal bskyed ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bskyed ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe generation of suffering‚Äù refers to the suffering of suffering.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa ni bskyed par bya ba'i bde bas skyes pa'i sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i don du ma yin no zhes 'di la 'jig rten pa'i dpe bsten pa ni 'dam rdzab ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa ni bskyed par bya ba'i bde bas skyes pa'i sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i don du ma yin no zhes 'di la 'jig rten pa'i dpe bsten pa ni 'dam rdzab ces bya ba'o //
translated: One who is endowed with discernment does not turn away from suffering born of the pleasure of creation. The worldly example for this is the statement, ‚Äúlike a swamp.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gang yang bde ba kho na skyes bu'i don yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang yang bde ba kho na skyes bu'i don yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is only pleasure that is the human goal, not anything else.

original: de yang sdug bsngal dang spel ma kho nar 'thob pa yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal dang spel ma kho nar 'thob pa yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: And that is obtained only when mixed with suffering. This is the idea.

original: de'i phyir dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yang dor bya ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yang dor bya ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even the suffering of the hells, etc., is not to be rejected,

original: bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause for obtaining pleasure.

original: 'on te bde ba thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the bodhisattvas spiritual conceptionüîΩ.

original: dmyal ba bzhin du sdug bsngal la yang bde bar 'gyur ba ni bsnyen bkur la sogs pa sdug bsngal chen po las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba bzhin du sdug bsngal la yang bde bar 'gyur ba ni bsnyen bkur la sogs pa sdug bsngal chen po las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Even suffering becomes pleasure for the bodhisattva, just as the hells, etc., are transformed into pleasant objects.

original: yang na 'khor ba pa'i dngos po gang dag 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la yang phung po ste /
analyzed: yang na 'khor ba pa'i dngos po gang dag 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la yang phung po ste /
translated: Or else, the aggregates are the things of samsara that arise and disintegrate.

original: spungs pa'i ngo bo yin gyi gcig gi ngo bo ma yin la /
analyzed: spungs pa'i ngo bo yin gyi gcig gi ngo bo ma yin la /
translated: They are the nature of a heap, not the nature of a single thing.

original: gzugs la sogs pa tha snyad kyi yul ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pas ni re re nas mi snang ba yin gyi 'dus pa yang mi snang @314b ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tha snyad kyi yul ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pas ni re re nas mi snang ba yin gyi 'dus pa yang mi snang @314b ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The object of conventional consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness is not different from the collection of subtle particles and so on. Therefore, the individual particles do not appear, but the collection does appear.

original: rab rib can gyi skra shad bzhin du rab rib can ma yin pas ni re rer yang snang ba kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rab rib can gyi skra shad bzhin du rab rib can ma yin pas ni re rer yang snang ba kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Just as the individual strands of hair appear to those with eye disease, the individual particles appear to those with eye disease, but not to those without eye disease.

original: rnal 'byor pas kyang rdul phra rab ba re re nas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa yin /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas kyang rdul phra rab ba re re nas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa yin /
translated: This is similar to the yogi‚Äôs seeing the individual subtle particles.

original: 'on te bdag cag la sogs pa'i dbang po las 'das pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag cag la sogs pa'i dbang po las 'das pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the individual particles are beyond the senses of ourselves and others,

original: rab rib can gyis skra shad rnams kyang re re ni dbang po las 'das pa yin na /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis skra shad rnams kyang re re ni dbang po las 'das pa yin na /
translated: then the individual strands of hair are also beyond the senses of those with eye disease.

original: 'dus pa la yang ji ltar phyin ci log yin /
analyzed: 'dus pa la yang ji ltar phyin ci log yin /
translated: How can the collection be mistaken?

original: de'i tshe ni de rnams ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni de rnams ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: But at that time, they are not not that.

original: ji ltar yang dbang po las 'das pa re re zhing rtsom byed ma yin pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dbang po las 'das pa re re zhing rtsom byed ma yin pa yin na /
translated: And if each of the atoms that are beyond the range of the senses does not create a sense-object, how can a collection of atoms create a sense-object?

original: dbang po'i rdzas rtsom byed ji ltar yin /
analyzed: dbang po'i rdzas rtsom byed ji ltar yin /
translated: How can a collection of atoms create a sense-object?

original: de'i phyir de nyid shin tu mi 'thad pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid shin tu mi 'thad pa chen po yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a very great error.

original: 'dis ni thag ring po'i sbrang bu'i phung po la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni re rer 'dzin pa med na ji ltar yin zhes bya bar mtshungs pa yin te /üîΩrab rib can gyis kyang spyi'i ngo bor skra mthong ba yin gyi bye brag tu ni ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni thag ring po'i sbrang bu'i phung po la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni re rer 'dzin pa med na ji ltar yin zhes bya bar mtshungs pa yin te / rab rib can gyis kyang spyi'i ngo bor skra mthong ba yin gyi bye brag tu ni ma yin la /
translated: This is similar to the question, ‚ÄúHow can one apprehend a mass of flies at a distance, if one cannot apprehend each individual fly?‚ÄùüîΩOne sees a generality of hair, not individual hairs.

original: gzhan la ni gnyis kar yin zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan la ni gnyis kar yin zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that one sees both the generality and the individual hairs.

original: de lta yin yang skra nyag re re ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin yang skra nyag re re ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if that were so, each individual hair would not be an object.üîΩBut if it is not visible, then the collection of atoms would not be visible, because the atoms are not visible.

original: 'on te mi snang bas yang phan tshun nye bas phul du byung ba skyed par byed pas de ltar snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi snang bas yang phan tshun nye bas phul du byung ba skyed par byed pas de ltar snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is claimed that the collection of atoms is visible because the atoms, although not visible individually, produce a special visual cognition when they come together,

original: de lta bur ni rdul phra rab la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta bur ni rdul phra rab la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The same is true of the atom.

original: rtag pa phul du byung ba ji ltar yin 'di yang gtan tsam yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa phul du byung ba ji ltar yin 'di yang gtan tsam yin te /
translated: How can it be permanent and also a whole? This is merely a hypothesis,

original: gnas skabs thams cad pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par 'byed pa nyams pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par 'byed pa nyams pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa yin no //
translated: because it is not in all circumstances, and because it is not tenable that the whole is destroyed when a part is destroyed.

original: rdul phra rab ni 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: The atom is not destroyed,

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it has no parts.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: sgra dang blo la sogs pa cha shas med kyang 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang blo la sogs pa cha shas med kyang 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sound, cognition, etc., are without parts, and yet are destroyed.

original: dbyibs dang ldan pa nyid kyis cha shas can yin na 'gal ba ci yod //
analyzed: dbyibs dang ldan pa nyid kyis cha shas can yin na 'gal ba ci yod //
translated: If it is a whole because it has shape, what is the contradiction?

original: steng dang 'og gi rdul phra rab dag gi bar na yod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bar du gcod par byed pa dang 'brel pa yin na phyogs gcig gis 'brel par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: steng dang 'og gi rdul phra rab dag gi bar na yod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bar du gcod par byed pa dang 'brel pa yin na phyogs gcig gis 'brel par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The atom is in the space between the upper and lower atoms, and is obstructed because it is resistant. If it is connected, it is not connected by one part.

original: cha'i shes pa 'di ni gnod pa can med pa'i phyir btags pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: cha'i shes pa 'di ni gnod pa can med pa'i phyir btags pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This cognition of parts is not a designation, because there is no contradiction.

original: cha la yang cha dang ldan pa nyid du gzhag pa ni cha shas rnams ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad kyi bong tshod dang lci ba nyi dag gi dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: cha la yang cha dang ldan pa nyid du gzhag pa ni cha shas rnams ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad kyi bong tshod dang lci ba nyi dag gi dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: And if a part is posited as having parts, then since the parts are infinite, there would be no difference in size or weight of any thing.

original: zhig pa'i mtha'i yin na mtha' yas pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhig pa'i mtha'i yin na mtha' yas pa mi 'thad do //
translated: No, because it is not tenable that the end of destruction is infinite.

original: ras ba la la sogs pa tshig pa la sogs pas zhig na cha shas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ras ba la la sogs pa tshig pa la sogs pas zhig na cha shas pa ma yin no //
translated: If a cloth, etc. is destroyed by burning, etc. it is not without parts.

original: de zhig pa la yang de lta bu'i rigs gzhan @315a * //
analyzed: de zhig pa la yang de lta bu'i rigs gzhan @315a * //
translated: And even if it is destroyed, another of the same type

original: ni de lta bu'i rigs gzhan las byung ba yin pa'i phyir gong bu med pas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis yul sun phyung bas chags pa med pa nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i sems ni sdug bsngal ma lus pa las grol bar 'gyur ba yin
analyzed: ni de lta bu'i rigs gzhan las byung ba yin pa'i phyir gong bu med pas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis yul sun phyung bas chags pa med pa nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i sems ni sdug bsngal ma lus pa las grol bar 'gyur ba yin
translated: arises from another of the same type. Therefore, since there is no whole, the mind that is not attached to the appropriated aggregates because it is disgusted with the object through the suffering of conditioned being is liberated from all suffering.

original: no // gong bu yod kyang sdug bsngal goms pa dang 'dzin par byed pa'i 'bad pas dbang po yul la sogs pas yid kyi bzung ba las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: no // gong bu yod kyang sdug bsngal goms pa dang 'dzin par byed pa'i 'bad pas dbang po yul la sogs pas yid kyi bzung ba las ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though the body exists, the mind is not grasped by the force of the habit of the suffering of the body or by the force of the habit of grasping the body, but rather by the force of the habit of the suffering of the object of the sense-faculty.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu yul sun ma phyung na the tshom med par sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes goms pa 'am 'dzin pa yang yid ni dka' ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu yul sun ma phyung na the tshom med par sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes goms pa 'am 'dzin pa yang yid ni dka' ba byed pa yin no //
translated: If the object is not rejected, the mind is grasped by the force of the habit of the suffering of the object, or by the force of the habit of grasping the object, without doubt.

original: ril por 'dzin pa ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The grasping of the body as a whole is not the cause of passion.

original: nam mkha' dang rtsva dang rdo ba la sogs pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang rtsva dang rdo ba la sogs pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not seen in the case of space, grass, wood, stone, etc.

original: dgos pa gang gi dbang gis dum bur byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs par cis mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dgos pa gang gi dbang gis dum bur byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs par cis mi 'gyur /
translated: Why is it not said that the body is divided into parts by the force of the need?

original: de'i tshe 'dod pa can med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dod pa can med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no one who desires at that time,

original: de lta yin na gong bur bye brag tu 'dzin pa kho na rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na gong bur bye brag tu 'dzin pa kho na rgyu yin no //
translated: then the cause is the grasping of the body as a whole.

original: rtog pa yin pa'i yul ni rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa yin pa'i yul ni rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object of imagination is not the cause,

original: bud med dang skyes pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni rnam rtog yin la /
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni rnam rtog yin la /
translated: then the imagination of the woman or the man is not the cause.

original: de yang ril por 'dzin pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de yang ril por 'dzin pa kho na yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is only the apprehension of the whole.

original: 'dis ni bzang po la sogs par 'dzin par bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni bzang po la sogs par 'dzin par bshad pa yin la /
translated: This explains the apprehension of the good, etc.

original: chags par bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam rtog gi bag chags kyang ril po'i bye brag gi bag chags yin no //
analyzed: chags par bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam rtog gi bag chags kyang ril po'i bye brag gi bag chags yin no //
translated: The latent impressions of the conceptual thoughts of the object of attachment, etc. are also latent impressions of the whole.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam par rtog pa la bde bar mngon par 'dod pa sdug bsngal goms pa yin par bstan pa zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam par rtog pa la bde bar mngon par 'dod pa sdug bsngal goms pa yin par bstan pa zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the desire for pleasure in the conceptual thought of suffering is the habituation to suffering.

original: bya ba la sbyor bzhin pa'i 'dod chags can ni bsnyen bkur dang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal kho nar rig pa yin yang bde ba'i rgyu nyid du len pa yin la /
analyzed: bya ba la sbyor bzhin pa'i 'dod chags can ni bsnyen bkur dang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal kho nar rig pa yin yang bde ba'i rgyu nyid du len pa yin la /
translated: The one who is attached while engaged in action, even though he knows that it is only suffering such as the suffering of service and desire, takes it as the cause of pleasure.

original: de la nye bar ston par byed na des bsams pa'i bde ba la sdug bsngal du ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la nye bar ston par byed na des bsams pa'i bde ba la sdug bsngal du ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: If he is taught otherwise, he is taught that the pleasure he imagines is suffering.

original: gzhan du na mi mthun pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gzhan du na mi mthun pa'i phyir la /
translated: Otherwise, it would be contradictory.

original: de lta yin na ni de ma yin pa la de 'di zhes nye bar bstan pa yang brdzun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni de ma yin pa la de 'di zhes nye bar bstan pa yang brdzun par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the statement ‚ÄúThis is not that, but it is this‚Äù would be false.

original: brdzun ni ma'i ming bzhin du yul sun phyung bas byang grol dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brdzun ni ma'i ming bzhin du yul sun phyung bas byang grol dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But a lie is not like the name of a mother, because it is conducive to liberation through the removal of the object.

original: de lta yin na de sun phyung ba 'dra ba'i yon tan ni byang grol du rigs pas sam /
analyzed: de lta yin na de sun phyung ba 'dra ba'i yon tan ni byang grol du rigs pas sam /
translated: If that were so, then the quality of being like the removal of that would be reasonable in liberation,

original: gzhan du yang rjes su gnang bar bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni des byed pa tsam gyis gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du yang rjes su gnang bar bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni des byed pa tsam gyis gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: or it would be permitted elsewhere, but not by just that action is it to be made clear.

original: de'i phyir phung po tsam 'di ni 'khor ba can yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po tsam 'di ni 'khor ba can yin la /
translated: Therefore, this mere collection is the one who transmigrates,üîΩand thus it is the one who suffers.

original: des na sdug bsngal lo zhes bsgom pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal lo zhes bsgom pa bstan pa ni /
translated: This is the teaching of the meditation.

original: legs pa yin @315b te ;
analyzed: legs pa yin @315b te ;
translated: It is good,

original: 'khor ba'i rtsa ba nas 'don pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rtsa ba nas 'don pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it removes the root of cyclic existence.

original: pha rol po'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po'i ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the opponent‚Äôs.

original: de'i phyir yan lag dang yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / skad cig ma drug gnas pa dang / rtag pa dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba la sogs pa dgos pa med pa can dam ma yin pa'i rtogs pas sbyar ba'i 'khrugs pa ni ci ni rjes su gnang ba thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag dang yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / skad cig ma drug gnas pa dang / rtag pa dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba la sogs pa dgos pa med pa can dam ma yin pa'i rtogs pas sbyar ba'i 'khrugs pa ni ci ni rjes su gnang ba thob pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the confusion of the non-Buddhist philosophers, who apply the concepts of part and whole, quality and qualified, six categories, permanence, universal, particular, inherence, etc., to things that do not require them, is not to be accepted as valid.

original: gnyid log pa na 'di yang 'di mthong ngo zhes spyad pa na mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnyid log pa na 'di yang 'di mthong ngo zhes spyad pa na mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But when one who is awake sees something, does he not say, ‚ÄúI saw it in a dream‚Äù?

original: 'di ni bdag med pa can gyi phung po rnams la 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag med pa can gyi phung po rnams la 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not tenable in the case of the aggregates, which are devoid of self.

original: de'i phyir gnyid dang sad pa'i dus kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyid dang sad pa'i dus kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the dream consciousness is continuous with the consciousness of the waking state.

original: de yang sgrub byed kyi shes pas rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de yang sgrub byed kyi shes pas rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is not that continuity established by a valid cognition?

original: mtshams sbyor ba'i shes pa rnams kyang snga ma'i shes pa'i bag chags ni shes pa phyi ma la mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba'i shes pa rnams kyang snga ma'i shes pa'i bag chags ni shes pa phyi ma la mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: And the consciousness that links death with rebirth is the consciousness that links the latent tendencies of the former to the latter.

original: bsdus pa can mal cha la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don mthong bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bsdus pa can mal cha la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don mthong bar byed pa yin la /
translated: The collection of bedding and so on is for the benefit of others.

original: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa yang 'dus pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa yang 'dus pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The body, sense faculties and so on are also collections.

original: gzhan gyi don byed pa yin na 'dus pa can ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don byed pa yin na 'dus pa can ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If they were for the benefit of others, they would not be collections.

original: 'dus pa can nyid yin na de yang gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa yin zhing sgrub byed ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dus pa can ma yin pa ni bdag yin te rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus pa can nyid yin na de yang gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa yin zhing sgrub byed ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dus pa can ma yin pa ni bdag yin te rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: If they were collections, then since they would also be for the benefit of others, there would be an infinite regress and they would not be established as collections. Therefore the self is not a collection because it is not divisible.

original: 'jig pa ma yin pa dang chags pa la yul yin pa'i dor bya ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ma yin pa dang chags pa la yul yin pa'i dor bya ma yin te /
translated: It is not a nonperishing substance because it is not a discard that is to be discarded.

original: don dam pa las bde ba kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la bde ba yang de las bzlog pas zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'du byed pa dang ldan pa ni shes pa snga ma dran pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: don dam pa las bde ba kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la bde ba yang de las bzlog pas zhes bya ba ste / 'du byed pa dang ldan pa ni shes pa snga ma dran pa kho na yin na /
translated: But if you think that pleasure alone is ultimate, then pleasure is the opposite of that.

original: ji ltar mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: If the prior consciousness is the one that possesses formative action, then how could it be a link of dependent origination?

original: shes pa snga ma'i 'du byed pa dang ldan pa kho na las shes pa phyi ma zhes mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa snga ma'i 'du byed pa dang ldan pa kho na las shes pa phyi ma zhes mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the subsequent consciousness is a link of dependent origination that is formed from the prior consciousness alone, which possesses formative action.

original: de nyid de'i ngo bo nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩphyi ma de nyid du 'du byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu mtshan yin na /
analyzed: de nyid de'i ngo bo nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro // phyi ma de nyid du 'du byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu mtshan yin na /
translated: Because it follows that it would be the same entity as that.

original: da ltar de'i rgyu mtshan gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: da ltar de'i rgyu mtshan gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is the reason for linking because it possesses formative action, then what is the point of another reason for it in the present?

original: 'dus pa can rnam par gzhag pa ma yin na ji ltar 'dus pa can yin zhes de yang rtog pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'dus pa can rnam par gzhag pa ma yin na ji ltar 'dus pa can yin zhes de yang rtog pa tsam yin te /
translated: If it is not established as a collection, then how could it be a collection?

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu la rgyu 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu la rgyu 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin la /
translated: That is also mere speculation, because the cause of an effect is not understood to be a noncause.

original: de yang 'bras bu nyid kyis rgyu gzhan du rtogs pa yin na yang thug pa med pa'i skyon @316a * //üîΩma yin zhing ;
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu nyid kyis rgyu gzhan du rtogs pa yin na yang thug pa med pa'i skyon @316a * // ma yin zhing ;
translated: Moreover, if the cause is understood through the effect, there is no fault of infinite regress.

original: bdag go zhes bya ba ni lus dang dbang po dang blo'i rig pa las tha dad pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag go zhes bya ba ni lus dang dbang po dang blo'i rig pa las tha dad pa yang ma yin /
translated: The so-called self is not different from the awareness of the body, faculties, and mind.

original: bstan bcos la mi rten pa'i 'jig rten pa'i nges pa yul yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos la mi rten pa'i 'jig rten pa'i nges pa yul yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not a worldly cognition that does not rely on treatises.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i 'dus pa la bdag go zhes goms pa'i phyir nges par byed la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i 'dus pa la bdag go zhes goms pa'i phyir nges par byed la /
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained through familiarity that the self is the collection of the body, faculties, and so on.

original: 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan dmigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma lus pa la khyab par byed pa la don dam pa'i bdag la sogs pa dmigs pa med bzhin pa ni de'i rtogs pas bdag nyid ji ltar 'khrul par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan dmigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma lus pa la khyab par byed pa la don dam pa'i bdag la sogs pa dmigs pa med bzhin pa ni de'i rtogs pas bdag nyid ji ltar 'khrul par byed par 'gyur /
translated: The non-collection, which is observed to possess qualities such as agency, pervades everything. The ultimate self and so on are not observed. How could one be mistaken about them through conceptualization?

original: rlung la sogs pa'i skyon las byung ba'i rmongs pa la sogs pa rnams kho na goms pa las gsal ba tsam yin gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i skyon las byung ba'i rmongs pa la sogs pa rnams kho na goms pa las gsal ba tsam yin gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not delusion, etc., which arise from the faults of wind, etc., merely clarified by practice, but not by their own nature?

original: rlung la sogs pa med na bong ba la sogs pa la rmongs pa la sogs pa rnams ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa med na bong ba la sogs pa la rmongs pa la sogs pa rnams ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If there is no wind, etc., there is no delusion, etc., with respect to a clod, etc.

original: 'on te yang 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te yang 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, it is said that desire, etc., arise from the practice of desire, etc.

original: lus dang bdag yongs su gyur pa rnams sam /
analyzed: lus dang bdag yongs su gyur pa rnams sam /
translated: The transformation of the body and self,

original: gzhan rnams kyi 'am /
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyi 'am /
translated: or of others,

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi ni 'dod chags pa rnams yon tan ma yin par bstan zin nas /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi ni 'dod chags pa rnams yon tan ma yin par bstan zin nas /
translated: or of the elements, has already been shown to be not a quality of desire, etc.

original: da ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi bdag nyid kyi khyad par yongs su gyur pa'i lus kyi rang bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu rnam pa gzhan gyis bkag pa yin pa'i phyir zlos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi bdag nyid kyi khyad par yongs su gyur pa'i lus kyi rang bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu rnam pa gzhan gyis bkag pa yin pa'i phyir zlos pa ma yin no //
translated: Now, the transformation of the body, which has the nature of wind, bile, and phlegm, is refuted by other reasons, such as being the cause of desire, etc., so it is not redundant.

original: dus min sgra dkar she ser dang // blo gsal rtul mang blo 'khrul dang // rmi lam du du ni 'od 'bar mthong //
analyzed: dus min sgra dkar she ser dang // blo gsal rtul mang blo 'khrul dang // rmi lam du du ni 'od 'bar mthong //
translated: The dream of a white or yellow light, or of a clear or dull mind, or of seeing a flame,

original: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi'o //
translated: is for one of a bilious temperament.

original: zhes mkhris pa'i rang bzhin zhe sdang yin pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes mkhris pa'i rang bzhin zhe sdang yin pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa ste /
translated: The statement that the nature of bile is hatred is mistaken,üîΩbecause it also exists for one of a windy nature, etc.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes ldog pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes ldog pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that it is not a perversion

original: 'khrul phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is because of the perversion of the dream.üîΩThe statement that it is a mixture of natures is because of the seeing of the result,

original: 'bras bu mthong ba las rlung gi rang bzhin can la mkhris pa'i rang bzhin yang yod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin snyam du sems pa ni rang bzhin 'dres pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong ba las rlung gi rang bzhin can la mkhris pa'i rang bzhin yang yod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin snyam du sems pa ni rang bzhin 'dres pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: since one of a windy nature also has a bilious nature.

original: mkhris pa ni ngo bo gang kho nas zhe sdang skyed par byed pa de kho nas dus ma yin pa'i skra dkar la sogs pa'i chos kyang skyed par byed pa'i phyir tshogs pa gcig las byung ba'i gzugs la ro bzhin du de yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mkhris pa ni ngo bo gang kho nas zhe sdang skyed par byed pa de kho nas dus ma yin pa'i skra dkar la sogs pa'i chos kyang skyed par byed pa'i phyir tshogs pa gcig las byung ba'i gzugs la ro bzhin du de yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Bile, by its very nature, produces hatred and also produces untimely gray hair, etc. Therefore, like taste, it would arise from a single collection.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: But it does not arise in that way.

original: 'bras bu med pa las kyang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin ni zhe sdang gi tshogs pa ma yin par go ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa las kyang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin ni zhe sdang gi tshogs pa ma yin par go ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The nature of bile is understood to be a collection of hatred, even though it does not have an effect.

original: de las gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Other than that‚Äù means other than that effect.

original: de ni zhes @316b bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes @316b bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the effect.

original: de la ni rgyu la'o //
analyzed: de la ni rgyu la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the cause.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa'i chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa'i chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Error‚Äù means that it is not a property of wind, etc.

original: thal 'gyur las ldog par bstan pa ni /üîΩde'i 'bras bu med na zhi //
analyzed: thal 'gyur las ldog par bstan pa ni / de'i 'bras bu med na zhi //
translated: The reverse of the reductio is shown:

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú If it has no effect, it is peace.‚Äù

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'i'o //
translated: ‚Äú Cause‚Äù means the collection.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin pa'i skra dkar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin pa'i skra dkar la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Other‚Äù means untimely gray hair, etc.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang las dpag pa'i mkhris pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang las dpag pa'i mkhris pa la'o //
translated: Here, in the case of bile, it is inferred from hatred.

original: bden te 'bras bu dus ma yin pa'i skra dkar la sogs pa med pa'i phyir mkhris pa'i rang bzhin med pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te 'bras bu dus ma yin pa'i skra dkar la sogs pa med pa'i phyir mkhris pa'i rang bzhin med pa yin no //
translated: True, but since there is no effect, such as untimely gray hair, there is no nature of bile.

original: de la zhe sdang ni de med kyang 'byung ba 'khrul pa can yin par bstan pa la /
analyzed: de la zhe sdang ni de med kyang 'byung ba 'khrul pa can yin par bstan pa la /
translated: There, it is shown that hatred arises even when that does not exist, being a mistaken superimposition.

original: gal te 'bras bu de zhes bya ba ni zhi sdang ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu de zhes bya ba ni zhi sdang ngo //
translated: If that effect, which is hatred,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu las zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du btags pa'i rgyu tshogs pa nyid ni 'bras bu ma rtogs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu las zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du btags pa'i rgyu tshogs pa nyid ni 'bras bu ma rtogs par bstan pa ni /
translated: how is it an effect? In the same way, the mere collection of causes designated as an effect is shown not to be realized.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bus yang rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bus yang rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the effect is also the unobstructed potential of the cause.

original: 'bras bu las bad kan gyi rang bzhin can du dpag pa las 'bras bu zhe sdang mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu las bad kan gyi rang bzhin can du dpag pa las 'bras bu zhe sdang mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: From the effect, it is inferred that the nature is phlegm. Since hatred is seen as the effect,

original: mkhris pa ni rang bzhin gzhan du brtag par mi nus te /
analyzed: mkhris pa ni rang bzhin gzhan du brtag par mi nus te /
translated: bile cannot be conceived as having a different nature.

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is too much, it is shown:

original: gal te mthong ba'i rgyu spangs nas //
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i rgyu spangs nas //
translated: If you reject the cause of seeing,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then you should not say that the eye sees.

original: rlung la sogs pa rnams kyang ji ltar yod pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa rnams kyang ji ltar yod pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Wind, etc. are not causes of attachment, etc. in the way that they are accepted to be.

original: yin na ni gang kho na'i tshe 'dod chags yin pa de kho na'i tshe zhe sdang la sogs rnams su 'gyur ro//
analyzed: yin na ni gang kho na'i tshe 'dod chags yin pa de kho na'i tshe zhe sdang la sogs rnams su 'gyur ro//
translated: If they were, then at whatever time there is attachment, at that very time there would be aversion, etc.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: This is demonstrated:

original: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par ni //
analyzed: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par ni //
translated: Because of the consequence that all would be the same as attachment,

original: thal phyir kun gyi chos ma yin //
analyzed: thal phyir kun gyi chos ma yin //
translated: they are not the properties of all.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i dus su yang dus mtshungs par 'dod chags mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i dus su yang dus mtshungs par 'dod chags mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of aversion, etc. it follows that all would be the same as attachment.

original: de bzhin du zhes sdang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba la sogs par brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes sdang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba la sogs par brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, it follows that all would be the same as aversion, etc.

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu skye dpar byed pa de nyid gzhan yang byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnams lhan cig par 'gyur ba 'am //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu skye dpar byed pa de nyid gzhan yang byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnams lhan cig par 'gyur ba 'am //
translated: Because the cause of the arising of the effect is the same as the cause of the other, the effects would be simultaneous.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Attachment and so on would also be similar.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir 'dod chags can dang / 'dod chags shas che ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o don to //
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir 'dod chags can dang / 'dod chags shas che ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not be possible to say that someone is attached or has a predominance of attachment, because the cause would be the same.

original: 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya nyid yin pa yang dri la sogs pa reg bya'i mthar thug pa ni sa'i ni dri dang reg bya dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya nyid yin pa yang dri la sogs pa reg bya'i mthar thug pa ni sa'i ni dri dang reg bya dag go //
translated: It is not definite that what is produced by mere primary elements is only odor and so on up to tactility, because odor and tactility are of earth,

original: chu'i ni ro dang reg bya dag go //
analyzed: chu'i ni ro dang reg bya dag go //
translated: taste and tactility are of water,

original: me'i ni gzugs dang reg bya dag go //
analyzed: me'i ni gzugs dang reg bya dag go //
translated: form and tactility are of fire,

original: rlung gi ni reg bya'o zhes bya bar nges pa ma yin nam /
