analyzed: rlung gi ni reg bya'o zhes bya bar nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: and tactility is of wind.

original: dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa'i nges pa bzhin du 'am /üîΩ'dod chags la sogs @317a * //
analyzed: dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa'i nges pa bzhin du 'am / 'dod chags la sogs @317a * //
translated: Or is it definite like the definiteness of white, yellow, and so on?

original: pa'i nges par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: pa'i nges par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Or is it definite like the definiteness of attachment and so on?

original: gzugs sogs bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIt is not like form and so on.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba la khyad par med kyang khyad par dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni khyad par can gyi rgyu gzhan du rtogs par byed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba la khyad par med kyang khyad par dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni khyad par can gyi rgyu gzhan du rtogs par byed par bstan pa ni /
translated: have a difference is taught to be due to the realization of another cause that has a difference.

original: der yang brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der yang brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is the same there.

original: de khas mi len na ni skyon yin no //
analyzed: de khas mi len na ni skyon yin no //
translated: If one does not accept that, there is a fault.

original: nus med rang bzhin med pas na //
analyzed: nus med rang bzhin med pas na //
translated: Since the powerless are essenceless,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba dag kyang khyad par du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba dag kyang khyad par du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: decrease and increase are not distinguished.üîΩSince all differences occur in all,

original: gang gi phyir khyad par thams cad kho na thams cad la 'byung ba yin zhes bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par thams cad kho na thams cad la 'byung ba yin zhes bya pa'i don to //
translated: the objection is the same there.üîΩSince each person has a difference in the elements such as wind,üîΩall are not the same.

original: khyad par gzhan yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes bu re re la rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las 'byung ba'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes bu re re la rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las 'byung ba'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since each person has a difference in the elements such as wind,

original: thams cad ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
translated: all are not the same.

original: rgyu gang gi yin pa'i khyad par de de lha bu yin gyi skyes bu thams cad kyi ni thams cad kyi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang gi yin pa'i khyad par de de lha bu yin gyi skyes bu thams cad kyi ni thams cad kyi chos ma yin no //
translated: The special cause of that is the son of a god, not the dharma of all persons.

original: thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa shin tu shas che ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //üîΩji ltar zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa shin tu shas che ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur ba ni ma yin no // ji ltar zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: If it were so, then all would be endowed with the extreme of passion, etc., but that is not the case.üîΩ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù means the special cause of passion, etc.,

original: gzhan yang rung ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: or of anything else.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par 'khrul pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par 'khrul pa nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means that the error is in the distinction.

original: 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa ni zhe sdang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa ni zhe sdang la yod pa'o //
translated: The result, passion, etc., is in aversion.

original: yang dag par ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: yang dag par ni bstan pa yin //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is taught correctly‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad yin te /
translated: means it is a joke.

original: yang dag pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i do to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i do to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot correctly‚Äù is the error.

original: gtan tshigs gang las zhes bya ba ni go byed las so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang las zhes bya ba ni go byed las so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the reason?‚Äù is from the one who understands.

original: thams cad kyi chos zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi chos zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe dharma of all‚Äù means passion, etc.

original: thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin na de la yod pa'i khyad par yang thams cad kyi rang bzhin kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin na de la yod pa'i khyad par yang thams cad kyi rang bzhin kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the nature of all, then the distinctions that exist in it would be the nature of all,

original: 'khrul par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because error would be the same.

original: gal te rlung la sogs pa gang yang rung rgyu nyid yin yang thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rlung la sogs pa gang yang rung rgyu nyid yin yang thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that even though wind, etc. are causes, not all of them are endowed with all attachment, etc.

original: thams cad du nges pa mthong ba las rjes su dpag pa'i nges pa'i khyad par lhan cig byed pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩ'on te 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis //
analyzed: thams cad du nges pa mthong ba las rjes su dpag pa'i nges pa'i khyad par lhan cig byed pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni / 'on te 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis //
translated: because the distinctions of ascertainment are inferred from the observation of ascertainment in all cases,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said:üîΩBut if it is by the distinction of effect,

original: de lta yin na lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par de nges pa'i rgyu goms pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par de nges pa'i rgyu goms pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the distinction of the co-existent cause is the cause of ascertainment,

original: de'i dbye bas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bye ba mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dbye bas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bye ba mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: because the distinction of attachment, etc. is seen by its division.

original: rtog pa gzhan yin na du ba yang me'i rgyu can du mi 'grub par bstan ni /
analyzed: rtog pa gzhan yin na du ba yang me'i rgyu can du mi 'grub par bstan ni /
translated: If it is another conception, it is taught that smoke is not established as having fire as its cause:

original: me ma mthong ba'i du ba gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: me ma mthong ba'i du ba gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is smoke without seeing fire?

original: me dang ldan pa'i yul ni me'i yul te de la'o //
analyzed: me dang ldan pa'i yul ni me'i yul te de la'o //
translated: The domain of fire is the domain of fire.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni me dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni me dang bral ba'o //
translated: From another is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.

original: rgyu'i khyad par @317b gyis khyad par du byed pa nyid kyis 'bras bu nyid la khyab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par @317b gyis khyad par du byed pa nyid kyis 'bras bu nyid la khyab par byed pa yin no //
translated: The effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.

original: bad kan gyi khyad par la yang khyad par can du mi 'gyur ba'i 'dod chags ni khyad par byed pa med pa'i phyir mi 'byug bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bad kan gyi khyad par la yang khyad par can du mi 'gyur ba'i 'dod chags ni khyad par byed pa med pa'i phyir mi 'byug bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.

original: khyad par dang bral bas zhes bya ba'o //üîΩmkhris pa'i khyad par yin na zhes sdang gi khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: khyad par dang bral bas zhes bya ba'o // mkhris pa'i khyad par yin na zhes sdang gi khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ;
translated: The cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.

original: khyab par byed pa med par ma grub pa yin zhes zer ba ni /üîΩma grub pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa med par ma grub pa yin zhes zer ba ni / ma grub pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa nyid dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa nyid dgag pa'o //
translated: The cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.üîΩThe effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.

original: ci las she na /
analyzed: ci las she na /
translated: The effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.üîΩThe cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of fire.

original: 'gyur ba yis zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yis zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis so //
translated: The effect is the domain of fire that is endowed with fire.

original: thams cad ni rlung la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni rlung la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The cause is the domain of fire that is devoid of

original: 'gyur ba yis zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yis zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy change‚Äù should be connected with ‚Äúby hatred.‚Äù

original: thams cad kyi 'gyur bas 'gyur ba can ni gang kho na'i yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'gyur bas 'gyur ba can ni gang kho na'i yang ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy change of all‚Äù means that it is not the change of just one.

original: thams cad kyi 'bras bu nyid kyang kun gyi chos ma yin zhes bya bar bkag par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'bras bu nyid kyang kun gyi chos ma yin zhes bya bar bkag par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe result of all‚Äù is not the property of all, as is shown by the negation.

original: kun las skye ba'ang zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun las skye ba'ang zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising from all‚Äù is taught.

original: gal te yang rgyu la khyad par yod kyang 'bras bu khyad par can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu la khyad par yod kyang 'bras bu khyad par can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if there is a difference in the cause, the result does not become different.

original: de lta na yang rang gi bos 'grub ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang gi bos 'grub ste /
translated: Even so, it is established by its own words.

original: 'di me dpar mi 'thad pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di me dpar mi 'thad pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is shown that this is not tenable:

original: rgyu ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause‚Äù

original: slar yang 'phel ba kho nas mkhris pa 'phel ba la tsa ba la sogs pa 'phen ba lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni tsha ba la sogs pa bzhin zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang 'phel ba kho nas mkhris pa 'phel ba la tsa ba la sogs pa 'phen ba lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni tsha ba la sogs pa bzhin zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike heat, etc.,‚Äù shows that it is like the increase of bile by the increase of heat, etc.

original: bcud kyis len pa la sogs pas chags pa 'phel ba la dgos pa dag gis bad kan 'phen na 'dod chags 'phen ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: bcud kyis len pa la sogs pas chags pa 'phel ba la dgos pa dag gis bad kan 'phen na 'dod chags 'phen ba ma yin nam /
translated: If phlegm is increased by the use of elixirs and so on, and if it is increased for the purpose of increasing passion, is not hatred increased?

original: de'i tshe bde ba'i khyad par 'byung bas rang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa las byung ba yin par bstan ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe bde ba'i khyad par 'byung bas rang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa las byung ba yin par bstan ni /
translated: At that time, a special pleasure arises, and it is taught that this arises from the full maturation of one's own propensities.

original: chags sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chags sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words passion and so on are used because hatred and so on are also included.

original: rgyu gzhan yod na yang zhes bya ba ni bad kan yod na yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yod na yang zhes bya ba ni bad kan yod na yang ngo //
translated: Even if there is another cause means even if there is phlegm.

original: 'bras pu gzhan ni zhe sdang mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'bras pu gzhan ni zhe sdang mthong ba yin la /
translated: The other effect is the seeing of hatred.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gzhan te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gzhan te /
translated: That refers to the other effect.

original: ma mthong ba'i khyad par ni rgyu la yod pa'o //üîΩkhyad par gzhan ni der zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i khyad par ni rgyu la yod pa'o // khyad par gzhan ni der zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The special nonseeing exists in the cause.üîΩ Another special refers to the cause.

original: rgyu la'o // de'i 'bras bu gzhan zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu la'o // de'i 'bras bu gzhan zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The other effect of that is connected to the words is seen.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin las zhe sdang gi rgyu gzhan dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin las zhe sdang gi rgyu gzhan dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: Just as passion is the cause of hatred because it has another cause,

original: khyad par gzhan du rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi khyad par yang de las gzhan pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu can yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan du rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi khyad par yang de las gzhan pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu can yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: In particular, one should think that the special desire is caused by a special cause other than that.

original: der yang de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der yang de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There also, it is called ‚Äúother than that.‚Äù

original: khyad par de zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin la yod pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par de zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin la yod pa'o //
translated: That special is in the nature of desire.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i khyad par gyi bskyed @318a * //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i khyad par gyi bskyed @318a * //
translated: The appearance is generated by a special appearance.

original: bya'o ; / ma mthong ba'i khyad par rgyu gang gis yin pa de'i ma mthong ba'i khyad par nyid do //
analyzed: bya'o ; / ma mthong ba'i khyad par rgyu gang gis yin pa de'i ma mthong ba'i khyad par nyid do //
translated: The special non-seeing is the very non-seeing by whatever cause.

original: thal 'gyur dang de las bzlog pa dag bde ba'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thal 'gyur dang de las bzlog pa dag bde ba'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reductio and its opposite are from the special bliss.

original: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par yin na 'dod chags kyi khyad par la khyad par gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par yin na 'dod chags kyi khyad par la khyad par gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is a special nature of desire, there is no other special desire.

original: ma yin du zin kyang rang gi ngo bo ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ma yin du zin kyang rang gi ngo bo ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: Even if it is not so, how is one‚Äôs own nature not changed?

original: gal te khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is called ‚Äúspecial,‚Äù

original: 'grib pa zhes bya ba ni med pa'o //
analyzed: 'grib pa zhes bya ba ni med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDiminution‚Äù is non-existence.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas thun mong gi rigs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas thun mong gi rigs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù and so on indicate the common reason.

original: de ltar rgyu ni 'phel par gyur pa na zhes bya ba dang / skyon rnams yod na yang zhes bya ba'i 'dis zlos pa ma yin zhing ;
analyzed: de ltar rgyu ni 'phel par gyur pa na zhes bya ba dang / skyon rnams yod na yang zhes bya ba'i 'dis zlos pa ma yin zhing ;
translated: ‚ÄúThus, when the cause increases‚Äù and ‚Äúwhen the faults exist‚Äù are not redundant.

original: rnam par 'grel pa nyid kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa nyid kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no redundancy and no repetition.

original: bad kan gyi khyad par yin pa yang khyad par med pa las sam /
analyzed: bad kan gyi khyad par yin pa yang khyad par med pa las sam /
translated: The difference in phlegm is not from a difference in the cause,

original: med pa las rgyu 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa las rgyu 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin te /
translated: nor is it from a non-cause, because desire is the result.

original: khyab par byed pa med pa'i phyir mi rigs te /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa med pa'i phyir mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that there is no pervader,

original: khams mnyam pa las byung ba bde ba lhan cig byed pa ni rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams mnyam pa las byung ba bde ba lhan cig byed pa ni rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the cause is the simultaneous arising of pleasure and the elements.

original: de dang ldan cig pa'i bad kan mi 'dod chags la 'khrul pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de dang ldan cig pa'i bad kan mi 'dod chags la 'khrul pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that the phlegm associated with it is not mistaken desire,

original: gal te bad kan 'phen na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bad kan 'phen na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then if phlegm increases,

original: gzhan gyis gegs byas nas zhes bya ba ni /üîΩlhan cig byed pa ma tshang na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gegs byas nas zhes bya ba ni / lhan cig byed pa ma tshang na'o //
translated: By another means by an obstruction.

original: cha mnyam las zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa las byung ba'i lhan cig pa'i bde ba las so //üîΩbde ba yang rang skyes pa tsam gyis skyed byed ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang khu ba 'phel ba'i rim gyis yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: cha mnyam las zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa las byung ba'i lhan cig pa'i bde ba las so // bde ba yang rang skyes pa tsam gyis skyed byed ma yin gyi / 'on kyang khu ba 'phel ba'i rim gyis yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: When the cooperating causes are incomplete, from an unequal part means from an unequal, simultaneous pleasure.üîΩPleasure is not produced merely by its own arising, but rather by the process of the increase of semen.

original: khu ba 'phel zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khu ba 'phel zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is indicated by the increase of semen.

original: de las ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: de las ni 'dod chags so //
translated: From that, there is passion.

original: khyad par yod na yang zhes bya bas bad kan ni 'dod chags la 'khrul par bstan nas /üîΩthun mong ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par yod na yang zhes bya bas bad kan ni 'dod chags la 'khrul par bstan nas / thun mong ba brjod pa ni /
translated: When there is a difference, phlegm indicates confusion about passion.

original: cha mi mnyam pa la'ang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: cha mi mnyam pa la'ang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The common expression is even from an unequal part.

original: de med kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de med kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: Even when that is absent, it exists.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni yon na 'ang med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni yon na 'ang med pa'o //
translated: The other is when there is no other, meaning when there is no other.

original: gzhan ni mi tshang ba bsgom pa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni mi tshang ba bsgom pa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The other is delighting in incomplete meditation.

original: zad nas zhes bya ba ni zhu ba'o //
analyzed: zad nas zhes bya ba ni zhu ba'o //
translated: Having been exhausted means having been melted.

original: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ldog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ldog pa med pa yin no //
translated: Even when that is absent, it exists, so there is no reversal.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan par 'dod nas rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan par 'dod nas rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
translated: The author wishes to show that there is no universal concomitance, and so he shows the nature of the thing itself:

original: bud med gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bud med gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of a single woman.‚Äù

original: de med pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de med pa bstan pa ni /
translated: He shows that there is no universal concomitance:

original: de gcig la zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbu ba 'ba' zhig rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de gcig la zhes bya ba'o // bu ba 'ba' zhig rgyu ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of a single man.‚Äù

original: gang gis thams cad du 'dod chags yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on kyang gzugs dang spyod tshul la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gis thams cad du 'dod chags yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba 'gyur ro // 'on kyang gzugs dang spyod tshul la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa yin la /
translated: It is not the case that the semen alone is the cause, since there is no universal concomitance, for it is not the case that all men are lustful.üîΩHowever, the co-operating conditions, such as the form and behavior of the woman, are not definite in the case of a single woman.

original: bud med gcig la rjes su 'gro ba @318b nges pa kho na ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: bud med gcig la rjes su 'gro ba @318b nges pa kho na ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The author thinks that the form, etc.üîΩare not definite, and so he says:

original: gal te gzugs sogs kyang yan lag //
analyzed: gal te gzugs sogs kyang yan lag //
translated: ‚ÄúIf form, etc.

original: nges pa med par zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa yang 'dod chags la 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa med par zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa yang 'dod chags la 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
translated: are also a part of the cause, then there is no universal concomitance, since form, etc. are also not concomitant with lust.

original: gzugs la sogs pa med kyang khu ba yod na yod pa'i phyir ldog pa me dpar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa med kyang khu ba yod na yod pa'i phyir ldog pa me dpar bstan pa ni /
translated: He shows that there is no universal concomitance in the absence of form, etc.,

original: nges pa med par 'byung ba 'ang min //
analyzed: nges pa med par 'byung ba 'ang min //
translated: ‚ÄúNor is it the case that it arises without a definite cause.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i khu ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa med par bstan pas rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa med pa kho nar bstan par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i khu ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa med par bstan pas rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa med pa kho nar bstan par byed pa ni /
translated: Since the semen of the co-creator of form, etc. is taught to be without passion, etc., the absence of the concomitance, etc. is taught.

original: yon tan ma bzung zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan ma bzung zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúNot apprehending the qualities.‚Äù

original: mi gtsang ba bsgom pa la sogs pas mi gtsang ba la sogs par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba bsgom pa la sogs pas mi gtsang ba la sogs par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The apprehension of impurity, etc. is by means of the meditation on impurity, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa tsam 'dzin pa ni lhan cig byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tsam 'dzin pa ni lhan cig byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The apprehension of mere form, etc. is not the co-creator,

original: 'on kyang gtsang ba la sogs par 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang gtsang ba la sogs par 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: but the apprehension of purity, etc. is taught.

original: de'ang yan lag yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'ang yan lag yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúIf that is a part.‚Äù

original: yon tan 'dzin pa ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bsgom pa med pa'i phyir bag chags gzhan yod pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan 'dzin pa ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bsgom pa med pa'i phyir bag chags gzhan yod pa yin no //
translated: The apprehension of the qualities is due to the existence of another instinct, because there is no meditation on impurity, etc.

original: de nyid re zhig tan 'dzin pa'i lhan cig byed pa ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid re zhig tan 'dzin pa'i lhan cig byed pa ci las yin zhe na /
translated: What is the co-creator of the apprehension of that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa thams cad ni mi gtsang ba bsgom pa ldan pa yang cig shos bzhin du de dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang 'dod chags can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa thams cad ni mi gtsang ba bsgom pa ldan pa yang cig shos bzhin du de dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang 'dod chags can du 'gyur ro //
translated: All the co-operating causes of form, etc., would be possessed of impurity, just like the other, and so they too would be lustful.

original: ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las yin zhe na /
translated: What is the action?

original: rgyu las te 'dod chags kyi rgyu mi gtsang bar mthong ba las bzlog pa bzhin du khyad par med pa las so //
analyzed: rgyu las te 'dod chags kyi rgyu mi gtsang bar mthong ba las bzlog pa bzhin du khyad par med pa las so //
translated: It is the cause, because the cause of lust is seeing impurity, and there is no difference between the two.

original: so sor nges pa'i rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i yon tan 'dzin pa'i bag chags ni 'dzin rten pha rol 'grub pa'i 'jigs pas khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i yon tan 'dzin pa'i bag chags ni 'dzin rten pha rol 'grub pa'i 'jigs pas khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The latent impressions that hold the qualities that arise from their own specific causes are not accepted because of the fear of establishing a support that holds them.

original: 'dis yon tan mi 'dzin pa yang yon tan 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes ba'i thal 'gyur ro zhes bya'i thal 'gyur 'di nyid bstan par byas nas /
analyzed: 'dis yon tan mi 'dzin pa yang yon tan 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes ba'i thal 'gyur ro zhes bya'i thal 'gyur 'di nyid bstan par byas nas /
translated: This is the reductio being urged: ‚ÄúEven though it does not hold the qualities, it would come to hold the qualities.‚Äù

original: da ni grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa bzhin du 'gal ba dag ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag gam /
analyzed: da ni grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa bzhin du 'gal ba dag ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag gam /
translated: Now, just as cold and warm touch are contradictory, so too lust and hatred are contradictory.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la mtshungs pa'i tshogs pa'i bskyed bya nyid du mi rigs pas bad kan gyi rang bzhin la 'dod chags yin pa bzhin du zhe sdang yang yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la mtshungs pa'i tshogs pa'i bskyed bya nyid du mi rigs pas bad kan gyi rang bzhin la 'dod chags yin pa bzhin du zhe sdang yang yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it is not reasonable that pleasure and pain are the effects of the same collection, he shows that just as the nature of phlegm is desire, so also it is hatred.

original: gnas skabs gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In what state?

original: 'bras bu bzhin du de'i rang bzhin dag kyang 'gal ba kho na yin la 'gal ba ma yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhin du de'i rang bzhin dag kyang 'gal ba kho na yin la 'gal ba ma yin na /
translated: Just as the effects are contradictory, so also their natures are contradictory. If they were not contradictory,

original: 'bras bu la yang der mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang der mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: he shows that the effect would not be so.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa rnams bad kan la @319a * //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba'o // 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams bad kan la @319a * //
translated: Those two?

original: sogs pa'i rang bzhin las nges pa ma yin na gang gis 'gal ba me dpar 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i rang bzhin las nges pa ma yin na gang gis 'gal ba me dpar 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If desire and so on are not ascertained as the nature of phlegm and so on, then by what are they contradictory, like fire and water?

original: 'di la nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Ascertainment?

original: de 'di rnam 'grel gyi rnam par dbye ba'i khyad par ni 'grel par yang sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de 'di rnam 'grel gyi rnam par dbye ba'i khyad par ni 'grel par yang sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: This is a special analysis of the Commentary, which should be applied to the Commentary.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang khu ba bzhin du nus pa can yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang khu ba bzhin du nus pa can yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Form, etc. are like semen, which is a potentiality.

original: khyad par can gzugs zhags pa yis //
analyzed: khyad par can gzugs zhags pa yis //
translated: The specific is not the cause of the general.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //üîΩgzugs ni skyed byed ma yin zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro // gzugs ni skyed byed ma yin zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúis‚Äù is understood.üîΩForm, etc. are not the cause of the existence of form, etc.

original: thams cad rgyu ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ni yod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu nyid yin ba bkag pa yin no ;
analyzed: thams cad rgyu ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ni yod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu nyid yin ba bkag pa yin no ;
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù is understood.

original: / rgyu nges pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni ldog pa can ma yin na'o //
analyzed: / rgyu nges pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni ldog pa can ma yin na'o //
translated: The cause is not determined.üîΩThe error of the qualities of form, etc. is shown.üîΩThe word ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù is understood.üîΩThe word ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù is understood.üîΩThe word ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù is understood.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan 'khrul pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan 'khrul pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù is understood.

analyzed: yul med par ni yul med na'o zhes bya ba 'dir mtshams bcad do //
translated: The word ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù is understood.üîΩThe

original: 'on te mi 'byung na kho na zhes rang bzhin nges pa yin na rang bzhin gcig nyid la yang cig car 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'byung na kho na zhes rang bzhin nges pa yin na rang bzhin gcig nyid la yang cig car 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But if it does not occur, then if the nature is ascertained, even in a single nature, one thinks that the effect does not occur simultaneously.

original: 'on te mkhris pa yis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te mkhris pa yis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is by bile, etc.

original: me zhes bya ba ni phyir rol gyi me'o //
analyzed: me zhes bya ba ni phyir rol gyi me'o //
translated: Fire is external fire.

original: chags sogs la ni zhes bya ba ni phyir rol la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: chags sogs la ni zhes bya ba ni phyir rol la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: Attachment, etc. means that it is not dependent on the external.

original: de bzhin rlung la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la nges par byed pa ma yin na nges par byed pa gzhan du rtogs pa na mthong ba'i phyir nang gi ni rang gi rgyud la byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin rlung la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la nges par byed pa ma yin na nges par byed pa gzhan du rtogs pa na mthong ba'i phyir nang gi ni rang gi rgyud la byung ba yin la /
translated: If wind, etc. and form, etc. are not determiners of attachment, etc., then when a determiner is understood elsewhere, it is seen that the internal arises in one's continuum.

original: de yang rang la phan 'dogs pas byed pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de yang rang la phan 'dogs pas byed pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pa'i bag chags so //
translated: And that which is beneficial to oneself is the latent tendency of the agent. That which is the latent tendency of the agent is the latent tendency of benefit.

original: bag chags dang 'brel pa las te sad pa las so //
analyzed: bag chags dang 'brel pa las te sad pa las so //
translated: From the connection with the latent tendency, from awakening.

original: nges pa las bzlog pa ni ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa las bzlog pa ni ma nges pa ste /
translated: The opposite of determination is indetermination.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: of attachment, etc.üîΩThe same should be said of the latent impressions of harmfulness.

original: de bzhin du gnod pa byed pa'i bag chags la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod pa byed pa'i bag chags la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught by the words:

original: 'on te nang gi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te nang gi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOr, if it is the internal, etc.‚Äù

original: bag chags nyid ces bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i bag chags nyid do ;
analyzed: bag chags nyid ces bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i bag chags nyid do ;
translated: The words ‚Äúlatent impressions‚Äù refer to the latent impressions of benefit.

original: / bag chags kyi khyad par gyi rgyu yang gzugs sogs pa sad par byed la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin nam snyan du sems pa ni /
analyzed: / bag chags kyi khyad par gyi rgyu yang gzugs sogs pa sad par byed la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin nam snyan du sems pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause of the distinction of latent impressions‚Äù is not indeterminate, since it depends on the activation of form, etc.üîΩThe doubt is resolved by the words:

original: 'on te yang gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te yang gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr, if it is the internal, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa la nges pa med pa 'di yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rtul po dang 'bring po la sogs @319b pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa la nges pa med pa 'di yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rtul po dang 'bring po la sogs @319b pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe indeterminacy of attachment, etc.‚Äù is due to the distinction of dull, medium, etc.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba ni lang tsho la sogs pa'i dus kyi nges pa so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba ni lang tsho la sogs pa'i dus kyi nges pa so //
translated: ‚ÄúAt some time‚Äù is due to the restriction of the time of youth, etc.

original: 'ga' zhig gi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúOf some‚Äù is due to external form, etc.

original: nang gi sems la sogs pa ma mtshon pa khyad par 'bras bu'i nges pa gcig pu la nges pas so //
analyzed: nang gi sems la sogs pa ma mtshon pa khyad par 'bras bu'i nges pa gcig pu la nges pas so //
translated: because it is ascertained only with regard to the effect, the special non-illustration of the internal mind, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni nges par ldog pa med pas zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni nges par ldog pa med pas zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin no //
translated: This ‚Äúbecause of the absence of dependence on form, etc.‚Äù is dependent on the ‚Äúbecause of the absence of invariable concomitance.‚ÄùüîΩSimilarly, the transformation of the elements is refuted by the refutation of the elements themselves, which are accepted by others, after the nature of phlegm, wind, etc., has been refuted as being desire, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba la yongs su gyur pa ni bad kan dang rlung la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bsal nas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i 'byung pa nyid bsal par byed pa ni rlung la sogs pa'i chos 'dod chags ma yin mo cesüîΩbya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba la yongs su gyur pa ni bad kan dang rlung la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bsal nas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i 'byung pa nyid bsal par byed pa ni rlung la sogs pa'i chos 'dod chags ma yin mo ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWind, etc., are not desire, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa rjes su byed pa ma yin pas bag chags kyir rjes su byed pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa rjes su byed pa ma yin pas bag chags kyir rjes su byed pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this‚Äù means by the non-concomitance of wind, etc., and by the concomitance of the latent impressions.

original: blo ni lus la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo ni lus la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the cognition is based on the body,

original: goms pas grub pa med ce na //
analyzed: goms pas grub pa med ce na //
translated: there is no establishment by practice.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa yang gzhan log par rtogs pa srid pa 'gegs par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa yang gzhan log par rtogs pa srid pa 'gegs par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: This and other such refutations are refutations of the possibility of other erroneous understandings.

original: de mthong ba yang yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de mthong ba yang yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The seeing of this is taught:

original: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These are the elements.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dag las tha dad par khas blangs pas zhas bya ba ni brten pa nyid tha dad pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dag las tha dad par khas blangs pas zhas bya ba ni brten pa nyid tha dad pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since form and so on are accepted as different from the elements, the meaning of ‚Äúbecause of the consecration of the difference of the supported‚Äù is that they are different in being the supported.

original: 'byung ba dang gzugs la sogs pa dag gi rten dang brten bkag pas khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yang me dpar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang gzugs la sogs pa dag gi rten dang brten bkag pas khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yang me dpar bstan pa ni /
translated: The contradiction of the acceptance of the refutation of the elements and form and so on as support and supported is taught:

original: de rten zhes bya ba ste /üîΩrgyu'i don gyi rten gyi sgra yin pas rten dang brten pa nyid ma yin ste /
analyzed: de rten zhes bya ba ste / rgyu'i don gyi rten gyi sgra yin pas rten dang brten pa nyid ma yin ste /
translated: The support of that is the elements.

original: dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgrub pa'i ngo bo la de nus pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro // grub pa'i ngo bo la de nus pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the word support has the meaning of cause, they are not support and supported because they are different in time.

original: lhan cig par grub kyang dgos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig par grub kyang dgos pa med pa yin te /
translated: Since that is not possible in the established entity, there is no need for them to be established as coexistent.

original: lhan cig pa'i don la ltos pa med pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig pa'i don la ltos pa med pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of ‚Äúsimultaneous‚Äù is not dependent.

original: 'byung ba'i ngo bo ni rang byung ba'i don du ltos pa yin na ji srid du yod pa la ltos pa de nyid 'di snga na med pa yin ji sred lhan cig gnas pa de srid du ltos pa med par bstan ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i ngo bo ni rang byung ba'i don du ltos pa yin na ji srid du yod pa la ltos pa de nyid 'di snga na med pa yin ji sred lhan cig gnas pa de srid du ltos pa med par bstan ni /
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúoriginated‚Äù is dependent, then as long as it is dependent, it is not prior; and as long as it is simultaneous, it is not independent.

original: rang gi rkyen dag dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi rkyen dag dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Its own conditions‚Äù means

original: dbyer med pa ni gnas pa'i phyir ni lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbyer med pa ni gnas pa'i phyir ni lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚Äúbecause of the indivisibility of the abiding.‚Äù

original: 'di kho na rgyu'i don dang rkyen gyi don dag la dus tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i yul nyid kho na gsal bar byed pa ni /üîΩrgyu ni 'bras dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: 'di kho na rgyu'i don dang rkyen gyi don dag la dus tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i yul nyid kho na gsal bar byed pa ni / rgyu ni 'bras dang lhan cig tu //
translated: This very point clarifies the meaning of cause and condition, that they are not different or not non-different.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú The cause is not simultaneous with the effect.‚Äù

original: 'di phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba ni dbyer ba ni dbyer med par gnas pa yin zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba ni dbyer ba ni dbyer med par gnas pa yin zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained as ‚Äúmutually without arising, indivisibility is indivisible.‚Äù

original: gal te gzugs sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gzugs sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú If form, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di rten kyang ni brten pa'i rten @320a * //
analyzed: 'di rten kyang ni brten pa'i rten @320a * //
translated: ‚Äú The support is the support of the supported.‚Äù

original: yin no // brten pa la ltos pa'i ngo bo ni brten pa med na med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: yin no // brten pa la ltos pa'i ngo bo ni brten pa med na med pa kho na yin no //
translated: The nature of the supported is that it does not exist without the support.

original: mi 'jig pa ni brten pa dang bral bar gnas na'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa ni brten pa dang bral bar gnas na'o //
translated: Non-destruction is when it remains without the support.

original: sngar yang zhes bya ba ni brten pa yin par mngon par 'dod pa'i dus nas yang ngo //
analyzed: sngar yang zhes bya ba ni brten pa yin par mngon par 'dod pa'i dus nas yang ngo //
translated: Also previously means also at the time when it is manifestly desired to be the support.

original: de nyid 'di'o zhes ngo zhes pa las ni rten nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid 'di'o zhes ngo zhes pa las ni rten nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the support because of the statement, ‚ÄúIt is that very thing.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no relation.

original: dbye ba med par gnas pa'i khyad par las rten khyab bya yin par ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: dbye ba med par gnas pa'i khyad par las rten khyab bya yin par ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the support is the pervaded due to the difference in the mode of existence without division.

original: dbyer med pa med kyang tshang dang myos pa'i nus pa dag rten la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: dbyer med pa med kyang tshang dang myos pa'i nus pa dag rten la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Even though there is no indivisibility, the potency of intoxication and so on is the support and so forth.

original: gal te myos sogs nus pa bzhin //
analyzed: gal te myos sogs nus pa bzhin //
translated: If it is like the potency of intoxication and so on,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the response.

original: lan ni / dngos po las zhes bya ba ste /üîΩji ltar 'di dag dbyer med pa ma yin pa de kho na bzhin du rten la sogs pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: lan ni / dngos po las zhes bya ba ste / ji ltar 'di dag dbyer med pa ma yin pa de kho na bzhin du rten la sogs pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: The response is from the line, ‚Äúfrom the thing.‚Äù

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as these are not indivisible, in the same way, the support and so forth are also because of non-difference.

original: de'i phyir khyab par bya ba nyid nyams pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab par bya ba nyid nyams pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the pervasion is not lost.

original: tha dad kyang brten pas byas pas ngo bo brten pa zhig na 'jig pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad kyang brten pas byas pas ngo bo brten pa zhig na 'jig pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though they are different, if the support is destroyed, the supported is also destroyed.

original: rten tshang par gnas na brten pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten tshang par gnas na brten pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the support remains intact, it is called ‚Äúsupported.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang lus las tha mi dad pa'i phyir lus nyid zhig na 'jig pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang lus las tha mi dad pa'i phyir lus nyid zhig na 'jig pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since desire and so on are not different from the body, when the body is destroyed, are they not also destroyed?

original: de'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i de ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i de ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, they are not the support and the supported.

original: dbyer med par gnas pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyer med par gnas pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: They also do not remain without being different.

original: tha dad pa yin yang rten gnas na brten pa 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin yang rten gnas na brten pa 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though they are different, if the support remains, the supported is not destroyed.

original: de 'jig na des byas pa'i rten nyid kyang 'jig pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de 'jig na des byas pa'i rten nyid kyang 'jig pa'i phyir ro//
translated: If it is destroyed, the support that is produced by it is also destroyed.üîΩTherefore, desire and the body and so on are not the same in terms of being the support and so on.

original: des na 'dod chags dang lus la sogs pa rten la sogs pa nyid dang bye ba med pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: des na 'dod chags dang lus la sogs pa rten la sogs pa nyid dang bye ba med pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: This is what you think.

original: de med mtshungs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med mtshungs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are not the same in terms of not existing‚Äù is what is said.

original: tha mi dad pa las khyab pa nyams pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa las khyab pa nyams pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the pervasion is not lost because they are not different.

original: 'dod chags dang lus dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang lus dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because desire and the body are not different.

original: tha dad na yang brten pa zhig pas rten nyid 'jig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad na yang brten pa zhig pas rten nyid 'jig pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if they were different, the support itself would be destroyed because the supported would be destroyed.

original: rten la sogs pa nyid la gnod pa med do zhes bya ba 'di la tha dad pa ni rten dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rten la sogs pa nyid la gnod pa med do zhes bya ba 'di la tha dad pa ni rten dang bral ba'o //
translated: In this case, the support, etc., are not undermined. Difference is the absence of support.

original: snang ba ni nyams su myong ba yin la de rtogs pas ro dang gzugs bzhin du gnyi ga lhan cig rig pa yin yang rten dang brten pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba ni nyams su myong ba yin la de rtogs pas ro dang gzugs bzhin du gnyi ga lhan cig rig pa yin yang rten dang brten pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Appearance is experience. Although both are cognized simultaneously by the realization of that, like taste and form, they are not support and supported.

original: rten la sogs pa nyid dbyer med pas khyab pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rten la sogs pa nyid dbyer med pas khyab pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: One who says that support, etc., are pervaded by inseparability,

original: 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang la sogs pa zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang la sogs pa zhes bya bar ro //
translated: means that they are like grain beer, manufactured beer, etc.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni me'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni me'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: One's own nature is the nature of fire.

original: gzhan la ni sngags la sogs pa dang bral ba la ste /
analyzed: gzhan la ni sngags la sogs pa dang bral ba la ste /
translated: The other is free from mantra, etc.

original: nus pa gzhan gyis sreg pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa gzhan gyis sreg pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is burned by another power.

original: des zhes bya ba ni nus pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni nus pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the nature of possessing another power.

original: nus pa bkag @320b pa la yang ni nus pa gcig nyid rang gi ngo bo bzhin du'o zhes bya ba'i bsam pas rgol ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa bkag @320b pa la yang ni nus pa gcig nyid rang gi ngo bo bzhin du'o zhes bya ba'i bsam pas rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven when the power is refuted,‚Äù the opponent argues, ‚Äúthe power itself is just like its own nature.‚Äù

original: nus pa gcig yin du chug kyang sngags la sogs pas gegs byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa gcig yin du chug kyang sngags la sogs pas gegs byas pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if there is one power, it is not obstructed by a mantra, etc.

original: de lta yod kyi phyir rol gyi skyes bus bsreg bya ma yin pa'i ngo bo gzhan du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yod kyi phyir rol gyi skyes bus bsreg bya ma yin pa'i ngo bo gzhan du byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it exists, the external person makes the nature of the fuel, which is not to be burned, into something else.

original: de'i phyir de dang bral ba la sreg pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang bral ba la sreg pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Therefore, when it is separated from that, it is burned.

original: bsreg bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsreg bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúfuel.‚Äù

original: gzhan nyid du ni bsreg bya ma yin pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du ni bsreg bya ma yin pa nyid du'o //
translated: It is not to be burned, because it is different.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya bas gnas skabs pa'i bsreg bya nyid la ltos nas bsreg bya nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya bas gnas skabs pa'i bsreg bya nyid la ltos nas bsreg bya nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù shows that fuel is dependent on the state of being to be burned.

original: gzhan du ni sngags dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni sngags dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means without a mantra, etc.

original: gang las byung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang las byung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what does it arise?‚Äù

original: rgyu las sam tshad ma las so //
analyzed: rgyu las sam tshad ma las so //
translated: From a cause or from a valid cognition.

original: 'di sreg par byed na de rnams med kyang byed pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di sreg par byed na de rnams med kyang byed pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If it burns, then it is established that it exists even without those.

original: don gyis go ba nyams par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don gyis go ba nyams par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the implicit meaning is

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy those.‚Äù

original: gal te gcig ngo bo rgyu yin na 'bras bu yang gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gcig ngo bo rgyu yin na 'bras bu yang gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur te /
translated: If the cause has a single nature, then the effect also would have a single nature,

original: rgyu'i ngo bor bye brag med pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bor bye brag med pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: because there is no difference in the nature of the cause, like a seed and a sprout.

original: du ma'i ngo bo yang yul tha dad pa'i mar khu dang sdong bu la sogs pa zad pa'i 'od 'phros pa ni rang gi rgyu dang rang gi shes pa dag gi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: du ma'i ngo bo yang yul tha dad pa'i mar khu dang sdong bu la sogs pa zad pa'i 'od 'phros pa ni rang gi rgyu dang rang gi shes pa dag gi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: If the cause has a multiple nature, then the effect also would have a multiple nature, like the light that arises from the exhaustion of the fuel, such as the butter and wick, that have different locations.

original: de'i phyir don gyi shugs kyis rang gi ngo bo med na don gyi shugs kyis nus pa'i dbye bar rnam par gnas pa zhes rtsod pa byed pa ni /üîΩdngos 'di ltos yod min te //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi shugs kyis rang gi ngo bo med na don gyi shugs kyis nus pa'i dbye bar rnam par gnas pa zhes rtsod pa byed pa ni / dngos 'di ltos yod min te //
translated: Therefore, the opponent argues that if the cause has no nature of its own, then the effect also would have no nature of its own, because the effect is a manifestation of the power of the cause.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis entity does not exist in dependence on that.‚Äù

original: me las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu du mar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: me las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu du mar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word from in from fire and so on indicates the many effects.

original: nus pa du pa du ni la tshad ma brjod nas /
analyzed: nus pa du pa du ni la tshad ma brjod nas /
translated: Having stated the many potencies,

original: khas mi len pa'i skyon brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khas mi len pa'i skyon brjod pa ni /
translated: he states the fault of not accepting:

original: rang bzhin gcig pu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say one nature,

original: yod pa ni sngags la sogs pa dang bral ba la'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni sngags la sogs pa dang bral ba la'o //
translated: existence is without mantra and so on.

original: med ces bya ba ni mi srid pa ste /
analyzed: med ces bya ba ni mi srid pa ste /
translated: Non-existence is impossibility.

original: de dang ldan par te gnyis ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang ldan par te gnyis ma yin te /
translated: Having that, it is not two,

original: dus gcig pa la gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus gcig pa la gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is contradictory in one time. This is the meaning.

original: de la sngags dang bral ba la me ni sreg par byed pa nyid du yod pa yin gyi de dang lnga pa la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sngags dang bral ba la me ni sreg par byed pa nyid du yod pa yin gyi de dang lnga pa la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There, in the absence of mantra, fire exists as burning, but not in the presence of that,

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ba ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ba ni /
translated: because of contradiction.

original: yod na thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad sngags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin yang bsreg bya nyid yin no //üîΩlan ni / ji ltar nus pa sna tshogs 'di //
analyzed: yod na thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad sngags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin yang bsreg bya nyid yin no // lan ni / ji ltar nus pa sna tshogs 'di //
translated: If you say all, all would be possessed of mantra and so on, but would still be combustible.üîΩ The answer is:üîΩHow is this various potency

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the second chapter, the chapter on the benefits of bodhicitta.

original: yul tha dad pa'i 'bras bu du ma mthong ba las nus pa sna tshogs par rtogs pa ni de med na nus pa du ma dang ldan pa yod kyang nus pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan par mngon par 'dod pa yin yang 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i 'bras bu du ma mthong ba las nus pa sna tshogs par rtogs pa ni de med na nus pa du ma dang ldan pa yod kyang nus pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan par mngon par 'dod pa yin yang 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: From seeing the many effects of different objects, one infers the various potencies. If that were not so, then even though there are many potencies, one would not infer the various potencies.

original: de lta bu'i nus pa dang bral ba las de ltar nus pa bzhin du 'bras bu la @321a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nus pa dang bral ba las de ltar nus pa bzhin du 'bras bu la @321a * //
translated: From that which is devoid of such potency, an effect like that which has such potencyüîΩdoes not arise.

original: rnams kho na sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo rnams su 'byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnams kho na sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo rnams su 'byung ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the various effects arise from the various potencies alone.

original: 'bru sna tshogs pa nyid mthong ba ni rang bzhin med pa tsam gyis 'byung na nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid la gzhan du grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'bru sna tshogs pa nyid mthong ba ni rang bzhin med pa tsam gyis 'byung na nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid la gzhan du grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If the mere seeing of the various seeds were to arise from the mere absence of intrinsic nature, then the various potencies would be established as something else.

original: gal te 'bras bu sna tshogs pa ni mthong bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu sna tshogs pa ni mthong bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in ‚ÄúIf the various effects are seen. . . .‚Äù

original: sreg byed nyid yod pa dang med par 'gal ba lan du bstan pa ni /üîΩgang gis sngags sogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sreg byed nyid yod pa dang med par 'gal ba lan du bstan pa ni /üîΩgang gis sngags sogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response that the existence and nonexistence of the fire are contradictory is stated in ‚ÄúBy what. . . ?‚Äù

original: rang gi rgyud las skyes pa'i me ni sa bon bzhin du yod pa dang med pa'i lhan cig byed pa can gyi rgyu las rnam par dbye ba'i 'bras bu byed par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las skyes pa'i me ni sa bon bzhin du yod pa dang med pa'i lhan cig byed pa can gyi rgyu las rnam par dbye ba'i 'bras bu byed par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The fire that arises from its own continuum is the effect that is distinguished from the cause that has the seed as its co-existent cause, and it is said that it is the effect that is distinguished from the cause that has the seed as its co-existent cause.

original: sngags la sogs pas bsreg byar byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pas bsreg byar byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is the object to be burned by mantras, etc.

original: bsreg bya'i rdzas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsreg bya'i rdzas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The substance to be burned is called

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bos so //
translated: other because of its nature.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bsreg bya'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bsreg bya'i ngo bo'o //
translated: That refers to the nature of the object to be burned.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni chang dang myos pa'i nus pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni chang dang myos pa'i nus pa'i dpe'o //
translated: That is an example of the potency of alcohol and intoxication.

original: skabs kyi zhes bya ba ni dbyer med pa nyid med kyang rten la sogs pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi zhes bya ba ni dbyer med pa nyid med kyang rten la sogs pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: In this context means that even though there is no inseparability, it is due to the support, etc.

original: nus pa ltar 'byung ba dang tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba 'di'i de ma thag tu rten dang brten pa gnyis zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa ltar 'byung ba dang tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba 'di'i de ma thag tu rten dang brten pa gnyis zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Like potency means that it should be seen as the two, the support and the supported, immediately after this.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis po 'di med pa rnams la tha dad pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis po 'di med pa rnams la tha dad pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: That itself means that for those who do not have these two, there is no inseparability.

original: snang ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir rten dang brten pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir rten dang brten pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: because the appearances are different.

original: de nyid kyis ni snang ba tha dad pa las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ni tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni snang ba tha dad pa las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ni tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: By that very fact, it is different from the different appearances, because of the difference.

original: bar mtshams na gnas pas rten med pa la sogs par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bar mtshams na gnas pas rten med pa la sogs par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because of the appearance of the absence of a support, etc., in the interval.

original: snang ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The different appearances are called different appearances.

original: 'di la kha cig na re yul rnams 'di la snang ba'i phyir snang ba ni dbang po yin la /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig na re yul rnams 'di la snang ba'i phyir snang ba ni dbang po yin la /
translated: In this regard, some say that the sense faculties are the appearances, because the objects appear to them.

original: de tha dad pa yang yin la snang ba yang yin pa des rtogs pa'i tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de tha dad pa yang yin la snang ba yang yin pa des rtogs pa'i tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The different appearances are the different cognitions,

original: dbang po tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩda bzhin du gzhan dag na re snang ba tha dad pa skyes bu gang gi yin pa des rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po tha dad pa'i phyir ro // da bzhin du gzhan dag na re snang ba tha dad pa skyes bu gang gi yin pa des rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: because the sense faculties are different.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid can gyi mngon sum pa ni lus yin la /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid can gyi mngon sum pa ni lus yin la /
translated: In the same way, others say that the body is the direct perceiver of itself and others, because the different appearances belong to a person.

original: sems pa ni rang gi mngon sum kho na yin no //
analyzed: sems pa ni rang gi mngon sum kho na yin no //
translated: The mind is the direct perceiver of itself alone.

original: 'di gnyis ka yang snang ba tha dad pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka yang snang ba tha dad pa ma yin na /
translated: If these two are not different appearances,

original: tha dad par sgrub par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tha dad par sgrub par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: then they are not established as different.

original: de yod na de nyid tha dad pa'i sgrub byed nyid yin gyi dbang po dang skyes bu dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de bsal ba ni /
analyzed: de yod na de nyid tha dad pa'i sgrub byed nyid yin gyi dbang po dang skyes bu dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de bsal ba ni /
translated: If they do exist, then that itself is the proof of their difference, and not the sense faculties and the person.

original: dbang po tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of that is ‚Äúthe difference of the sense faculties.‚Äù

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The nature of appearance is the absence of understanding.

original: lus dang sems pa dang tha mi dad pas rten la sogs pa dang de las bzlog pa'i so sor snang ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lus dang sems pa dang tha mi dad pas rten la sogs pa dang de las bzlog pa'i so sor snang ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the body and the mind are not different is the individual appearance of the support and so on, and the opposite of that.

original: der yang snang ba ni tha dad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der yang snang ba ni tha dad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The appearance there is different.

original: tha dad pa ma yin no snyam @321b sems pa ni 'on te bde ba la sogs pa ni nang gi reg bya zhes bya ba'o //üîΩphyi rol rig pa ma yin yang tha dad pa las bzlog pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin no snyam @321b sems pa ni 'on te bde ba la sogs pa ni nang gi reg bya zhes bya ba'o // phyi rol rig pa ma yin yang tha dad pa las bzlog pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The thought that they are not different is ‚ÄúBut pleasure and so on are internal objects of touch.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching that external objects are not known but are not the opposite of different is ‚ÄúThat which is in what.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi shing bzhin du rig pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi shing bzhin du rig pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: It is not like an external tree.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúother‚Äù should be supplied.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni shes pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni shes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù means consciousness.

original: gzhan gyis ci phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes bus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes bus so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is it not like that?‚Äù means ‚Äúwhy is it not like a person?‚Äù

original: gnyis po phan tshun reg pa ni 'khyud pa na'o //
analyzed: gnyis po phan tshun reg pa ni 'khyud pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe two‚Äù means the two that are mutually touching, that is, embracing.

original: gnyi gas kyang ni zhes bya ba ni reg bya dag ste gzhan la gnas pa gzhan gyis rig pa bzhin du rang la yang gnas par rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang ni zhes bya ba ni reg bya dag ste gzhan la gnas pa gzhan gyis rig pa bzhin du rang la yang gnas par rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù means the two tangible objects. The meaning is that just as one tangible object in one place is cognized by another, so too would a tangible object in one‚Äôs own place be cognized.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin ni bdag gi reg pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin ni bdag gi reg pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of self‚Äù means the nature of one‚Äôs own tangible object.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan la yod pa dang / rang la yod pa gnyis kyis cig car kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan la yod pa dang / rang la yod pa gnyis kyis cig car kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that were so‚Äù means that both the tangible object in another place and the tangible object in one‚Äôs own place would be cognized simultaneously.

original: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba rnam pa gzhan kho na cha shas med pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba rnam pa gzhan kho na cha shas med pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù means that another aspect is not possible, because of the absence of parts.

original: du ma zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: du ma zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMany‚Äù means having parts.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba ni rang rig pa rnams kyi bde ba'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba ni rang rig pa rnams kyi bde ba'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú Itself‚Äù means of the atoms of pleasure of those who are self-aware.

original: gcig nyid ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab po //
analyzed: gcig nyid ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab po //
translated: ‚Äú One‚Äù means an atom.

original: rdul phra rab re re nas rig pa med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab de rnams kyi 'byar ba yang dbye bas rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab re re nas rig pa med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab de rnams kyi 'byar ba yang dbye bas rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Since each atom is not aware, the contact of those atoms is understood through separation.

original: yod kyang zhes bya ba ni 'byar ba zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yod kyang zhes bya ba ni 'byar ba zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äú Even though‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúcontact.‚Äù

original: 'byar bas zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'byar bas zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams reg pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Contact‚Äù is the contact of the atoms.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Of those‚Äù means the atoms are not understood as having a different nature.

original: 'byung ba dag las te ma rtogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams las sems pa tha dad par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dag las te ma rtogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams las sems pa tha dad par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú From the elements‚Äù means from the atoms that are not understood, the mind is understood as different.

original: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the difference between the understood and the not understood.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni reg bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni reg bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù means by a tactile object.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: ji ltar gnas zhes bya ba ni bde ba nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas zhes bya ba ni bde ba nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúHow could it be located?‚Äù means ‚Äúhow could it be pleasant?‚Äù

original: gang du yang rung bas reg pa na de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du yang rung bas reg pa na de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would be just like that when touched anywhere.

original: gzhan med kyang zhes bya ba ni lus las so //
analyzed: gzhan med kyang zhes bya ba ni lus las so //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it were not there‚Äù means ‚Äúeven if it were not in the body.‚Äù

original: sems pa ni yid du 'ong ba ngo bo nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni yid du 'ong ba ngo bo nyid kyi'o //
translated: The pleasantness is intrinsic.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni las kyi ngo bo'i rgyu'i khyad par las de 'di pa la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni las kyi ngo bo'i rgyu'i khyad par las de 'di pa la med pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúLocated‚Äù means ‚Äúcaused by a special cause.‚Äù Since that is not in this,

original: yid du 'ong ba nyid ni lus kyi chos ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba nyid ni lus kyi chos ma yin gyi /
translated: pleasantness is not a property of the body.

original: 'on kyang shes pa po'i shes pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa po'i shes pa'i chos yin te /
translated: Rather, it is a property of the consciousness of the cognizer.

original: rung ba'i yul na yod pa rnams mi shes kyang rang nyid shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rung ba'i yul na yod pa rnams mi shes kyang rang nyid shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: To explain this, he says,

original: gal te de yi yid 'ong nyid //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te de yi yid 'ong nyid // ces bya ba ste /
translated: If pleasantness were in the body,

original: de lta @322a * //
analyzed: de lta @322a * //
translated: The body would be cognized even without contact.üîΩIf pleasantness were in the body, the body would be cognized even without contact.

original: bu'i ngo bor snang ba mthong ba nyid kyi ming can skyes bu re re zhing nges pa rig pa'i shes pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bu'i ngo bor snang ba mthong ba nyid kyi ming can skyes bu re re zhing nges pa rig pa'i shes pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that the cognition which is the awareness of the certainty of each individual person, which is called the seeing of the appearance in the form of the son, is only consciousness is as follows.

original: gzugs ni snang bar gyur na yang //
analyzed: gzugs ni snang bar gyur na yang //
translated: Even though form appears,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is as follows.

original: lus kyi nang du chud nyid na //
analyzed: lus kyi nang du chud nyid na //
translated: If it were included within the body,

original: zhes bya ba ni lus las tha mi dad na ste /üîΩlus 'ba' zhig gzhan gyis ji ltar rig par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus las tha mi dad na ste / lus 'ba' zhig gzhan gyis ji ltar rig par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: if it were not different from the body,üîΩhow could the body alone be cognized by another?

original: lus ma rtogs kyang shes pa rtogs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lus ma rtogs kyang shes pa rtogs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that consciousness is cognized even though the body is not is as follows.

original: mun gnag gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩlus kyi khongs su gtogs pa nyid //
analyzed: mun gnag gnas pa zhes bya ba'o // lus kyi khongs su gtogs pa nyid //
translated: Dwelling in the darkness.

original: ces bya ba'i nges pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i nges pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of the certainty that it is included within the body is as follows.

original: rnam par rtog pa med par ni //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par ni //
translated: Without conceptualization,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is as follows.

original: mun gnag gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mun gnag gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of this, ‚ÄúDwelling in the darkness,‚Äù is as follows.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni lus kyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni lus kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means by the body.

original: de med par ni rtog pa med par te rig par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de med par ni rtog pa med par te rig par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout it‚Äù means without conceptualization. ‚ÄúIs cognized‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: lhan cig dmigs par nges pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs par nges pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcertainty of simultaneous observation‚Äù means ‚Äúexistence.‚Äù

original: lus kyi 'bras bu'am lus kyi bdag nyid yin na lus rnam par 'gyur na rnam rtog tu gcig pa'i rnam pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi 'bras bu'am lus kyi bdag nyid yin na lus rnam par 'gyur na rnam rtog tu gcig pa'i rnam pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If it were the body‚Äôs effect or the body‚Äôs nature, then when the body changes, the conceptualization would change.

original: ji srid lus ni 'gyur bar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji srid lus ni 'gyur bar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúAs long as the body changes.‚Äù

original: de'i 'gyur bas 'gyur ba nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu nyid la khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'gyur bas 'gyur ba nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu nyid la khyab pa yin la /
translated: The change of the body would pervade the change of its effect.
