original: de dang 'gal ba la ni de rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin pas rnam par 'gyur ba nyid yin na ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba la ni de rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin pas rnam par 'gyur ba nyid yin na ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not in contradiction with that, it would not change when the body changes.

original: lus 'ba' zhig gi 'bras bu nyid yin na de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: lus 'ba' zhig gi 'bras bu nyid yin na de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were the body‚Äôs effect alone, then that would be so.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: yid kyi rnam shes ni don dang lhan cig byed pa'i lus kyi 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes ni don dang lhan cig byed pa'i lus kyi 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Mental consciousness is the body‚Äôs effect that is produced simultaneously with its object.

original: lus la dbye ba med kyang don gyi dbye bas phye ba yin no //
analyzed: lus la dbye ba med kyang don gyi dbye bas phye ba yin no //
translated: Although the body is not differentiated, it is differentiated by the differentiation of its object.

original: de'i phyir de'i tshogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is differentiated by the differentiation of its collection.

original: de'i 'bras bu kho na de yin no snyam du sems pa la /üîΩrnam par rtog pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu kho na de yin no snyam du sems pa la / rnam par rtog pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The thought is:

original: rnam par rtog pa ni don la mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni don la mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
translated: because conceptualization does not depend on an object.

original: lus tsam rgyu nyid du khas len na khyab par byed pa 'gal bar grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus tsam rgyu nyid du khas len na khyab par byed pa 'gal bar grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one accepts that the body alone is the cause, the pervasion is established as contradictory.

original: yid kyi rnam shes kyi rgyu lus nyid yin na lus tha mi dad na yid la snang bzhin pa tha mi dad par bstan nas /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes kyi rgyu lus nyid yin na lus tha mi dad na yid la snang bzhin pa tha mi dad par bstan nas /
translated: If the cause of mental consciousness is the body itself, if the body is not different, the mental consciousness is taught to be not different.

original: bag chags sad pa'i rgyu nyid yin na lus la dbye ba med kyang de'i dbye bas phye bar 'thad pa kho nar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags sad pa'i rgyu nyid yin na lus la dbye ba med kyang de'i dbye bas phye bar 'thad pa kho nar bstan pa ni /
translated: If the cause of the activation of latent potentialities is the body itself, even though the body is not different, it is certainly tenable to distinguish it by the distinctions of the body.

original: gang tshe ltos pa med pa ni lus kyi bye brag la ste /
analyzed: gang tshe ltos pa med pa ni lus kyi bye brag la ste /
translated: When there is no dependence on the distinctions of the body,

original: gang gi tshe bag chags sad pa kho na shes pa gang gis rgyu yin pa'i shes pa de 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bag chags sad pa kho na shes pa gang gis rgyu yin pa'i shes pa de 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: when the activation of latent potentialities is the cause of a certain consciousness, that consciousness is the cause of another consciousness.

original: gang dang de rtag tu 'brel pa'i phyir de'i tshe des na skye rgyus so //
analyzed: gang dang de rtag tu 'brel pa'i phyir de'i tshe des na skye rgyus so //
translated: Because it is always related to that, at that time, it is the cause of the arising of that.

original: 'ga' zhig gi skyes @322b bu'i'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi skyes @322b bu'i'o //
translated: Some say: It is the person‚Äôs.

original: res 'ga' 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur gyi gcig gi ngo bo ni ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur gyi gcig gi ngo bo ni ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Sometimes it is some, but not the nature of one.

original: gang gi tshe bag chags sad pa'i rgyu shes pa 'ga' zhig ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gi yin la de'i tshe des te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bag chags sad pa'i rgyu shes pa 'ga' zhig ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gi yin la de'i tshe des te /
translated: When there is the arising of some cognition that is the cause of arousing the latent potentialities, then at that time, by that cause, sometimes some arise.

original: rgyus res 'ga' zhig 'ga' kho nar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyus res 'ga' zhig 'ga' kho nar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa'o //
translated: This is the assertion of others.

original: 'grel ba mdzad pa ni lus la ltos pa med par zhes bya bas khyad par bkag nas lhag ma khas blangs pas bag chags sad pa'i rgyu cung zad la ltos nas des te rgyus skyes bu gang la la'i nam zhig gi dus su shes pa cung zad duüîΩ'gyur zhes 'chad ba ni /
analyzed: 'grel ba mdzad pa ni lus la ltos pa med par zhes bya bas khyad par bkag nas lhag ma khas blangs pas bag chags sad pa'i rgyu cung zad la ltos nas des te rgyus skyes bu gang la la'i nam zhig gi dus su shes pa cung zad du 'gyur zhes 'chad ba ni /
translated: The author of the commentary refutes this distinction by saying, ‚ÄúWithout depending on the body,‚Äù and then accepts the remainder, ‚ÄúBy depending on some cause of arousing the latent potentialities, by that cause, at some time, some cognition arises in some person.‚ÄùüîΩThis is explained by ‚ÄúIf the body were the cause,‚Äù and so on.

original: lus rgyu yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin lus kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis rgyu nyid du 'gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: lus rgyu yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin lus kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis rgyu nyid du 'gyur du zin kyang /
translated: Even though the body is the cause by being a cooperative condition of cognition, it is not the cause by being the substantial cause of cognition.

original: gang gis 'gyur bas nges par 'gyur ba de nye bar len pa'i shes pa btsal bar bya ba kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis 'gyur bas nges par 'gyur ba de nye bar len pa'i shes pa btsal bar bya ba kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is definitely that which transforms, it is only the appropriating consciousness that should be sought.

original: shes pa rgyu nyid yin pa la gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa rgyu nyid yin pa la gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa ni /
translated: To teach another reason for consciousness being the cause, he says:

original: rnam shes min pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam shes min pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not non-consciousness.

original: gal te lus kyi lhan cig byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te lus kyi lhan cig byed pa yin na /
translated: If it were the co-creator of the body,

original: de nyid kyi shes pa nus pa'i ngo bor 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi shes pa nus pa'i ngo bor 'gyur la /
translated: then it would be the nature of the potential of that consciousness.

original: chos can gzhan du rtogs pa min na de dang nus pa'i rtogs par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir /üîΩrtogs pa lci bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: chos can gzhan du rtogs pa min na de dang nus pa'i rtogs par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir / rtogs pa lci bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If it is not realized as a different phenomenon, then it would be realized as the potential of that.

original: gal te dngos po thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: gal te dngos po thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The thought that realization would be heavy is taught by ‚ÄúIf all things‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'dod pa 'di ni grangs can gyi yin gyi /üîΩrgyang ban pa'i ma yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di ni grangs can gyi yin gyi / rgyang ban pa'i ma yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This assertion is that of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya,

original: de skad grangs can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de skad grangs can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not of the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka. This is taught by ‚ÄúThus the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'di mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
translated: This is unreasonable is taught by ‚ÄúIf the nature of consciousness‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: ngo bo gang zhig ni rnam shes kyi snang ba yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo gang zhig ni rnam shes kyi snang ba yin la /
translated: What is the nature that is the appearance of consciousness?

original: de nus pa'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa la med pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nus pa'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa la med pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
translated: because it does not exist in the cognition that is the occasion of its potentiality.

original: de'i phyir snang ba nye bar len pa ni snang ba rtogs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba nye bar len pa ni snang ba rtogs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of the appearance is the apprehension of the appearance itself, not of anything else.

original: rgyu ni rnam brgyar rnam phye yang //
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam brgyar rnam phye yang //
translated: Even if the cause is analyzed in a hundred ways,üîΩit is still not different.

original: tha dad par ro zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad yin pas mi dmigs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par ro zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad yin pas mi dmigs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is ridiculous, and so it is shown to be unobservable.

original: snang ba'i rnam shes nye bar len pa nyid rnam shes yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam shes nye bar len pa nyid rnam shes yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The apprehension of the appearance is itself consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown by the phrase ‚Äúconsciousness that is similar or dissimilar.‚Äù

original: rtsva mchog gi rtse mo na glang po che brgya bzhin du 'o ma la ma mthong ba'i zho khas len pa dang 'dra ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtsva mchog gi rtse mo na glang po che brgya bzhin du 'o ma la ma mthong ba'i zho khas len pa dang 'dra ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is like the assertion of milk in the tip of a blade of ku≈õa grass, where there are only a hundred elephants.

original: zho sogs rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zho sogs rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown by the phrase ‚Äúof milk, etc.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyis ni yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gzhan no /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyis ni yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gzhan no /
translated: By another nature means by a nature that is different from the nature of apprehending objects.

original: des de nyid yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: des de nyid yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of the object-possessor.

original: @323a * // rnam shes las zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin pa las so //
analyzed: @323a * // rnam shes las zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin pa las so //
translated: From consciousness means from the nature of the object-possessor.

original: 'du byed mngon phyogs pa ni mkhas pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mngon phyogs pa ni mkhas pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The formative forces that are directed toward it are skill in the arts, etc.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa bon las byung ba yang slar yang rtsa ba las 'phros pa'i rim gyis rtsa ba las skyes pa gzhan las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa bon las byung ba yang slar yang rtsa ba las 'phros pa'i rim gyis rtsa ba las skyes pa gzhan las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not so means that what arises from the seed is not different from what arises from the root, etc.

original: de'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu'i dbye bas byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu'i dbye bas byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the immediately preceding condition is the cause of the effect by way of its division,

original: bar du chod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bar du chod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by way of an interruption.

original: rnam par shes pa las zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid las so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid las so //
translated: From consciousness means from the nature of the object-possessor.

original: re zhig 'byung ba rnams kyi so so ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig 'byung ba rnams kyi so so ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The individual is not the cause of the elements, because the elements are not desire, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa med kyang shing dang rdo ba la sogs pa'i 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa med kyang shing dang rdo ba la sogs pa'i 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Even in the absence of desire, etc., the elements such as earth, etc., are seen in trees, stones, etc.

original: lus kyang rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyang rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The body is not the cause of the elements,üîΩbecause the elements are not the body.

original: de yod kyang res 'ga' med pa'i phyir dang / 'tsho ba yang btang snyoms kyi dus na de med kyang 'byung ba'i ngo bo mthong ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: de yod kyang res 'ga' med pa'i phyir dang / 'tsho ba yang btang snyoms kyi dus na de med kyang 'byung ba'i ngo bo mthong ba'i phyir la /
translated: And even if life is absent when it is indifferent, the nature of its arising is seen.

original: de nyid kyis na 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya ma yin te /
translated: For that very reason, it is not produced by mere elements,

original: snga na med pa'i sems can 'byung ba sngon du 'gro ba las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i sems can 'byung ba sngon du 'gro ba las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: because it does not arise from the prior arising of sentient beings who did not exist previously.

original: de lta na shing la sogs pa bzhin du lus yongs su gyur pa yang 'tsho ba na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes nges pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na shing la sogs pa bzhin du lus yongs su gyur pa yang 'tsho ba na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes nges pa med par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, like trees and so on, the transformation of the body is not definite, since it is like the body that possesses attachment and so on when it is alive.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis nges pa la khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis nges pa la khyab pa yin la /
translated: Since it is certain that the nature of something is pervasive,

original: rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid ni de dang 'gal ba yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid ni de dang 'gal ba yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: and that which is not its nature is pervaded by the opposite of that, the pervasion is taught to be contradictory:

original: snga na med pa 'byung ba la //
analyzed: snga na med pa 'byung ba la //
translated: The arising of that which did not exist previously

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is not definite.

original: gal te 'jig rten pha rol tu 'byung ba nges pa can du khas mi len /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pha rol tu 'byung ba nges pa can du khas mi len /
translated: If the arising of sentient beings in other worlds is not definitely accepted,üîΩthen the arising of sentient beings in this world is also not definite.

original: 'byung bar rtogs pa yang med pa'i phyir ji ltar nges pa yin zhes rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung bar rtogs pa yang med pa'i phyir ji ltar nges pa yin zhes rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: Since there is no realization of an element, how can there be ascertainment?

original: gal te 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is a world beyond,

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod na skye ba snga ma las byung ba'i sred pa la sogs pa'i nges pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod na skye ba snga ma las byung ba'i sred pa la sogs pa'i nges pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then since craving, etc. would be ascertained as arising from a previous birth,

original: nges pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: there would be no uncertainty.

original: zhes bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: To show that this is not so, he says,

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen, etc. ‚Äù

original: ci las she na /
analyzed: ci las she na /
translated: From what?

original: sred pa nyid yod pa'i srog chags skye ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: sred pa nyid yod pa'i srog chags skye ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since craving is the life of a living being who is born,

original: srid pa nyid rgyu yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: srid pa nyid rgyu yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: existence is the cause.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus,

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: since it is the cause of a world beyond,

original: skye ba can 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags can nyid skye ba yin zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba can 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags can nyid skye ba yin zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: one who is born would not be free from attachment. This is the ascertainment that one who is born is attached.

original: 'byung ba tsam gyi bdag nyid ni 'dod chags ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam gyi bdag nyid ni 'dod chags ma yin no //
translated: Attachment is not the nature of mere occurrence.

original: de lta mod kyi lus kyi rnam pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi lus kyi rnam pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The verse says,

original: 'byung ba'i bdag las ma 'das phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag las ma 'das phyir // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it does not go beyond the nature of the elements.

original: @323b kun zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: @323b kun zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to the form of the body.

original: rgyu de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfor that very reason‚Äù means

original: lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the elements that form the body.

original: rgyu la khyad par med na 'bras bu la khyad par med de des khyab pa'i phyir srog chags nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu la khyad par med na 'bras bu la khyad par med de des khyab pa'i phyir srog chags nyid lta bu'o //
translated: If there is no difference in the cause, there is no difference in the effect, because the effect is pervaded by the cause, just as with the nature of a living being.

original: 'on te lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba rnams las 'dod chags la sogs pa phul du byung bas rjes su dpag pa'i phul du byung ba dang / 'dod chags nyid mtshungs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'on te lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba rnams las 'dod chags la sogs pa phul du byung bas rjes su dpag pa'i phul du byung ba dang / 'dod chags nyid mtshungs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: But if you think that there is no difference between the form of the body and the elements, because the difference in the effect is due to the difference in the cause, and the difference in the cause is due to the difference in the seed, and the difference in the seed is due to the difference in the karma, and the difference in the karma is due to the difference in the mental afflictions, and the difference in the mental afflictions is due to the difference in the object, and the difference in the object is due to the difference in the elements, and the difference in the elements is due to the difference in the cause, and the difference in the cause is due to the difference in the effect, then the verse says,

original: gal te 'byung 'chad las min na //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'byung 'chad las min na // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not from the elements.

original: lus kyi rnam pa can rnams kyi srog chags nyid la 'bras bu'i khyad par med pa yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa can rnams kyi srog chags nyid la 'bras bu'i khyad par med pa yin te /
translated: The nature of a living being is not different in the form of the body.

original: de tsam pa bskyed bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam pa bskyed bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the products of that much.üîΩBut attachment and so on are not like that, so they are not the products of that much.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir de tsam gyi bskyed bya ma yin pas khyad par gyi rim pa skye bar byed par rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir de tsam gyi bskyed bya ma yin pas khyad par gyi rim pa skye bar byed par rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: The order of the distinctions is understood to be the order in which they arise.

original: de yang de ltar rtogs pa ni de zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: de yang de ltar rtogs pa ni de zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: And that is understood in the following way: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the elements that are the form of the body.

original: de 'gyur ba las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de 'gyur ba las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid las so //
translated: From their transformation, attachment and so on arise.

original: med par byed pa las ni 'dor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: med par byed pa las ni 'dor bar byed pa'o //
translated: From their removal, they are removed.

original: ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las yin zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of that?

original: phul byung 'grib par ldan te phul du byung ba dang ldan pa yang gang tshe 'grib pa dang ldan pa yang gang tshe 'grib pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis skyed byed ma yin pa de'i tshe 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: phul byung 'grib par ldan te phul du byung ba dang ldan pa yang gang tshe 'grib pa dang ldan pa yang gang tshe 'grib pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis skyed byed ma yin pa de'i tshe 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: When the excellent is associated with decline, and when the excellent is associated with decline, it is not the producer. At that time, there is freedom from attachment. This is the meaning.

original: // snga na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gsum gyi bsdus pa'i don to /
analyzed: // snga na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gsum gyi bsdus pa'i don to /
translated: The meaning of the half-verse beginning with ‚Äúnever before‚Äù is summarized.üîΩIt is taught by the verse beginning with ‚Äúattachment, etc., are not determined.

original: chags sogs nges med ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chags sogs nges med ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúAttachment and so on are not ascertained‚Äù teaches this.üîΩ

original: ji srid srog chags ma yin pa //
analyzed: ji srid srog chags ma yin pa //
translated: As long as there is no living being,

original: zhes bya ba ni shing la sogs pa'i bye brag khyad par gyi rim pa tha dad pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shing la sogs pa'i bye brag khyad par gyi rim pa tha dad pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: means that there is a different kind of gradation of distinctions, such as trees, etc.

original: tha dad pa ni khyad par gyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni khyad par gyi rim pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù means a different kind of gradation.

original: tha dad pa la yang ni 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba dang ldan pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: tha dad pa la yang ni 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba dang ldan pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn different‚Äù means in that which has decrease and increase.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i mtshungs pa'i bdag nyid ni spyi'i rgyu nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i mtshungs pa'i bdag nyid ni spyi'i rgyu nyid yin la /
translated: The identity of the cause of attachment, etc., is the general cause.

original: de mi ldog pa ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi ldog pa ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its non-cessation is because of its permanence.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is the meaning that attachment, etc., are not exhausted.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i khyad par med na spyi ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i khyad par med na spyi ji ltar yin /
translated: If there is no distinction in the cause of attachment, etc., how can there be a general cause?

original: rgyud gzhan la yod pa ni rgyud gzhan la 'dod chags kyi rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la yod pa ni rgyud gzhan la 'dod chags kyi rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: And the cause of attachment in another continuum is not asserted to be in another continuum.

original: brjod pa 'dod chags ni lus kyi rnam pa kho na'i 'byung ba las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: brjod pa 'dod chags ni lus kyi rnam pa kho na'i 'byung ba las byung ba yin la /
translated: Attachment is said to arise from the primary elements that are the form of the body.

original: de nyid rgyu'i spyi yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid rgyu'i spyi yin par brjod do //
translated: And that is said to be the general cause.

original: de la yod na 'dod chags 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'byung ba'i bdag las ma 'das @324a * //
analyzed: de la yod na 'dod chags 'byung ba'i phyir ro // 'byung ba'i bdag las ma 'das @324a * //
translated: Because attachment arises when it exists.

original: phyir ; / zhes dogs par gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyir ; / zhes dogs par gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that the primary elements are not transcended?

original: bden mod kyi byung ba tsam las 'dod chags yin la /
analyzed: bden mod kyi byung ba tsam las 'dod chags yin la /
translated: That is true, but attachment is from the mere primary elements.

original: de phul du yang ba las 'dod chags phul du byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de phul du yang ba las 'dod chags phul du byung ba yin gyi /
translated: And attachment is superior when they are superior.

original: de med pa las ni 'byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de med pa las ni 'byung ba ma yin la /
translated: But it does not arise when they do not exist.

original: 'dod chags tsam ni 'byung ba tsam las byung ba yin zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no ;
analyzed: 'dod chags tsam ni 'byung ba tsam las byung ba yin zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no ;
translated: The difference is that mere attachment arises from mere primary elements.

original: /'dra ba'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba tsam las so //
analyzed: /'dra ba'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba tsam las so //
translated: The cause of similarity is from the mere primary elements that are the form of the body.

original: mtshungs pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba tsam du'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba tsam du'o //
translated: Similarity is mere primary elements.

original: 'byung ba la khyad par med kyang khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin gyi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba la khyad par med kyang khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin gyi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Although there is no difference in the elements, it is the effect of something else that has a difference, and it is not the effect of the elements.üîΩThis is taught by ‚ÄúIf. . .

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means:üîΩ

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i khyad par la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i khyad par la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn what‚Äù refers to the difference in the arising.

original: mtshungs pa las zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya nyid las so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa las zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya nyid las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the similar‚Äù means from the mere arising that is to be produced.

original: 'di nyid kyis dpe bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis dpe bstan pa ni /
translated: This very thing is taught by the example.

original: ba lag gi shes pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩba lang gi shes pa ni mtshungs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ba lang nyid las sam /
analyzed: ba lag gi shes pa zhes bya ba'o // ba lang gi shes pa ni mtshungs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ba lang nyid las sam /
translated: ‚ÄúThe consciousness of the cow‚Äù is stated.

original: ba lang ma yin pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The consciousness of the cow is from the cow itself, which is similar, or from the elements that are not different in arising from the cow, etc.üîΩThe teaching that there is no difference in the elements is ‚ÄúHere also. . .

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here also means in this context.

original: gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya'i srog chags nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i yul 'di la 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya srog chags nyid la khyad par med pa'i phyir dpe gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya'i srog chags nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i yul 'di la 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya srog chags nyid la khyad par med pa'i phyir dpe gzhan yin no //
translated: The example is different in this case, because the mere elements that are produced are not different in the living being that is produced.

original: 'jig rten rgyang ban pa'i lta ba la ltos nas gnas skabs kyi dpe yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang ban pa'i lta ba la ltos nas gnas skabs kyi dpe yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the example is only in terms of the present situation, in relation to the view of the Lokayatas.

original: chad par yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan med par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chad par yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan med par dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Also in the case of annihilation‚Äù means that it is intended that there is no other position.

original: khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa'i chos ni chos can yod na shin tu ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa'i chos ni chos can yod na shin tu ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: A property that has a particular order is not completely absent when the subject is present.

original: me yod pa kho na yin na dro ba nyid ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa ni shin tu med pas khyab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me yod pa kho na yin na dro ba nyid ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa ni shin tu med pas khyab pa ma yin te /
translated: Because heat is not absent when fire is present, a property that has a particular order is not completely absent.

original: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The idea is that it is not pervaded by complete absence, because it exists even when that is absent.

original: dro rim khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dro rim khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the order of heat.

original: chos can gnas na khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa gang yin par de ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: chos can gnas na khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa gang yin par de ldog pa yin te /
translated: If the subject is present, then it is qualified by the presence of the property.

original: de de la res 'ga' snga na med pa yang yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de de la res 'ga' snga na med pa yang yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If it is absent, then it is qualified by the absence of the property.

original: de bzhin du dro ba nyid ni me yod na ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dro ba nyid ni me yod na ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, heat is not absent when fire is present.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not,

original: de med na me nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na me nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were absent, fire itself would be absent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir me las dro ba'i tha dad pa bkag pas tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir me las dro ba'i tha dad pa bkag pas tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid du brjod pa yin te /
translated: For this very reason, the difference of heat from fire is refuted, and they are said to be the object of the convention of nondifference.

original: nges pa dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa dag kho na tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i yul nyid rtogs par bstan pa ni min /
analyzed: nges pa dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa dag kho na tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i yul nyid rtogs par bstan pa ni min /
translated: The mere fact that the presence and absence of a definite object are the object of the cognition of nondifference is not taught.

original: dro las me zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dro las me zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúheat is called fire‚Äù

original: thams @324b cad snga na yang yod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams @324b cad snga na yang yod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: is to be supplied with the words ‚Äúis not present prior to all.‚Äù

original: lus la tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus yod kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus yod kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the difference in the body‚Äù means because the body exists and does not exist.

original: de bzhin du me yod kyang dro ba med pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du me yod kyang dro ba med pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Likewise, where there is fire, there is heat.

original: 'dir me ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir me ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, fire is the example.

original: 'di nyid me ma yin zhes bya ba nyid kyi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid me ma yin zhes bya ba nyid kyi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äújust‚Äù is applied in a different order:

original: lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba nyid yal bar 'dug pa'i gnas skabs na 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa ni mi 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba nyid yal bar 'dug pa'i gnas skabs na 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa ni mi 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúJust this is not fire.‚Äù It is not the case that when the elements in the form of the body are in a state of inactivity, there is no passion, etc.

original: de bzhin du thal ba'i gnas skabs su dro ba med pa na me yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du thal ba'i gnas skabs su dro ba med pa na me yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Likewise, where there is no heat in the state of ashes, there is no fire.üîΩIf it is argued that the state of ashes is not fire because the elements have been destroyed,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the state of ashes is not the elements, because the elements have been destroyed.

original: gal te 'byung ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is argued that the state of ashes is the elements because it is a transformation of the elements,

original: rgyun chad pa nyid snga na med par ma 'khrul pa yin par thal bar 'gyur grang na /üîΩ'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya bar bzlog par go bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa nyid snga na med par ma 'khrul pa yin par thal bar 'gyur grang na /üîΩ'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya bar bzlog par go bar bya ba'o //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that the state of ashes is fire because it is a transformation of fire.

original: dro ba nyid la mi 'khrul pa can gyi chos can ni me yin gyi de bzhin du 'bar ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dro ba nyid la mi 'khrul pa can gyi chos can ni me yin gyi de bzhin du 'bar ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The subject that is nonerroneous with respect to heat is fire, but it is not just mere blazing.üîΩThe text says:

original: sngags rgyud la sogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngags rgyud la sogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The power of mantras, etc.

original: dro ba la mi 'khrul pa can gyi 'bar ba ni de med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir 'bar ba yod kyang khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa'i dro ba nyid med pa ma yin na gang gis snga na yang med par rtogs par 'gyur zhes bstan
analyzed: dro ba la mi 'khrul pa can gyi 'bar ba ni de med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir 'bar ba yod kyang khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa'i dro ba nyid med pa ma yin na gang gis snga na yang med par rtogs par 'gyur zhes bstan
translated: Since blazing that is nonerroneous with respect to heat does not exist without it, even if blazing exists, heat that possesses a special stage does not not exist.üîΩThe text says:

original: pa ni / 'bar ba las zhes bya ba ste /üîΩphyi 'bral bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: pa ni / 'bar ba las zhes bya ba ste / phyi 'bral bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: From blazing.

original: snga na yang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga na yang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúprior to‚Äù is that it is not separated.

original: sngags la sogs pa'i nus pas dro ba nyid med kyang 'bar ba yod pa yin na /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa'i nus pas dro ba nyid med kyang 'bar ba yod pa yin na /
translated: If heat does not exist due to the power of mantras, etc., but blazing exists,

original: 'on te 'bar ba de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'bar ba de gang yin zhe na /
translated: then what is that blazing?

original: dbyibs dang kha dog yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The shape and color of that are taught.üîΩThe text says:

original: mdog dang dbyibs kyi 'bar ba'o //üîΩzhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: mdog dang dbyibs kyi 'bar ba'o //üîΩzhes bya ba'o /
translated: Blazing is color and shape.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs su 'gyur ba de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs su 'gyur ba de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How could it be that color and shape change?

original: dro ba nyid yod pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
analyzed: dro ba nyid yod pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause heat does not exist‚Äù should be supplied.

original: / dpe ma yin zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid mthong bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / dpe ma yin zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid mthong bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not an example‚Äù shows that the reason is not ascertained in the dissimilar instances.

original: byung ba byung nas 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: byung ba byung nas 'jig pa yin la /
translated: The meaning is that when a thing arises, it perishes,

original: snga na yang res 'ga' ma byung bar rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga na yang res 'ga' ma byung bar rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and it is understood that it did not exist previously.

original: sngags dang rgyud sogs zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni 'bar ba ni dro ba med par mi 'byung la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud sogs zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni 'bar ba ni dro ba med par mi 'byung la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The commentary on the phrase ‚Äúmantra, tantra, etc.‚Äù is supplied by the phrase ‚Äúbecause a fire does not occur without heat.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is change.

original: dro ba la zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni gtan mi bral ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dro ba la zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni gtan mi bral ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the phrase ‚Äúheat‚Äù is supplied by the phrase ‚Äúbecause it is never separated from it.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir khyad par dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni byung ba byung nas zhig pa ni khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa yin la snga na yang kha cig tu gtan med par yin pa ni bsgrub bya yin zhes bya ba'i @325a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni byung ba byung nas zhig pa ni khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa yin la snga na yang kha cig tu gtan med par yin pa ni bsgrub bya yin zhes bya ba'i @325a * //
translated: The meaning is that it is the thesis that it is also nonexistent prior to that.

original: don to // khyad par rim pa dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: don to // khyad par rim pa dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The sequence of distinctions is connected with the possession of qualities.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de rnams med kyang 'byung ba de med kyang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de rnams med kyang 'byung ba de med kyang 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù means that it arises even though they do not exist.

original: de khyad par ni de'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de khyad par ni de'i khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIts distinction‚Äù means the distinction of that.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni spyi'i chos can du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni spyi'i chos can du bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which‚Äù indicates a general property.

original: khyad par ni dbye ba yin la /
analyzed: khyad par ni dbye ba yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúDistinction‚Äù means division.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan de rnams la lar chad pa ni snga na med pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan de rnams la lar chad pa ni snga na med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSometimes‚Äù means that those qualities are sometimes interrupted, that is, nonexistent prior to that.

original: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan bzhin du nag po la sogs pa'i yon tan yin na /
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan bzhin du nag po la sogs pa'i yon tan yin na /
translated: If they are qualities such as black, etc., like qualities such as white, etc.,

original: dkar po dang shin tu dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dkar po dang shin tu dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: It is not endowed with the qualities of white and extremely white, and so on.üîΩThat which pervades manifest and unmanifest phenomena is the subject.

original: mngon par gyur pa dang mi mngon par gyur pa'i chos can rnams la rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa de chos can yin zhes bya ba'i rigs pas chos can yod pa na khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan rang nyid kho na ldog pa
analyzed: mngon par gyur pa dang mi mngon par gyur pa'i chos can rnams la rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa de chos can yin zhes bya ba'i rigs pas chos can yod pa na khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan rang nyid kho na ldog pa
translated: Since the subject exists, the qualities endowed with a hierarchy of distinctions are themselves reversed.

original: yin na / kha cig tu snga na yang rang nyid kho na med pa yin te /
analyzed: yin na / kha cig tu snga na yang rang nyid kho na med pa yin te /
translated: But if they did not exist before, they would not exist by themselves.

original: de la dbang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: de la dbang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that they are not independent.

original: ji ltar dro ba nyid kho na me yin pa de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa kho na sa la sogs pa lta bu yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar dro ba nyid kho na me yin pa de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa kho na sa la sogs pa lta bu yin na /
translated: If heat alone is fire, and white, etc., alone are earth, etc.,

original: de log na ldog pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de log na ldog pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: then when they are reversed, they are reversed alone.

original: de la dkar po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la dkar po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of that is that white, etc., are earth, etc.

original: de lta yin na lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang blo dang dbyibs la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yon tan ma yin te /üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang 'jig pa yin yang lus so lus so zhes bya ba'i shes pa rab tu 'jug pas rjes su 'jug pa ni chos can yin gyi dro ba med pa la ni de lta bu'i shes pa'i yul rjes su 'jug pa niüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang blo dang dbyibs la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yon tan ma yin te / 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang 'jig pa yin yang lus so lus so zhes bya ba'i shes pa rab tu 'jug pas rjes su 'jug pa ni chos can yin gyi dro ba med pa la ni de lta bu'i shes pa'i yul rjes su 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the elements that are the body‚Äôs form would not be the qualities of attachment, etc., because they are not attachment, etc., nor are they the qualities of attachment, etc.,

original: gzhan la dkar po nyid la sogs pa ldog pa yin yang dngos po gzhan 'byung bas reg bya la sogs pa'i ngo bo rjes su 'jug par bstan pa ni /üîΩsnam bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde med kyang zhes bya ba ni nag po'i ngo bor gyur na dkar po nyid med pa'o //üîΩdes na zhes bya ba ni de dag la bstod pa brjod pa yin no //

original: 'byung ba 'gyur ba ma yin yang //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'gyur ba ma yin yang //
translated: But the elements are not changeable.

original: 'gyur pa can ni de la dbang med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gyur pa can ni de la dbang med pa yin la /
translated: The changeable is not independent of them.

original: de yod kyang kha cig tu 'byung ba ma yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de yod kyang kha cig tu 'byung ba ma yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: But even when it exists, it is not present everywhere.

original: me tha dad pa yin na yang dro ba ni khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: me tha dad pa yin na yang dro ba ni khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Even though fire is different from heat, heat has a gradation of intensity.

original: de yod na gtan ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod na gtan ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: When it exists, it is not absent.

original: de las dbye ba med pas lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las dbye ba med pas lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not separate from that, it arises and ceases simultaneously with it.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa lus las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa lus las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, attachment, etc., are not nondifferent from the body,

original: @325b de yod kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @325b de yod kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not present when the body is.

original: de'i phyir lus 'ga' ni 'dod chags dang bral bar yang 'gyur te /üîΩdbye ba dang ldan pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus 'ga' ni 'dod chags dang bral bar yang 'gyur te / dbye ba dang ldan pa nyid yin na /
translated: Therefore, the body sometimes becomes free from attachment,üîΩbecause it has a gradation of intensity,

original: khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gos la tshon bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gos la tshon bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: like a cloth that is being dyed.

original: gzugs sogs bzhin du nges min te //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin du nges min te //
translated: It is not definite like form, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: The verse says:

original: yang na / me nyid rjes su 'jug pa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na / me nyid rjes su 'jug pa ni // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Fire is the follower.

original: yang na dkar po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba chad kyang gdon mi za bar gzhan zhig tu 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na dkar po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba chad kyang gdon mi za bar gzhan zhig tu 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Or else, even if any white, etc., color is cut off, it becomes something else without a doubt.

original: de bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: So too, attachment, etc., will be.

original: gzugs sogs bzhin du nges min te //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin du nges min te // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But they are not ascertained like form, etc.

original: nges pa ni gang yang rung ba med kyang gang yang rung bar 'byung ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni gang yang rung ba med kyang gang yang rung bar 'byung ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Ascertained means that even if any one does not exist, any one arises.

original: ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las yin zhe na /
translated: From what?

original: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: They are form, etc.

original: 'byung ba las ni lus kyi rnam pa'i las so //
analyzed: 'byung ba las ni lus kyi rnam pa'i las so //
translated: From the elements, there is bodily form-karma.

original: dbyer med phyir ni phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyer med phyir ni phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are inseparable, because they are not mutually absent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa med na 'byung ba rnams ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa med na 'byung ba rnams ma yin la /
translated: If form, etc., does not exist, the elements do not exist.

original: de rnams kyang de rnams med na ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang de rnams med na ma yin no //
translated: And they do not exist if those do not exist.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i lus kyang ngo snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i lus kyang ngo snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The thought that the body, which does not arise without attachment, etc., is also like that, is refuted by

original: de mtshungs she na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de mtshungs she na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The same is true of the other defilements.

original: min zhes bya ba ni 'di dgag pa'o //
analyzed: min zhes bya ba ni 'di dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the negation.

original: ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: gang la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lhan cig pa'i yul tsam 'byung ba rnams kyi bskyed pa gang yin pa de thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lhan cig pa'i yul tsam 'byung ba rnams kyi bskyed pa gang yin pa de thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The arising of the mere object of desire, etc. is the arising of the defilements.

original: 'di yang / rgyu ni nye phyir blo rnams kun //
analyzed: 'di yang / rgyu ni nye phyir blo rnams kun //
translated: This is also the case with the following:

original: thams cad tshe na skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad tshe na skye bar 'gyur //
translated: All cognitions arise at all times,üîΩbecause the cause is present.

original: zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i don la dgongs nas lhan cig rnams lus dang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i don la dgongs nas lhan cig rnams lus dang ngo //
translated: With regard to the meaning of the above verse, the author of the commentary says: ‚ÄúThe arising of the defilements is the arising of the body and the defilements together.‚Äù

original: skye ba ni gnas skabs kyi yod pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba ni gnas skabs kyi yod pa ste /
translated: Arising is the existence of a state.üîΩThe arising of the defilements is the arising of the body and the defilements together.

original: de thal bar 'gyur ba de lus dang lhan cig yod par nges pas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de thal bar 'gyur ba de lus dang lhan cig yod par nges pas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don du bshad pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the above verse is explained as follows:

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The defilements arise at all times.

original: thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa la sogs pa bsgom pas yal bar 'dug pa yod pa na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa la sogs pa bsgom pas yal bar 'dug pa yod pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt all times‚Äù means when one is indifferent through the cultivation of selflessness, etc.

original: da ni don tha mi dad par mi 'byed pa'i don du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni don tha mi dad par mi 'byed pa'i don du bshad pa ni /
translated: Now, the explanation of the meaning of not being differentiated as a separate meaning:

original: 'byung ba chen po tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is merely the great elements.

original: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa nye ba yin pas lus lhan cig byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa nye ba yin pas lus lhan cig byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since the objects, faculties, etc. are close, aren't they co-producing factors of the body?

original: rnam shes bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu ni yal bar 'dug pa'i gnas skabs na lhan cig byed pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rnam shes bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu ni yal bar 'dug pa'i gnas skabs na lhan cig byed pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Attachment, etc. are not co-producing factors when the state of being a cause is abandoned, like consciousness.

original: yul gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'o// @326a * //
analyzed: yul gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba'o// @326a * //
translated: Because it has an object as its cause.

original: bud med dang skyes pa zhes bya ba 'dis rnam rtog gi rnam shes kyi yul rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa zhes bya ba 'dis rnam rtog gi rnam shes kyi yul rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa yin gyi /
translated: By this woman and man, attachment, etc. are objects of conceptual consciousness.

original: mthong ba tsam rnams la ni ma yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba tsam rnams la ni ma yin la /
translated: They are not mere seeing,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las byung ba rnams yul la brten pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩrnam par rtog pa yul yin phyir //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las byung ba rnams yul la brten pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni / rnam par rtog pa yul yin phyir //
translated: and those arising from the imprints of conceptuality are not dependent on objects.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is a conceptual object.

original: de lta yin na bag chags de'i skye gnas bdag dang bdag gi yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin na bag chags de'i skye gnas bdag dang bdag gi yin la /
translated: If that were so, then the arising and enduring of that latent impression would be the self and that which belongs to the self.

original: nus pa dang lhan cig byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: nus pa dang lhan cig byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The response to the idea that the latent impression is the cause and the power is the cooperative condition is

original: skal mnyam zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skal mnyam zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the statement, ‚ÄúSimilarity is the cause.‚Äù

original: skal mnyam ni 'dra ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i sa bon rgyu yin te /
analyzed: skal mnyam ni 'dra ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i sa bon rgyu yin te /
translated: Similarity is the cause of the seed of improper mentation.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyogs la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyogs la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it does not exist in the position that denies the existence of other worlds.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa lus tsam las byung ba yin na nges pa 'am re rer yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /üîΩnges pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa lus tsam las byung ba yin na nges pa 'am re rer yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni / nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIf attachment and so on arise from the body alone, they would be certain or individual,‚Äù demonstrates that they would be certain or individual.

original: cig car yang 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩthams cad tshe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: cig car yang 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni / thams cad tshe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThey would arise simultaneously,‚Äù demonstrates that they would arise simultaneously.

original: 'dod chags kyi dus su zhe sdang dang de'i dus su 'dod chags su 'gyur ro //üîΩrnam par rtogs pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi dus su zhe sdang dang de'i dus su 'dod chags su 'gyur ro // rnam par rtogs pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThey would arise at all times‚Äù means that attachment would arise at the time of aversion and aversion would arise at the time of attachment.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yi rgyun //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yi rgyun //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe continuum of attachment and so on would not exist,‚Äù demonstrates that they would not exist without conceptualization.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe continuum of attachment and so on would not exist‚Äù demonstrates that they would not exist without conceptualization.

original: gal te yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par lus tsam las 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par lus tsam las 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If the special transformation arises from the body alone,

original: lus bzhin du dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir cig car ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lus bzhin du dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir cig car ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: then it would be simultaneous with the body, because it would endure at all times like the body.üîΩThis is demonstrated in the following:

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so,üîΩthen one would understand that the cause is the effect, or that the cause is the cause of the effect,

original: 'bras bu'i rim pa mthong ba las rgyu 'am rgyu yis rgyu yang rung /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rim pa mthong ba las rgyu 'am rgyu yis rgyu yang rung /
translated: from seeing the sequence of the effect.üîΩThis is what you think.

original: gang yin par yang rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩgang yang rung ba la zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang yin par yang rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni / gang yang rung ba la zhe na zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ra mtshams bcad pas 'di nyid bkag pa yin no //
translated: This is what you think.üîΩThis is what you think.üîΩThis is what you think.üîΩThis is what you think.

analyzed: gang zhig gang la lar thams cad du yod pa de'i rgyu can du dus thams cad du 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /

analyzed: thams cad tshe na 'ang 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
