original: rgyu med pa can thams cad dus thams cad par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: rgyu med pa can thams cad dus thams cad par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: And all that is causeless would not exist at all times,üîΩbecause it is not seen.

original: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'ang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'ang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is stated:

original: 'ga' yang rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' yang rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: No one would have a cause.

original: gal te yang tshul ma yin pa yid la byed pa sa bon du mthong ba bor nas 'dod chags la sogs par nges pa'i rgyu yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yin pa khas len pa yin pa de lta na du ba yang me'i bskyed byar @326b mi 'gyurüîΩba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te yang tshul ma yin pa yid la byed pa sa bon du mthong ba bor nas 'dod chags la sogs par nges pa'i rgyu yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yin pa khas len pa yin pa de lta na du ba yang me'i bskyed byar @326b mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If one accepts that the transformation of the cause of desire and so on is the seed of improper mental attention, then smoke would not be the product of fire.

original: thams cad las 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad las 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that everything is so.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The response that it is not the case that there is no difference in the transformation is stated:

original: me med par yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: me med par yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Even without fire.

original: yul la sogs pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa las kyang ngo //
translated: Smoke is seen from such things as a place.

original: rgyu med pa can las kyang du ba mthong ba'i stobs kyis yul la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ba kho nar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can las kyang du ba mthong ba'i stobs kyis yul la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ba kho nar bstan pa ni /
translated: The response that it is definitely ascertained that smoke arises from fire, not from such things as a place, is stated:

original: dngos po rgyu med pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po rgyu med pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even without a cause.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu thams cad pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu thams cad pa'am /
translated: Likewise, desire and so on are not the cause of the body,

original: rgyu med pa yang rung /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yang rung /
translated: nor are they causeless.

original: lus kyi rgyu can ma yin pa yang nges pa ni yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las sam mthong ba las 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu can ma yin pa yang nges pa ni yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las sam mthong ba las 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that they are not definitely the cause of the body, but arise from the transformation of the body or from seeing.

original: lus kyi rgyu can ni mthong ba'i rgyu thams cad nyid dam rgyu med pa nyid dam rung ba ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu can ni mthong ba'i rgyu thams cad nyid dam rgyu med pa nyid dam rung ba ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the cause of seeing is either all the causes of the body or it is causeless, or it is not seen as suitable?

original: nges pa can ni yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par tsam ma mthong ba yin yang de ni gcig tu ma mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa can ni yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par tsam ma mthong ba yin yang de ni gcig tu ma mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is not seen that the cause of seeing is merely the transformation of the body, it is not that it is not seen at all.

original: ma mthong ba'i lus las ma log pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i lus las ma log pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Because it is not the case that the body is not seen as the cause of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i brtag bya rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩrgyu nyid du'ang khyad par med par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i brtag bya rnam pa gnyis te / rgyu nyid du'ang khyad par med par 'gyur grang na /
translated: The object of seeing is twofold:üîΩIf it is not seen that the cause of seeing is not different from the cause of the body,

original: gal te khyad par med pa mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par med pa mthong ba yin na /
translated: then if it is seen that it is not different,

original: lus kyi rgyu can nyid kyang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu can nyid kyang mi 'grub ste /
translated: the body is not established as its cause.

original: rang rig pas rgyu dang rgyu can dang / bdag dang gzhan dang / rim pa gcig dang cig shos ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang rig pas rgyu dang rgyu can dang / bdag dang gzhan dang / rim pa gcig dang cig shos ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because of self-awareness, there is no distinction between cause and effect, self and other, and the one and the other.

original: mthong ba tsam la rten byed na //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam la rten byed na //
translated: This is indicated by ‚ÄúIf you rely on mere seeing.

original: zhes bya ba'o// 'on te rgyu nyid du mthong na rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i khyad par gyis rang rig pas rgyu dang de dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha snyad kyi ming can yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o// 'on te rgyu nyid du mthong na rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i khyad par gyis rang rig pas rgyu dang de dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha snyad kyi ming can yin la /
translated: ‚Äù But if you see them as causes, then the conceptual thought of cause and effect, etc., which is designated by the conventional name, is established by self-awareness through the distinction of positive and negative concomitance.

original: des rgyu nyid la sogs pa grub pa yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: des rgyu nyid la sogs pa grub pa yin pa de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa'i rgyu can 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams yin gyi lus kyi rgyu can ni ma yin te /üîΩde ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa'i rgyu can 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams yin gyi lus kyi rgyu can ni ma yin te / de ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: then desire, etc., which are the cause of the attachment that grasps at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine, ‚Äù are not the cause of the body,

original: tha snyad 'jig par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad 'jig par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is not understood in that way. This is indicated by ‚ÄúThe conventional is destroyed.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'dor bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'dor bar nus pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that it is not possible to abandon it.

original: skye ba'i dang po la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu lus ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i dang po la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu lus ni /
translated: The first of the two types of birth is the body that is the cause of desire and so on.

original: rang rig pa las byung ba'i rtog par rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang rig pa las byung ba'i rtog par rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: In the first place, is it not realized that the body, the cause of desire and so on, arises from self-awareness?üîΩIt is not the case that the attachment to the past self and mine is the cause.

original: 'das pa'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa rgyu nyid ma yin snyam du sems pa ni dper na kha cig tu me'i rgyu rkyen nyid du du ba mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'das pa'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa rgyu nyid ma yin snyam du sems pa ni dper na kha cig tu me'i rgyu rkyen nyid du du ba mthong ba yin la /
translated: It is like the case where someone sees smoke as the cause and condition of fire,

original: ma mthong yang de'i rgyu nyid du rig pa yin la de bzhin du 'di la yang blta bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong yang de'i rgyu nyid du rig pa yin la de bzhin du 'di la yang blta bar bya ba yin te /
translated: and even though it is not seen, it is known to be its cause. In the same way, this should be seen here.

original: de ltar nges par gnas pa'i phyir @327a * //
analyzed: de ltar nges par gnas pa'i phyir @327a * //
translated: Because it is ascertained in that way.

original: zhes bstan pa ni //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni //
translated: The teaching on that is:

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yis //
translated: As it is inferred,

original: tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is called a convention.

original: med na mi 'byung bar khyab pa can ni mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma mthong ba bzhin du mthong ba la yang rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung bar khyab pa can ni mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma mthong ba bzhin du mthong ba la yang rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since the pervasion of not occurring without is not a matter of direct perception, just as it is not seen, is inference also not a valid cognition in seeing?

original: de'i tshad ma nyid de tsam rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshad ma nyid de tsam rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The reason for this is that the valid knowledge that ascertains that is based on that alone.

original: tha dad shes dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha dad shes dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To the one who thinks this, it is said, ‚ÄúThe consciousness that is different‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i rang rig pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rtogs bya med na mi 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i rang rig pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rtogs bya med na mi 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The object of the conception that arises from reflexive awareness, which possesses the property of being concomitant with forward and reverse entailment, is not arisen without that.

original: de'i rtogs bya kho na yin no zhes mngon par 'dod pa yin pa khas mi len na /
analyzed: de'i rtogs bya kho na yin no zhes mngon par 'dod pa yin pa khas mi len na /
translated: If one does not accept that the object of that is only that,

original: khyad par med pa'i bdag nyid rig pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i bdag nyid rig pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: then it is mere awareness that has the nature of being without distinction.

original: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang 'dzin pa dang sngon po dang cig shos la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba med pa yin na /üîΩcis rnam par 'byed pa yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang 'dzin pa dang sngon po dang cig shos la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba med pa yin na / cis rnam par 'byed pa yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If there is no division of that into the categories of apprehended object and apprehending subject, blue and its other,üîΩthen how is it divided?

original: des na tha snyad dbye bar ni //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na tha snyad dbye bar ni // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation is, ‚ÄúTherefore, it is divided conventionally‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rang rig pa las 'dis phyis dpog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang rig pa las 'dis phyis dpog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is inferred later from reflexive awareness,

original: rjes su dpag pa yin pa de las te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yin pa de las te /
translated: it is inference.

original: rang gi 'dod pa tsam las byung ba'i rnam rtog las tha snyad byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa tsam las byung ba'i rnam rtog las tha snyad byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the conventional is not made from a conceptual thought that arises from one‚Äôs own desire alone.

original: blang ba dang dor ba yongs su rtogs bya'i ngo bo yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa ma yin na ma /
analyzed: blang ba dang dor ba yongs su rtogs bya'i ngo bo yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa ma yin na ma /
translated: If the nature of the object to be understood is not the opposite of that which is to be rejected,üîΩthen how can it be that there is no distinction of direct perception in regard to that?

original: de ji ltar de la mngon sum las dbye ba med pa yin snyam du sems pa la dor bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ji ltar de la mngon sum las dbye ba med pa yin snyam du sems pa la dor bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be rejected‚Äù is stated in response to this thought.

original: sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i lus la gnas pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi yul can gyis mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i lus la gnas pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi yul can gyis mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the body that is the basis for the production of suffering is not understood by direct perception that has an object that is merely one‚Äôs own nature.

original: de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i blang bya bde ba'i sgrub byed yin par rtog par bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i blang bya bde ba'i sgrub byed yin par rtog par bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not taught that the nature of the body that is the basis for the production of suffering is the object of direct perception, and that which is other than that is the object of inference.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be accepted‚Äù is connected with the phrase ‚Äúis not taught.‚Äù

original: ji ltar lus la gnas pa'i ngo bo la mngon sum du mi 'jug pa de ltar spros nas de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar lus la gnas pa'i ngo bo la mngon sum du mi 'jug pa de ltar spros nas de bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as the nature of the body that is the basis for the production of suffering is not engaged by direct perception, in the same way, having elaborated on that, it is taught.

original: blang bya nyid ni yod phyir yang //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /üîΩbde ba sgrub pa yod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: blang bya nyid ni yod phyir yang // zhes bya ba ste / bde ba sgrub pa yod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because that which is to be adopted exists.

original: dor bya nyid la ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ram zhes brtag grang na /
analyzed: dor bya nyid la ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ram zhes brtag grang na /
translated: If you think that the reason is not established, then you should analyze whether the reason is that the establishment of pleasure exists or that the establishment of pain does not exist in that which is to be rejected.

original: dor bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni blang bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa las bzlog pas sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / bde ba sgrub par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dor bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni blang bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa las bzlog pas sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / bde ba sgrub par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The presentation of that which is to be rejected is the opposite of the presentation of that which is to be adopted. Therefore it is established that that which is to be rejected is the establishment of pain and the nonestablishment of pleasure.

original: dor bya las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dor bya las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom that which is to be rejected‚Äù indicates this.

original: re zhig bde ba'i sgrub byed nyid ni bde ba la mngon sum pa ma yin na /
analyzed: re zhig bde ba'i sgrub byed nyid ni bde ba la mngon sum pa ma yin na /
translated: If the establishment of pleasure is not directly perceived in pleasure,

original: dngos po la mngon sum gyi rtogs bya ma yin no zhes bstan pa @327b ni ;üîΩdon byed don du gnyer rnams kyi //
analyzed: dngos po la mngon sum gyi rtogs bya ma yin no zhes bstan pa @327b ni ; don byed don du gnyer rnams kyi //
translated: then it is not an object that is directly perceived in things.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose who seek the purpose of an object‚Äù indicates this.

original: don ni sreg pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa yin la /
analyzed: don ni sreg pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa yin la /
translated: The purpose is the need for burning and so on.

original: byed pa ni byed pa po nyid de /
analyzed: byed pa ni byed pa po nyid de /
translated: The agent is the one who performs the action.

original: blang bya nyid yin la nye ba'i ngo bo'i 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blang bya nyid yin la nye ba'i ngo bo'i 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the object to be taken up, but it is not apprehended by the perception that apprehends the proximate entity.

original: byed pa po nyid ni byed pa po las tha mi dad pa yin gyi de'i 'dzin par gzung ba kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: byed pa po nyid ni byed pa po las tha mi dad pa yin gyi de'i 'dzin par gzung ba kho na ma yin nam /
translated: The agent itself is not different from the action, but isn't its apprehension just the apprehension of that?

original: de lta na yul gyi yang me dang 'brel pa can nyid mngon sum gyis bzung ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yul gyi yang me dang 'brel pa can nyid mngon sum gyis bzung ba kho na yin te /
translated: In that case, the object of fire is also just apprehended by perception, because it is related to fire.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa ci zhig bya //
translated: What inference is there in that case?

original: zhes bzung ba yin yang ma nges par bya ba'i don du rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bzung ba yin yang ma nges par bya ba'i don du rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though it is apprehended, it is inference for the purpose of making it certain.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: nges pa yin yang du ba'i yul las tha dad pas yul gzhan bzhin du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa yin yang du ba'i yul las tha dad pas yul gzhan bzhin du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is certain, the object of smoke does not appear as a different object from fire, because it is not different.

original: de mi snang na de dang 'brel pa can nyid snang ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de mi snang na de dang 'brel pa can nyid snang ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If that does not appear, it is taught that its relation is not apparent:

original: 'byung 'gyur don byed ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur don byed ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The effect and the object to be produced.

original: don byed pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngo bo 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum ni don byed pa'i mngon sum bzhin du rtogs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngo bo 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum ni don byed pa'i mngon sum bzhin du rtogs pa med pa yin te /
translated: The direct perception that apprehends the nature of that which is concomitant with the performance of an object is, like the direct perception of the performance of an object, not a knower.

original: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is because it is not an instigator.

original: 'jug par byed pa nyid ni sgrub byed snang ba can yin te /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa nyid ni sgrub byed snang ba can yin te /
translated: And the instigator itself is that which appears as the probandum.

original: de ni sgrub byed nyid du rtogs par byed par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni sgrub byed nyid du rtogs par byed par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not able to make one understand the probandum itself. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar na blangs bya nyid ni dmigs la /
analyzed: de ltar na blangs bya nyid ni dmigs la /
translated: Thus, the object to be apprehended is the object of observation.

original: bzlog pa dgag pa ni ma mthong ba tsam las mi 'grub par bstan pa ni /üîΩspang bya bkag pa 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa dgag pa ni ma mthong ba tsam las mi 'grub par bstan pa ni / spang bya bkag pa 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The negation of the opposite is not established from mere non-seeing. This is indicated by ‚ÄúThe negation of the object to be refuted as well.‚Äù

original: rtogs 'di mngon sum las ma yin //
analyzed: rtogs 'di mngon sum las ma yin //
translated: ‚ÄúThis understanding is not from direct perception‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of a contradiction.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not from inference‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of an object that is the opposite of the object to be refuted.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not from a reliable cognition other than those‚Äù means that there is no reliable cognition other than direct perception and inference.üîΩ‚ÄúThis understanding is not from direct perception‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of an object that is the opposite of the object to be refuted.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrim gyis 'byung ba'i mngon sum gnyis po 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i rigs pas rang gi dus la yod pa tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrim gyis 'byung ba'i mngon sum gnyis po 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i rigs pas rang gi dus la yod pa tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir ;
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not from inference‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of an object that is the opposite of the object to be refuted.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not from a reliable cognition other than those‚Äù means that there is no reliable cognition other than direct perception and inference.üîΩ‚ÄúThis understanding is not from direct perception‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of an object that is the opposite of the object to be refuted.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not from inference‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of an object that is the opposite of the object to be refuted.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not from a reliable cognition other than those‚Äù means that there is no reliable cognition other than direct perception and inference.üîΩ‚ÄúThis understanding is not from direct perception‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of an object that is the opposite of the object to be refuted.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not from inference‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of an object that is the opposite of the object to be refuted.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not from a reliable cognition other than those‚Äù means that there is no reliable cognition other than direct perception and inference.üîΩ‚ÄúThis understanding is not from direct perception‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of an object that is the opposite of the object to be refuted.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not from inference‚Äù means that there is no apprehension of an object that is the opposite of

original: sgrub byed dang bsgrub ba bya nyid mi 'dzin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub byed dang bsgrub ba bya nyid mi 'dzin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that the probandum and the probans are not apprehended is:

original: mngon sum gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The direct perception of both.üîΩThe illustration of the experience of the nature of the object and its simultaneous occurrence is:üîΩThe nonerroneous direct perception.

original: don byed pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngo bo lan cig ma yin par nyams su myong bar mtshon pa ni 'khrul pa med pa'i mngon sum ni don byed pa med kyang 'jug pa'i yul ma yin nam snyam du sems la gal te shin tu goms pa'i zhes
analyzed: don byed pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngo bo lan cig ma yin par nyams su myong bar mtshon pa ni 'khrul pa med pa'i mngon sum ni don byed pa med kyang 'jug pa'i yul ma yin nam snyam du sems la gal te shin tu goms pa'i zhes
translated: If one thinks that the object of engagement is not without the performance of an object, then it is:üîΩThe extremely habituated.

original: bya ba'o // re zhig don byed pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i goms pa dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'o // re zhig don byed pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i goms pa dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The simultaneous occurrence of the performance of an object is not observed.

original: 'ba' zhig ni snga ma dang mtshan nyid de la dmigs pa med na de la rung bar yang mi 'gyur zheng /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni snga ma dang mtshan nyid de la dmigs pa med na de la rung bar yang mi 'gyur zheng /
translated: If the mere object is not observed, then it is not suitable.

original: nye ba la dmigs pa'i mngon sum ni de nyid dam /
analyzed: nye ba la dmigs pa'i mngon sum ni de nyid dam /
translated: The direct perception that observes the near is:üîΩThat itself.

original: mthong ba nyid kyang ma @328a * //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid kyang ma @328a * //
translated: The seeing is also not understood.

original: rtogs pa yin gyi 'dra ba la ni yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa yin gyi 'dra ba la ni yin no //
translated: It is similar.

original: 'dra ba yang rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba yang rig pa ma yin no //
translated: The similarity is also not known.

original: 'ba' zhig ni snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid gzung ba yang nges par 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid gzung ba yang nges par 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: But the mere fact that the characteristics are not the same as before does not necessarily mean that they are apprehended.

original: de'i phyir de nyid la dran pa ni sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid la dran pa ni sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, memory of that very object is an overextension.

original: 'jug pa yang tha dad pa la lhan cig pa dang lhan cig pa dag tu dmigs pa yin gyi lhan cig pa dmigs pa goms pa yin na lhan cig pa ma yin par dmigs pa ni lhan cig pa la tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang tha dad pa la lhan cig pa dang lhan cig pa dag tu dmigs pa yin gyi lhan cig pa dmigs pa goms pa yin na lhan cig pa ma yin par dmigs pa ni lhan cig pa la tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the operation of the mind is such that it apprehends as simultaneous what is not simultaneous. If it were to apprehend only what is simultaneous, then it would not be a valid means of knowing the nonsimultaneous.

original: gang gi tshe lhan cig pa ma yin pa dang rung ba ma yin pa yang dmigs bzhin pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lhan cig pa ma yin pa dang rung ba ma yin pa yang dmigs bzhin pa yin na /
translated: But when it apprehends what is not simultaneous and what is not suitable to be apprehended,

original: goms pa yang de kho na du bzhin du bzlog pa yin la de goms pas de'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang ; sngon du de'i tshe ngo bo gzung ba la goms pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: goms pa yang de kho na du bzhin du bzlog pa yin la de goms pas de'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang ; sngon du de'i tshe ngo bo gzung ba la goms pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then it is just as if it were to apprehend the opposite of what is familiar. And it is because it is familiar with the apprehension of that object at that time that it apprehends it as having that nature.

original: phan tshun ltos pa yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩma rtogs pa la goms par byed //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa yin par bstan pa ni / ma rtogs pa la goms par byed //
translated: The mutual dependence is shown in the line:

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is familiar with what is not understood.‚Äù

original: don byed pa'i sgrub byed dang dmigs pa rim gyis 'byung ba dag phan tshun mi rigs pas rung ba nyid du nyams su myong ba'i phyir phan tshun bstan par gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don byed pa'i sgrub byed dang dmigs pa rim gyis 'byung ba dag phan tshun mi rigs pas rung ba nyid du nyams su myong ba'i phyir phan tshun bstan par gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The proof of the function and the object that arises in sequence are mutually inconsistent, and because they are experienced as suitable, it is clear that they are mutually taught.

original: mngon sum nyid ni rung ba nyid la sogs pa skyes pa goms pa gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de de lta ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ni rung ba nyid la sogs pa skyes pa goms pa gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de de lta ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Direct perception itself is the result of the arising and habituation of suitability, etc., which is not so.

original: dor ba dang blang bar mthong ba ma yin par bstan pa sdud pa ni /
analyzed: dor ba dang blang bar mthong ba ma yin par bstan pa sdud pa ni /
translated: The summary of the teaching that seeing what is to be rejected and what is to be adopted is not so is:

original: mngon sum tsam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon sum tsam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Just direct perception.

original: tsam smos pa ni /
analyzed: tsam smos pa ni /
translated: Just is stated

original: de'i rjes la 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: in order to eliminate the conceptual thought that arises after that.

original: gal te dor ba de dang blang ba yang mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: gal te dor ba de dang blang ba yang mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa de lta na /
translated: If what is to be rejected and what is to be adopted are not the objects of direct perception, then

original: gang yin pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang yin pa bstan pa ni /
translated: what is taught is:

original: rang gi rang bzhin tsam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin tsam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Just one's own nature.

original: tsam smos pa ni rnam par shes pa rang gi ngo bo yang bsgrub bya'i shes pa la gnas pa'i mngon sum ma yin nam zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tsam smos pa ni rnam par shes pa rang gi ngo bo yang bsgrub bya'i shes pa la gnas pa'i mngon sum ma yin nam zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúmere‚Äù is mentioned in order to indicate that the nature of consciousness itself is not a perception that exists for the consciousness that is the object to be established.

original: de lta yin na gang las dor ba la sogs pa rtogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na gang las dor ba la sogs pa rtogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: If that is the case, then how is the understanding of discarding and so on?

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The term ‚Äúinference‚Äù is mentioned.

original: de dang 'dra ba mthong ba las de'i don bye da'i shes pa'i no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba mthong ba las de'i don bye da'i shes pa'i no //
translated: The knowledge of the object of that is from seeing something similar to it.

original: gnyi ga rig par byed pa ma yin pa'i mngon sum ni 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la mngon sum gnyis po las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas 'brel pa grub pa ni mngon sum du grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga rig par byed pa ma yin pa'i mngon sum ni 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la mngon sum gnyis po las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas 'brel pa grub pa ni mngon sum du grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: Is it not the case that a perception that does not cause the understanding of both does not apprehend a relationship? The establishment of a relationship by a conception that arises from the two perceptions is only the establishment of a perception.

original: tha snyad pa rnams kyis de ltar nges par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams kyis de ltar nges par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because that is how those who use conventions ascertain it.

original: tha snyad 'dogs pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúconventional designation‚Äù is mentioned.

original: rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is a conception.

original: dor bya la sogs pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba ma yin @328b nam ;
analyzed: dor bya la sogs pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba ma yin @328b nam ;
translated: Is it not seen by direct perception that things to be discarded and so on exist?

original: 'di ni khyad par gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is a subject that has specific features.

original: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan sgrub byed ma yin pa lkog tu ma gyur pa la bsams la /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan sgrub byed ma yin pa lkog tu ma gyur pa la bsams la /
translated: However, it is with reference to the nondistinct intrinsic reality that is not established as another, and that is not hidden, that it is said that it is seen by direct perception.
